loans.name: Luz Adriana

texts.es:
Luz Adriana started her used clothing business at a market by her house 5 years ago with only $36 worth of merchandise. Little by little, she noticed that she was making money with this business, and she started to buy and sell a greater quantity of merchandise. The main reason Luz started her business was because the income her husband made working as a chauffer wasn't enough to cover the expenses of their two children, ages 2 and 7, who needed better care and food to be able to grow up healthily.

However, she doesn't have enough merchandise right now for the winter season. This is why Luz is requesting a loan of $475, which she is willing to repay in 6 months, to buy used clothing in bulk in the United States, so she will have new products to offer. With your help, Luz will be able to grow her business and take good care of her family so they don't lack anything.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Hace 5 años que Luz Adriana con sólo US $36 de mercancía comenzó a vender ropa usada en un mercado por su casa. Poco a poco se fue dando cuenta que este negocio sí le dejaba dinero y fue así que comenzó a comprar y vender mayor cantidad de mercancía. La principal razón por la que Luz comenzó su negocio fue porque su esposo quién trabajaba como chofer no le alcanza para poder pagar los gastos de sus dos hijos de 2 y 7 años quienes necesitan de cuidados y alimentación sana para que crezcan saludables.

Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con suficiente mercancía para la temporada de invierno. Es por eso que Luz está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar unas pacas de ropa de segunda en Estados Unidos para poder tener productos nuevos que ofrecer. Con tu ayuda Luz podrá crecer su negocio y así sacar adelante a su familia para que no les falte nada.

loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
8 years ago Angélica started to sell second-hand clothing to her relatives and friends and little by little increased her stock of products so that now she sells new clothing that goes to stuck León Guanajuato México. Angélica began her business because her husband's earnings were not enough to cover the expenses of her 5 children who were then students. Now four of her children are married and only one is still a student.

For this reason Angélica wanted to expand her business so that she could pay the expenses of her youngest child whose school bills were very high. Angélica is requesting a loan of $925 that she is prepared to repay in 1 month. With this money she will be able to buy more products so that she has new articles to offer to her customers. With you help Angélica will be able to help her son to succeed so that he can finish his studies.

Tranlsated from Spanish by a Kiva volutnteer.

Angélica comenzó hace 8 años a vender una paca de ropa de segunda para vender entre sus familiares y amigos y poco a poco fue modificando el repertorio de sus productos hasta lo que hoy vende que es ropa nueva que va a surtir a León Guanajuato México. Angélica comenzó debido a que con lo que gana su esposo no le alcanzaba para pagar los gastos de sus 5 hijos a quienes tenía estudiando. Actualmente cuatro de ellos ya están casados y sólo uno sigue estudiando.

Es por eso que Angélica desea crecer su negocio para poder pagar los gastos de su hijo más pequeño quien tiene muchos gastos en la escuela. Angélica está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 1 mes y con este dinero Angélica podrá comprar más productos para poder tener artículos nuevos para ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Angélica podrá sacar adelante a su hijo para que termine la carrera.

loans.use: To purchase products to meet her orders

loans.name: José Héctor

texts.es:
José Héctor started his business 6 years ago. After his wife unfortunately passed away, José was left with the responsibility of raising and caring for their 8 kids. He hopes to always give them the best so they don't suffer from the absence of their mother. José started selling vegetables, tortillas, milk, and soft drinks, among other things. Little by little, he added more products, up until what he has now.

Nevertheless, José is thinking about expanding his grocery store to have a larger variety so his clients have something from which to choose. José is requesting a credit of $650, which he is willing to repay in 6 months. With this money, he will be able to buy more merchandise and to expand his business so his clients feel at ease in his store and come more often. With your help, José will be able to take good care of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Hace 6 años que José Héctor comenzó su negocio de Abarrotes, después de que desgraciadamente su esposa falleció y se quedó José con la responsabilidad de criar y cuidar a 8 hijos a quienes desea darles siempre lo mejor para que no sufran por la ausencia de su madre. José Comenzó con verduras, tortillas, leche, cocas, entre otras cosas. Poco a poco se fue haciendo de más productos hasta lo que hoy tiene.

Sin embargo José está pensando en ampliar su tienda de abarrotes para poder tener mayor surtido y así que sus clientes puedan tener algo de dónde escoger. José está solicitando un crédito de US $650 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero José podrá comprar más mercancía y ampliar su negocio para que sus clientes se sientan a gusto en el lugar y vayan con mayor frecuencia. Con tu ayuda José podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: To expand his store

loans.name: Abdul Qader

texts.en: Abdul Qader lives in district 6 of Kabul Afghanistan. He is married and lives with his nuclear family for whom he is the breadwinner. He has a video cassette shop, but he is new at this business, so he wants to enlarge his shop and expand his business. For that purpose, he is requesting a small loan to import new original video cassettes from other countries. In this way, he will be able to attract more customers and make more income to help his family have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To import new original video cassettes

loans.name: Claudia Isabel

texts.es:
Claudia had just given birth when she noticed that the income her husband earned at his job wasn't enough to pay for the expenses of their son. This is why she started selling used clothing, to make money to pay for her son's diapers. Little by little, she noticed that having an extra business was a good way to provide for her family. She gradually increased her products, exchanging used clothing for new clothing.

However, she doesn't have enough winter clothing right now to offer her clients. This is why she is requesting a credit of $250, which she is willing to repay in 5 months. With this money, she will be able to purchase more merchandise in Moroleón, Guanajuato, so she'll have new products to offer her clients. With your help, Claudia will be able to get ahead with her business and take care of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Claudia se acababa de aliviar cuando se dio cuenta que con lo que ganaba su esposo en la obra no era suficiente para pagar los gastos que estaba teniendo su hijo. Fue por eso que comenzó a vender ropa usada para poder sacar dinero para los pañales de su hijo. Poco a poco fue dándose cuenta de que teniendo un negocio extra era muy bueno para poder solventar a su familia. Poco a poco fue incrementando en sus productos, cambiando la ropa usada por ropa nueva.

Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con ropa de invierno para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes. Es por eso que Claudia está solicitando un crédito de US $250 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y así con este dinero podrá comprar más mercancía en Moroleón, Guanajuato, para así tener nuevos productos qué ofrecer a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Claudia podrá salir adelante en su negocio y con su familia.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for the winter

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos Morales is a parent to five children. He began making laminate door and windows four years ago with a handful of tools and leasing a local place. Slowly and with good quality in his work he was able to get letters of recommendation and increasing the amount of customers. This was he was able to purchase some space and created his workshop.

Thanks to his enthusiasm, Santos has had numerous requests from clients who are overseas. This helps him improve the quality and quantity of items he has to offer. For this reason he is requesting a loan of $475. He is willing to pay it back in 5 months. With this money he will purchase more raw materials. With your help, you can help him move ahead in his business and offer a college education to all his children.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Santos Morales padre de 5 hijos, comenzó a trabajar fabricando puertas y ventanas de lámina, hace 8 años con un poco de herramienta y rentando un local, poco a poco y con la buena calidad en sus trabajos como carta de recomendación fue haciéndose de clientes. Y así logró adquirir un pequeño terreno para poder poner su pequeño taller.

Gracias a su entusiasmo a Santos le han hecho pedidos del extranjero por cientos, lo cual le ayuda a incrementar la calidad y cantidad de su negocio. Tal es el caso que está pasándole actualmente es por eso que Santos está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero poder comprar materia prima para elaborar sus productos. Con tu ayuda Santos podrá sacar adelante a su negocio y con este poder brindarles educación universitaria a todos sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of  raw materials to build his products

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel Yohane, age 30, is married with 1 child (almost 2 years-old). Samwel owns a fruit and vegetable stand, which he opened 7 years ago. Working from 7am-4pm daily, he earns about $136 a month from this business.

Samwel has successfully taken out 3 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase the business' stock. He now hopes for a new loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

Samwel is a member of group Jitegemee (Swahili for “self-relient”), which totals 30 members. These members keep each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase the stock in his fruit and vegetable stand

loans.name: María De Lourdes

texts.es:
Maria de Lourdes is a single mom of three small children, she cares for them without any support. This is why she works on a daily basis as a laborer. However, the money she makes with this career is not enough to get through with the daily expenses that she has. For this reason she began selling jewelry by catalog to her friends and neighbors during her free time.

However, she currently has some requests that she is not able to fulfill because she doesn't have the capital. This is why Maria is requesting a loan of $700 and hopes to pay it back within 6 months. Her clients will be requesting and purchasing these products and this was she will be able to re-pay. With your help Maria will be able to move ahead in her life and help her three kids.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.>/b>

María de Lourdes es madre soltera de tres pequeños, de quienes se hace cargo totalmente. Es por eso que trabaja diariamente como obrera, sin embargo el dinero que gana con esta profesión no le deja suficiente dinero como para poder solventar los gastos de sus hijos quienes al crecer van necesitando más cosas. Es por eso que comenzó a vender joyería por catálogo a sus compañeros y a sus vecinos. En sus tiempos libres.

Sin embargo actualmente tiene varios pedidos que no a podido surtir por falta de capital, es por eso que María de Lourdes está solicitando un crédito de US $700 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses. Puesto que los clientes que le están pidiendo estos productos son muy buena paga pero ella los cobra en plazos. Con este dinero María podrá comprar los pedidos para poder sacar dinero para los gastos de sus hijos. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar adelante a sus tres hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Mohammad Halam

texts.en: Mohammad Halam lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and lives with his nuclear family for whom he is the sole breadwinner. He runs a china and glassware shop in one of the good areas of Kabul. He started this business two years ago when he left the army. Over the space of these two years, he has formed good relationships with people and attracted many customers. Now he wants to develop his business so he would like to take a small loan to expand his inventory and make good income to help his family whom he dearly loves.

loans.use: To expand his inventory of china, etc.

loans.name: Kosal

texts.en: Mrs. Kosal D., 26, is married and lives with her husband and one school-aged child at Preveng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband run a store in their home selling coffee and soft drinks to the people in their community, earning collectively about US$ 6/day in revenue. This couple would like to request a loan amount of $1200 to expand and invest in their business so that it enables them to meet their clients’ needs and raise their standard of living.

loans.use: To expand and invest in their business so that it enables them to meet their clients’ needs and raise their standard of living.

loans.name: Padi Bali Indah Group

texts.id:
Problems faced by I Made C., I Gede Made S., I Nengah S., I Ketut S., I Nengah D., I Gede Nyoman W., I Wayan S., I Nengah D., I Ketut M., I Gede Made S., I Nengah S., I Nengah Sukabratra dan I Wayan W. in their farming activity are quite similar. Pests caused by rats is the biggest problem happening in their rice farm. They have made many efforts to overcome the problem such as placed striped colored ribbons-similar to grass snake's skin color that rats are frightened- on their rice farms. Also, they grew tadpoles to invite the snakes. They also planned to invest some of the loan on an ultrasonic device - rats can not stand the noise - to evict the rats. The value of the device is Rp 300.000,00.

Translated form Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva volunteer.

Permasalahan yang dihadapi oleh I Made C., I Gede Made S., I Nengah S., I Ketut S., I Nengah D., I Gede Nyoman W., I Wayan S., I Nengah D., I Ketut M., I Gede Made S., I Nengah S., I Nengah Sukabratra dan I Wayan W. sebagai petani tidak jauh berbeda. Hama tikus merupakan masalah yang besar bagi lahan pertanian mereka. Berbagai upaya telah mereka upayakan, antara lain : meletakkan benda yang berwarna belang – seperti warna ular sawah yang ditakuti oleh tikus – di lahan mereka dan memelihara kecebong untuk mengundang kehadiran ular. Mereka juga berencana untuk menginvestasikan sebagian pinjaman mereka untuk alat ultrasonik – tikus tidak tahan mendengar suara ini - guna mengusir tikus senilai Rp 300.000,00.

loans.use: to invest some of the loan on ultrasonic device to evict rats (pests) from rice farms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a used computer to start a website development business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Nyota Njema B Group

texts.en:
Sophia, age 45, is married with 2 children (ages 10 and 4). She owns a clothing business which she began in 2002. Selling clothes from 8am to 4pm daily, she makes a monthly profit of about $106.

Sophia hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will be sharing this loan with subgroup member Beti P., who also sells clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothing stock

loans.name: Ing

texts.en: Mrs. Ing S., 58, is the mother of six children and lives with her husband in Preyveng province, Cambodia. She works renting out wedding clothes, doing make-up, etc., especially the day the wedding party is celebrated, making on average US$ 5 each day. Her husband works hulling rice  and typically makes about US$ 1 each day in profit. One of her children works with her husband; two are employed at a garment factory, two others are mechanics, and the other is a student. Mrs. Ing S. hopes to use this loan to purchase more fashionable wedding dresses to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.use: To purchase more fashionable wedding dresses to meet her clients’ needs

loans.name: Hin

texts.en:
Miss Hin S., 26, is single and lives with her two little sisters and one brother and her grandmother in Preyveng province, Cambodia. To support her entire family, she works as a broker buying food from her area and reselling it in Phnom Penh city earning about US$ 25/day in revenue.Two of her sisters are currently employed at a garment factory and her little brother is a student.

Miss Hin S. has humbly requested a loan to purchase more foodstuffs to meet her customers’ needs and otherwise to invest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more food to meet her customers’ needs and otherwise invest in her business

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah, age 35, is married with 2 children (ages 10 and 3). She owns a clothing business, where she sells clothes from 7am to 2pm daily. She started this business in 2005 and hopes to expand her business over time. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothing stock.

Leah is a member of loan group Nguru Kazi, which totals 36 members. Together, they keep each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy clothing stock

loans.name: In

texts.en:
Mr. In S., 60, is married with three children and lives with his wife and three nephews in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He is employed as a security guard and typically earns around US$ 2 each day, while his wife runs a laundry shop making about US$ 3 each day in revenue. One of his children works as a security guard with him; another one is a student, and the other is married and lives separately.

Mr. In S. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for his family’s transportation. His family members spend a lot of money every day using public transportation especially motor-taxis, so he expects the loan will help him reduce this expense and can raise his savings.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for his family’s transportation

loans.name: Hadya

texts.en:
Hadya, age 42, is married with 2 children (ages 16 and 10). She owns a clothing business where she sells various types of clothing. She began this business in 2004 and now makes a profit of about $265 a month.

Hadya now hopes for a loan to buy more stock for her business. She is a member of group Faidika, which totals 40 members who keep each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy clothing stock

loans.name: Hea

texts.en: Mrs. Hea H., 67, is the mother of seven children and works with her husband selling food and a variety of other things to the people in their community, earning collectively US$ 10 each day in revenue. Two of her children are currently employed at a garment factory making together about US$ 170 each month and the others are married and live elsewhere. Mrs. Hea H. hopes to use this loan to purchase more products to expand her inventory so that she can meet her growing customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase more products to expand her inventory to meet her growing customer demand

loans.name: Wazalendo Group

texts.en:
Mariam is 48-years-old and sells fish and different snacks. She works from 6am to 7pm daily and makes a monthly profit of $220.

Mariam is married with 3 children (ages 18, 24, and 27). She also takes care of 3 other children, ages 2, 4, and 6.

Mariam is the subgroup leader of Wazalendo A. She and her other subgroup members hope for this loan to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy fish stock

loans.name: Kaneez's Group

texts.en:
I am Kaneez F. from the semi-urban town of Kasur, Pakistan. I am married and the mother of five: three daughters and two sons. At present, three of my kids attend school whereas two are not yet of school-going age. My husband has an embroidery business; he has been in this business since his teens. He has eight employees to help him in his work. My husband now needs to buy a few items for his business for which purpose he requires a loan.

I also want to request that you make loans to four of my friends who are my loan group members. Sabra S. needs a loan for her husband who makes bamboo and cloth hangings, that are used to cover open doorways. Khursheed G.'s husband requires a loan to invest in his sweets shop. Parveen A. requires a loan for their fruit business. Sughran B. also requires a loan for her husband’s fruit business. We all need these loans to improve our businesses and uplift our family’s financial status.

loans.use: Expand our family's embroidery business

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
I was born in Gujranwala, a mid-size town in Pakistan but moved to a small town, Kasur, with my husband after my marriage. I have seven kids: two daughters and five sons. My husband is a daily wage laborer and I work as a maid in several houses. One of my sons drives a rickshaw (local three-wheeled taxi) and now he needs to buy a new one because the old one is in very bad condition and needs to be replaced. Therefore, we require a loan.

My other group members who are in need of loans are: Zarina B. who needs a loan for their embroidery business; Sughran S. whose husband runs a bakery and needs to expand it; Salma B. whose husband has a food stall and needs a loan as capital to invest in it; and Asiah B. whose husband makes and supplies a local type of chips and needs a loan for this business.

All these women are my friends and are very responsible in their dealings. I assure you we all will return your loans on time without delays.

loans.use: Buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Matha

texts.en:
Matha, age 34, is married with 2 children (ages 12 and 14). She owns a business of selling drink items such as water and soda. She began this business in 2006 and now makes about $476 monthly from this business. She hopes for a loan to buy more stock of drink items.

Matha belongs to the group Nyota Njema, which totals 36 members. Together, they keep eachother accountable and ensure eachother in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy stock of drink items

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
I got married eight years ago and I have four kids all of whom are boys. Currently, two of my kids attend school and other two are not of school-going age yet. I live with my family in the small town of Kasur, Pakistan. For the past ten years, we have had a business making bamboo and cloth hangings. These hangings are used as curtains at entrance doors. My husband has also hired four workers to help him. Now, he requires loan to expand his business.

I'm also asking for loans for my two friends and group members who are: Sheedan T. who needs a loan to buy a donkey cart and Shamim A. who requires a loan for their embroidery business. I am the group leader for these two because I feel I have the guts to represent us and a determination to develop my community’s families.

loans.use: Expand current hangings business

loans.name: Farhat's Group

texts.en:
I am Farhat Q., wife of Muhammad Jameel from the small town of Kasur, Pakistan. I am the mother of four: three sons and one daughter. All of my kids attend school and perform very well there. I myself studied till tenth grade and I am aware of the importance of going to school therefore, I want my children to finish their schooling.

My husband is a daily wage laborer and I embroider clothes on order. I also sell cloth to neighborhood customers. Now, I need to buy cloth in bulk for my business, for which purpose I require a loan.

The other women in my group who also need of a loan are:

Shakila B. who needs a loan for their construction business;

Rasheeda B. whose husband is an electrician and needs a loan to expand his business;

Farzana B. who needs a loan for her fruit business; and

Safia B. who requires a loan to manufacture a traditional type of hair bands.

loans.use: Buy cloth in bulk to re-sell to neighbors

loans.name: Maasifu_A Group

texts.en: Sara, age 35, is married with 2 children (ages 6 and 11). She owns a business of selling drink items such as water and sodas. She began this business in 2006. Everyday, she works from 5:30am to 6pm. She now hopes for a loan to buy more stock of drink items. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Witness K., who sells wood and charcoal.

loans.use: To buy drink items

loans.name: Suriya's Group

texts.en:
I am Suriya B.. I am married and the mother of three girls and one boy. My husband is a daily wage laborer building houses. I make traditional hair bands known as prandas, and now, I require a loan to buy thread and beads to make these bands in larger quantities.

I'm also requesting loans for my other group members who are:

Saleema B. who also manufactures the same hair bands as I do;

Shahnaz B. whose husband has a tea stall;

Latifa I. who requests a loan for her husband’s beetel-nut shop; and

Azra P. who needs a loan to buy a rickshaw.

loans.use: Buy thread and beads in bulk for my business making traditional hair bands

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
I am Parveen K. and I have lived all my life in a small town near Lahore, Pakistan. I am married and the mother of four: three boys and one girl. At present, only two of my sons attend school whereas one boy and girl are still small. My husband works as an accountant at a cloth manufacturing power looms company for the meager salary of $50, whereas I make shoes. We now feel the need to increase our income and hence my husband has decided to buy a rickshaw and drive it in the evening till night after his office work. My husband is skilled in driving and I hope he can do well. Please give us a loan for this purpose.

There are two other women who are friends of mine who are also in need of a loan: Basheeran B. requires a loan for their fruit cart. Khalida B. requires a loan for her bed sheets and cushions business, so there are three of us in our group and we guarantee repayment for each other.

loans.use: Buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Daran's Group

texts.en:
I am Daran B., wife of Muhammad Manzoor. I am the mother of six girls and one boy. All of my children are married. My husband operates a milk shop in a nearby market, whereas one of my sons who lives with me has a little furniture-making business. Along with manufacturing furniture, he also sells wood to his customers. This wood is used to light a fire to cook food. It is winter here these days and the demand for wood has risen sharply therefore, my son needs to buy wood in bulk for which purpose he needs a loan.

The other women entrepreneurs in my group who need loans are the following. Koser H. needs a loan for her son’s shoe business. Koser L. needs a loan for their fruit business. Rubina J. intends to use her loan to buy a rickshaw. Shamim A. needs a loan to expand her business creating traditional hair pieces called pranda.

loans.use: Buy wood in bulk for resale as kindling

loans.name: Uamsho A Group

texts.en:
Esther, age 45, is married with 4 children (ages 27, 14, 9, and 6). She has a retail business of selling charcoal which she started about a year ago. Everyday, she sells from 7am to noon, and makes a monthly profit of about $132 from this business.

Esther is the subgroup leader of group Uamsho A. She will be sharing this loan with her other subgroup members Nasra, Mwanaidi, Aziza, and Zawadi, who all have businesses dealing in charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy charcoal stock

loans.name: Maryam's Group

texts.en:
“I live in Riawind located near the second largest city of Pakistan called Lahore. I have six children; one of them is married, four of them work, and the youngest one is still at home. We have taken loans before and invested in our livestock fodder business. With the profits, we have bought a piece of land. Now we want a loan to purchase more fodder to sell. If we have profits this time, we will build our home on the piece of land.

I would also like to help other women in my community and borrow money in a group where we guarantee each other’s repayment. Suriya H. will invest in her gas cylinder business. Suriya Elizabeth will invest in her drugstore, and Biwa J. M. will invest in her grocery store. Parween will invest in her husband’s construction business.”

loans.use: Buy fodder in a large quantity

loans.name: Martha's Group

texts.en:
“I live with my husband and five children in Riawind, a small city located near Lahore, a large urban centre in Pakistan. Four of my children work, whereas the youngest one attends school at present. I have taken loans before and invested in the business. With the profits, I married off one son and did some repairs on our house. I need a loan now to invest in my son’s construction business. He makes wooden benches used in the construction business.

I have four other women in my group and I would like to tell you about them. Parween's husband trades in second-hand goods. Haleema’s husband runs a dairy store and needs a loan to purchase dairy products. Naziran wants to purchase a buffalo to fatten and re-sell, and Hanifa A.’s husband wants to buy equipment for their tyre store.”

loans.use: Invest in my son's business making wooden benches

loans.name: Uamsho B Group

texts.en:
Halima, age 35, is married with 4 children (ages 14, 10, 6 and 1). She owns a business of selling wood, which she began about a year ago. Everyday, she sells wood from 8am to 4pm. In a month, she makes about $132 in profit from this business.

Halima is the leader of subgroup Uamsho B. She will be sharing this loan with her subgroup, who have businesses dealing in food, charcoal, and general items sales.

loans.use: To buy wood stock

loans.name: Ushirika A Group

texts.en:
Rukia, age 23, is married with one child, age 7. She and her husband also take care of 4 other children. Rukia owns a cafe where she sells snacks and soft drinks. She opened this cafe in 2006. Now, the cafe is open from 8am to 6pm daily and she makes a monthly profit of about $185.

Rukia hopes for a loan to expand her business. She will be sharing this loan with her subgroup members Amina (also a food vendor) and Sophia (a rice store owner).

loans.use: To buy food items for cafe

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David D. is a bicycle repairer as well a trader who sells bicycle parts. David is married and has 2 children ages 4 and 1. His wife is a hairdresser who is working very hard to support her husband with the family’s finances. David wants to expand his business and increase his income.

He is asking for $1,200 to buy bicycle parts (rims, tyres, peddles, etc) and tools for his repair works.

loans.use: To buy bicycle parts (rims, tyres, peddles, etc.) and tools for his repair works.

loans.name: Mouhiba

texts.en: Mouhiba is a 52 year-old woman who lives with her family in the region of Nabatieh, in south Lebanon. Mouhiba makes bread, the kind that is called 'saj' in Lebanon. Mouhiba is a mother of 6 and is the only provider for her family. This is the second time Mouhiba is asking for a loan from A. Majmoua. She needs to buy the necessary provisions for her business.

loans.use: To buy the necessary provisions

loans.name: Yusif

texts.en:
Yusif A. is a distributor of ice cream (Fun products). He is married and has 4 children, ages 15, 11, 7and 3. His wife is a trader who is working very hard to support her husband with the family's finances. His current capital is not enough to meet the growing demand of his costumers. He wants to buy a larger deep freezer to store his ice cream for distribution.

He is asking for $1,200 as an additional capital to buy a new deep freezer and also buy more ice cream for distribution.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy a new deep freezer and also buy more ice cream for distribution.

loans.name: Ushirika B Group

texts.en:
Zena, age 45, is divorced and has five children. She owns a business of selling clothing, which she began in 2006. Now, she sells the clothes on the street of her home from 10am to 4pm daily. The business brings her a monthly profit of about $132.

Zena hopes for a loan to buy more clothes to sell. She will be sharing this loan with her small group members, who have shop, cafe, and soft drink businesses.

loans.use: To buy more clothing

loans.name: Layla

texts.en: Layla is a 41 year-old mother of 3. She lives with her family in south Lebanon, in the region of Nabatieh. This is the second time Layla is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. She needs to buy new merchandise for her accessories store. Layla does not only limit her business to accessories sales but also works in the make-up sector.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise

loans.name: Ward

texts.en: Ward is a 35 years old woman. Ward lives in south Lebanon, in the region of Nabatieh. Ward sells bags and shoes. This is the second time she is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. She needs 400$ to buy new merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy new merchandise

loans.name: Ushirika C Group

texts.en:
Monica is 27-years-old and lives with her husband and 4-year-old child. She owns a business of selling utensils. She has been doing this trade since 2003 and now she makes a monthly profit of about $70. She sells the utensils from 9am to 2pm every day.

Monica is the leader of subgroup Ushirika C. She and her subgroup members, Halima (tailoring) and Fatuma (selling charcoal), hope for a loan to increase their businesses.

loans.use: To buy stock of utensils

loans.name: Husna

texts.en:
Husna, age 32, is married with 5 children (ages 15, 13, 10, 7, and 4). She owns a business of selling clothing. She began this business 6 years ago and now she is able to make about $530 a month from this trade. She sells the clothes from 10am to 3pm daily.

In the past, Husna was able to take out a loan from BRAC Tanzania to increase her business. Having paid this back successfully, she now hopes to take out a new loan to buy more clothing stock.

Husna is a member of the loan group Kichangani, whose members ensure one another and keep eachother accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy clothing stock

loans.name: Nana Yaw

texts.en:
Nana Yaw A. is trader who deals in second-hand clothing. He is a married man with a child of 4 years old. His wife is also a trader who is working very hard to help her husband put food on the table for the family. Business is going on very well for Nana Yaw and he wants to maximize his profit by increase his capital base.

He is hereby asking for $1,200 as an additional capital to buy more second-hand clothing and also improve his shop.

loans.use: Buy more second-hand clothing and also improve his shop.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina O. owns a shop in which bags, clothing, and others are sold. She also has a canteen where she prepares food for sale. She is married to a commercial driver whose daily income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. However, Amina is working very hard to support husband with the family’s finances. Amina wants to improve upon her canteen business.

She is asking for $1,200 as an additional capital to buy more food supplies for her canteen and also more bags, clothing materials and others for her shop.

loans.use: Buy more food supplies for her canteen and also more bags, clothing materials and others for her shop.

loans.name: Hekima_A Group

texts.en:
Habiba, age 34, is married with 1 girl and 3 boys (between 3-12 years old). She and her husband also take care of her orphaned niece and nephew.

Habiba owns a business of selling different food items, which she began in 2006. She works from 10am to 9pm daily, and in a month, she is able to make a profit of about $132.

In the past, Habiba was able to take out a loan from BRAC Tanzania to enhance her business. Having paid this back successfully, she now hopes for a new loan to buy more food items. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Nadhiju (food vendor), Swaumu (clothes seller), and Vumilia (food vendor).

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra Kamate prepares a native food called ‘Wakye’ for sale. She also fries fish on a large scale for distribution. Her husband is an operator of a milling machine but his daily income is not enough to meet the family’s financial needs. Zahra is working very hard to support her husband to meet the family’s financial needs. She wants to increase her income; she has plans to improve upon her business

She is asking for $1,200 as additional capital to buy more fresh fish, beans, oil, rice, and other food supplies which are the raw materials for her food production.

loans.use: Buy more fresh fish, beans, oil, rice and other food supplies which are the raw materials for her food production.

loans.name: Upendo 2A Group

texts.en:
Mercy, age 35, is married with 4 children (between 1 year old and age 17). She and her husband also take care of her sister's children as well (ages 14 and 17). Mercy owns a fish business, which she started in 2004. Mercy is a hardworking woman and her business is open from 6:30am to 10pm daily. She makes a monthly profit of about $132 from this business.

Mercy hopes for a new loan to expand her fish business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Scholastica, who sells soft drinks.

loans.use: To buy fish stock

loans.name: Leonard Amoako

texts.en: Leonard Amoako A. is a trader who sells electrical materials and fittings. He is married and has two children. His wife is a trader who is supporting him with the family’s finances. There has been an increase in demand for his goods and he is planning to increase his sales but he lacks adequate capital. He is hereby asking for $1,200 as  additional capital to buy more electrical materials and fittings to meet the demand of his customers.

loans.use: As  additional capital to buy more electrical materials and fittings to meet the demand of his customers.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena A. is a dealer of unsewn clothing material, shoes, bags and so on. She is a married woman with one child who is six years old. Her husband is a transport owner but his income is not sufficient to meet the family’s financial needs. Helena is working very hard to support her husband with the family’s finances. Demand for her goods has increased.

She is asking for $1,200 as  additional capital to buy more materials, shoes, bags, etc. to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more materials, shoes, bags, etc. to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
Mrs. Zulma Insfran is 39 years of age. She currently lives with Julián Fariña, who is 41, and together they have 2 children who attend elementary school.

Mrs. Insfran tells us that she has had her mini market since the year 2000. She started her business with a small amount of money that her husband gave her when he was working as a foreman in a ranch. With this money, she was able to open up a mini market where she sells fruits, vegetables, and sugar, among other products.

She dreams of having her children earn a university education and become professionals who lead respectable lives. She is requesting this loan in order to buy rice, sugar, and noodles.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Zulma Insfran tiene 39 años de edad vive actualmente en pareja con el señor Julián Fariña de 41 años de edad tienen dos hijos que están cursando la etapa primaria de la escuela.

La señora Zulma nos cuenta que desde el año 2000 tiene su despensa, se inicio con un pequeño capital que le había facilitado su marido que trabajaba de capataz en una estancia, fue así como abrió una despensa donde vende productos de primera necesidad como frutas, hortalizas, azúcar, entre otros.

Sueña con que sus hijos lleguen a terminar alguna carrera Universitaria y sean profesionales y así llevar una vida digna. Solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz, azúcar y fideo.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, and noodles

loans.name: Hekima B Group

texts.en:
Khadija, age 23, lives with her parents and takes care of her 12-year-old orphaned nephew. She owns a cosmetics shop, which she opened in March 2007. At her shop, she sells cosmetics from 9am to 8pm daily, and makes a monthly profit of about $212.

Khadija hopes for a loan to buy more stock for her shop. She will share this loan with her fellow subgroup members Salma and Hanifa, both doing food sales.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics stock

loans.name: Heoine

texts.en: Heroine B. is a Trader who sells Video CDs and DVDs. She is married but has no children. Her husband is also a trader, but his daily income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. Heroine is working very hard to support with the family’s finances. At the moment she wants to increase her income by expanding her business. She is asking for $1,200 as additional capital to purchase more movies (both CDs and DVDs) to meet the growing demand of her costumers for her goods.

loans.use: As an additional capital to purchase more movies (both VCDs and DVDs) to meet the growing demand of her  costumers for her goods.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
Mr. German C. is 50 years of age. He is married to Mariza Irala, who is 27 years of age, and together they have 2 school age children.

German states that he started selling produce in 1992. Initially, he only sold tomatoes, sweet red peppers, and onions, but after upon realizing that sales were good, he asked his parents for a loan, rented out a space to set up a shop, and started to buy a greater quantity of fruits and vegetables to distribute to the general stores in his area.

Now, German is requesting a loan to buy more fruits and vegetables because his clientele is steadily growing due to his high quality products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. German C. tiene 50 años de edad esta casado con la señora Mariza Irala de 27 años tienen dos hijos menores de edad.

German nos cuenta que en el año 1992 comenzó a trabajar en la venta de verdura primeramente comenzó a vender tomates, locotes, cebollas; luego ya que la venta era buena, pidió un préstamo a sus padres y alquilo un salón para su local y fue así que comenzó a comprar las verduras y frutas en cantidades mayores y proveer a las despensas del barrio.

Hoy Germán solicita el préstamo para la compra de más frutas y verdura ya que cada vez aumentan sus clientes pues sus productos son de muy buena calidad.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits & vegetables such as apples, bananas, grapes, lettuce, tomatoes, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es:
Mr. Juan Ángel Rodríguez Villalba is 51 years of age, married, and has 2 grown up children.

Juan used to work in a cotton company in Ybycui, but after many years working there, he decided to leave it. With his severance pay, he was able to buy tools to open an automotive repair shop. Since then, he has dedicated his time and effort to his business with great sacrifice.

He is able to cover the household expenses with the profits earned from his business, which is vital because his wife is a homemaker and therefore does not receive any income.

He will use the loan to buy tools for his automotive repair shop.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Señor Juan Ángel Rodríguez Villalba tiene 51 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos, ambos mayores de edad.

Juan trabajaba en la algodonera Ybycui, luego de muchos años decidió salir de la empresa y como fue bien indemnizado, con ese dinero compro herramientas para abrir un taller mecánico de automóviles, actividad a la que se dedica desde ese entonces con mucho sacrificio.

Con las ganancias que obtiene de su taller, solventa los gastos de la casa, ya que su esposa no trabaja y solo se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos.

El crédito será destinado a la compra de herramientas para su taller.

loans.use: Purchase of new tools for his automotive repair shop

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Señora Albertina is 58-years-old and is a single mother of an adult daughter, who helps her make garments.

Albertina is a seamstress and has made a living making garments for a little more than 8 years. She started working by herself with one sewing machine, and after various credits, she now has 7 industrial machines and employs 8 people.

Albertina tells us that thanks to these credits, she was able to grow. Today she makes t-shirts, pants, skirts, and uniforms, among other items. She hopes to acquire a new credit to buy fabric, thread, fasteners, buttons, etc, because she has a lot of orders for uniforms for the month of January.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Albertina tiene 58 años, es madre soltera, tiene una hija mayor que la ayuda con la confección y elaboración de prendas de vestir.

Albertina es modista y hace un poco más de 8 años que se decida a la fabricación de prendas de vestir. Empezó trabajando ella sola con una máquina de coser, y hoy día y luego de varios créditos, ya cuenta con siete máquinas industriales y da empleo a 8 personas.

Albertina nos cuenta que gracias a esos créditos ella pudo crecer, hoy fabrica remeras, pantalones, faldas, uniformes, entre otros. Desea adquirir un nuevo crédito para comprar telas, hilos, cierres, botones, etc. pues tiene muchos pedidos de uniformes para el mes de enero.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, thread, fasteners, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana is 25 years old and is a single mother of three children, 2 boys (ages 1 and 3) and one girl (6 years old). Ana has two fruits & vegetables stands at the local San Lorenzo market, she's had them for over 10 years.

Ana began to work with her mom since she was very young at the same stand where she works now. She comes from a very humble family but thanks to their efforts they were able to complete construction of their home.

In the future they hope to purchase more fruits & vegetable stands in order to have larger sales in the area. She requests the credit in order to purchase wholesale items such as apples, bananas, pineapples, grapes, tomatoes, onions, lettuce, carrots, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Ana tiene 25 años y es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos, dos varones de 1 y 3 años y una nena de 6. La Sra. Ana tiene dos puestos en el mercado de San Lorenzo hace ya más de 10 años, en donde vende verduras y frutas.

Ana empezó a trabajar desde muy joven con su mama, quien era dueña del puesto hasta que un día le dejo a su cargo el negocio. Provienen de una familia humilde, gracias al esfuerzo de ambas pudieron terminar de construir su vivienda.

En el futuro tiene pensado comprar mas puestos para una mayor venta de sus productos. Hoy día solicita el crédito con el que podrá adquirir mercaderías en grandes cantidades como manzanas, bananas, piñas, uvas, tomates, cebollas, lechugas, zanahorias, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Blanca N.

texts.es:
Selling clothing is a very important business because clothing can be sold at any time of the year. Knowing this, Mrs. Blanca G. has had her business for 10 years in the Israel Lewites market in Managua. She began her business in order to maintain her home and feed her five children.

She says that in the year she has worked with Ceprodel she has received great opportunities because of the loans she has received, taking advantage of them to expand her sales with the volume of merchandise and earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

La venta de ropa es un negocio muy importante ya que puede ser comercializado en cualquier época del año. Consiente de esta situación, la señora Blanca G. desde hace 10 años tiene su propio negocio en el mercado Israel Lewites en Managua. El propósito por el cual inició el negocio es para mantener su hogar y de esta manera alimentar a sus cinco hijos.

Comenta que desde hace un año ha trabajado con Ceprodel el cual le ha brindado grandes oportunidades por medio de los créditos habiéndolos aprovechado de manera que ha ampliado sus ventas tanto en volumen de mercadería como en utilidades.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Mrs. Concepción T. is known as Conchita, has been selling clothing for 20 long years in the city of Managua. She is a married mother of two children who are the most precious things she has.

Mrs. T. began her business with the goal of bettering the condition of her home as there were few resources and only the low income her husband provided, which was not enough to maintain their home.

She has worked with Ceprodel for 2 years and she says that she has had great opportunities to improve her business. Because of the loans she has experienced greater volumes of sales that have benefited her business, but above all, have provided the support for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Concepción T. conocida como conchita se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 20 largos años en la ciudad de Managua. Es una madre casada y con dos hijos que son lo más preciado que ella tiene.

La señora T. inició su negocio con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar ya que ha sido de escasos recursos y solamente con los bajos ingresos que obtenía su esposo no podían mantener el hogar.

Ha trabajado con Ceprodel desde hace dos años y según comenta, ha obtenido grandes oportunidades para mejorar su negocio. Por medio de estos ha adquirido mayores volúmenes de venta que le han beneficiado en su negocio pero sobre todo en el apoyo de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase clothing.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María is a single mother of a daughter who lives with her.

Señora María has made a living selling clothing and household appliances for 17 years. She previously had a small grocery store which wasn't very successful, so she incorporated clothing sales, which had much more advantageous results for her than the other business.

With the current credit requested, she hopes to acquire a larger quantity of clothing and household appliances to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

María es madre soltera y tiene una hija que vive con ella.

La Sra. Maria se dedica a vender ropas y electrodomésticos hace ya 17 años; anteriormente tenía una despensa la cual no tuvo mucho éxito, luego fue incorporando la venta de ropas a cuota que le resulto mas ventajoso que la otra actividad.

Con el actual crédito solicitado desea adquirir mayor cantidad de ropas y electrodomésticos para vender.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing and household appliances

loans.name: Eira Mercedes

texts.es:
Mrs. Eira Hernández began a business 5 years ago in the city of Managua selling flavored refreshments, pop, and juices of different flavors.

It is necessary to note that this type of business is very strong because Eira began as a street vendor in the streets of Managua before establishing herself in the capital’s market.

Ceprodel has supported Eira for a year, and she has had 6 loans which she has used wisely to maintain her locale and to continue working hard to succeed and provide for her two small children who need her so.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Hace cinco años, en la ciudad de Managua, para poder mantener a sus 2 hijos, la señora Eira Hernández inicia un negocio de venta de agua helada, gaseosa y jugos de diferentes sabores.

Es necesario destacar que este tipo de negocio es muy fuerte por el hecho de que la señora S. comenzó vendiendo ambulante en las calles de Managua hasta establecerse en el mercado de la capital.

Desde hace un año, Ceprodel ha apoyado a la señora Eira con la realización de 6 créditos los cuales los ha utilizado sabiamente para darle mantenimiento a su localidad y seguir esforzándose por sacar adelante a sus dos pequeños hijos que tanto la necesitan.

loans.use: Purchase drinks

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando Mendez is a married man responsible for three sons. For 10 years he has been selling basic grains which he sells in the Israel Lewites market in the city of Managua.

He began his business with U$200 that he saved over a long period of time. It is necessary to note that he is a strong and hardworking man that has known how to respond to the call of being a father who supports his three small children that study in elementary school.

He has worked with Ceprodel for two years, having received loans that he has taken advantage of wisely to better his and his family’s living conditions. He has a history of 13 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Fernando Mendez es un caballero casado y con tres hijos a su responsabilidad. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la veta de granos básicos los cuales son vendidos en el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua.

Inició su negocio con un capital de U$ 200 que los obtuvo por medio de sus ahorros de largo tiempo. Es de suma necesidad destacar que es un hombre esforzado y trabajador que ha sabido responder al llamado de ser padre manteniendo a sus tres pequeños hijos que cursan la etapa escolar.

Desde hace dos años ha trabaja con Ceprodel el cual le ha brindado créditos que los ha aprovechado muy sabiamente para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Actualmente tiene un record de 13 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase basic grains

loans.name: Guillermo Villega

texts.es:
Since he was 17 years old Mr. Guillermo E. (known as don Memo) has worked at the sale of watches and jewelry in the city of Managua, specifically in the markets of the capital. He began his business with an investment of US $300 with which little by little, over the years he has managed to better the economic situation of his business.

He is married and with the responsibility of supporting his three children who require much of his support as they are school aged. It is necessary to point out that Mr. E. has successfully completed 14 loans with Ceprodel in the past two years and they have benefitted his business greatly in that they have increased his sales and therefore his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 17 años el señor Guillermo E. (conocido como don Memo) se dedica a la venta de relojes y prendas en la ciudad de Managua específicamente en los mercados de la capital. Su negocio lo comenzó con una inversión de U$ 300 por lo que a través de los años ha venido mejorando poco a poco la situación económica de su negocio.

Es casado y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus tres hijos que necesita mucho de su apoyo por estar en la etapa escolar. Es necesario destacar que el señor E. ha realizado 14 créditos con Ceprodel desde hace dos años y le han sido de mucho beneficio para su negocio ya que han incrementado sus ventas y por ende sus utilidades.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise - Compra de mercadería

loans.name: Ivania

texts.es:
Selling soda pop and juice is a common business in the city of Managua, especially in the markets of the capital. Knowing this, Ivania Martinez has been in this business for 15 years in order to support her husband with the household expenses and pay the school tuition for her two small daughters.

She began her business with an investment of U$170 and has worked with Ceprodel for a year obtaining loans that have greatly benefited her business as she has increased her earnings and acquired greater volumes of product.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La venta de gaseosas y jugos es un negocio muy común en la ciudad de Managua específicamente en los mercados de la capital. Consiente de esto, la señora Ivania Martinez se dedica desde hace 15 años a este negocio para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar y el pago de los estudios de sus dos pequeñas hijas

Inició su negocio con un capital de U$ 170 y desde hace un año ha trabajado con Ceprodel obteniendo créditos que han beneficiado grandemente su negocio por lo que ha aumentado sus ganancias y adquirido mayores volúmenes de sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase juice and soda pop

loans.name: Lidia Margari

texts.es:
Señora Lidia C. has made a living selling fruits and vegetables for 18 years in the city of Managua, and more specifically in the markets of this capital city. She started her business with an investment of $95, and she has improved the economic situation of her business little by little through the years.

She is a widow and has the responsibility of caring for her elderly mother, who needs a lot of her support. It's necessary to point out that Señora C. has had 4 credits with CEPRODEL in 2 years, and they have been very beneficial to her because she has been able to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Desde hace 18 años la señora Lidia C. se dedica a la venta de frutas y vegetales en la ciudad de Managua específicamente en los mercados de la capital. Su negocio lo comenzó con una inversión de U$ 95 por lo que a través de los años ha venido mejorando poco a poco la situación económica de su negocio.

Es viuda y con la responsabilidad de mantener a su anciana madre que necesita mucho de su apoyo. Es necesario destacar que la señora C. ha realizado 4 créditos con Ceprodel desde hace dos años y le han sido de mucho beneficio para su negocio ya que han incrementado sus ventas y por ende sus utilidades.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Manuela De Jesús

texts.es:
For the past 10 years, in the city of Managua in the Israel Lewites market, Mrs. Manuela Martinez has worked at the sale of costume jewelry such as cufflinks, chains and accessories. These are sold from very early in the morning until the late afternoon.

It is necessary to point out that Mrs. Manuela is a single mother with the responsibility of supporting her three children, give them an education and feed them every day. In spite of this situation she has acted very wisely in acquiring credits with Ceprodel for the past two years, which have caused an impact on her sales by increasing them and she has acquired more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace 10 años en la ciudad de Managua en el mercado Israel Lewites la señora Manuela Martinez se dedica a la venta de bisuterías tales como collares, colas y prendas. Estas son vendidas desde muy temprano por la mañana hasta el atardecer.

Es necesario destacar que la señora Manuela es madre soltera y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus tres hijos dándoles educación y el pan de cada día. A pesar de esta situación ella ha actuado muy sabiamente al adquirir créditos con Ceprodel desde hace 2 años los cuales le han causado un impacto en sus ventas al haberlas incrementado y adquirido mas mercadería.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise - Compra de mercaderia

loans.name: Margarita Catalina

texts.es:
Ten years ago, in the city of Managua, in order to support her three children and her elderly father, Mrs. Margarita Hernandez started a business for the sale of ice water, sodas and hamburgers.

It is necessary to note that this type of business is very hard since Mrs. Margarita is primarily exposed for not having a good place in the market and this dircetly harms her health.

For the past year, Ceprodel has helped Mrs. Margarita with the completion of four loans, which she has used to maintain her market place and continue strengthening it so she may advance her four children who need her so.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace diez años, en la ciudad de Managua, para poder mantener a sus 3 hijos y a su anciano padre, la señora Margarita H. inicia un negocio de venta de agua helada, gaseosa y hamburguesas.

Es necesario destacar que este tipo de negocio es muy fuerte por el hecho de que la señora Margarita se expone primeramente por no tener en buen estado su local en el mercado y esto perjudica directamente la salud.

Desde hace un año, Ceprodel ha apoyado a la señora Margarita con la realización de 4 créditos los cuales los ha utilizado para darle mantenimiento a su localidad y seguir esforzándose por sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos que tanto lo necesitan.

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks - Compra de gaseosas

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
Selling clothing is a common business in the city of Managua, especially in the city’s markets. Nevertheless, María Jarquin has been doing just this for 2 years in order to support her three school-aged children. It is necessary to note that she is a single mother so she is fulfilling the roles of both father and mother.

She has worked with Ceprodel for a year bettering her business and she has been able to support her three children in school. It is necessary to point out that she has been timely in her loan payments to Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La venta de ropa es un negocio muy común en la ciudad de Managua específicamente en los mercados de la capital. Sin embargo, la señora María Jarquin se dedica desde hace 2 años a este negocio para mantener a sus tres hijos que se encuentran en la etapa escolar. Es necesario destacar que es madre soltera por lo que hace el papel de padre y madre.

Desde hace un año ha trabajado con Ceprodel obteniendo mejoras en su negocio y además ha podido mantener a sus tres hijos que se encuentran en la etapa de estudios. Es necesario destacar que ella ha sido fiel con el pago de estos créditos en Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Señora María Z. has sold groceries like basic grains and cooking oil for 29 years. Her business is known for being very stable because at any given day or time, it is common to find her working.

She is married with two kids to care for, and they are the reason for her efforts and hard work. She has worked with CEPRODEL for a year, obtaining improvements to her business and also being able to support her two children, who are in school. It's important to point out that she has been loyal with the payments of her credits with CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Maria Z. desde hace 29 años se dedica a la venta de abarrotes tales como granos básicos y aceite. Su negocio se caracteriza por ser muy estable ya que en todo momento, a cualquier día y en cualquier hora es muy común encontrarla en sus labores.

Es casada y con dos hijos que mantener por lo que ellos son la razón de sus esfuerzos y labores. Desde hace un año ha trabajado con Ceprodel obteniendo mejoras en su negocio y además pudiendo mantener a sus dos hijos que se encuentran en la etapa de estudios. Es necesario destacar que ella ha sido fiel con el pago de estos créditos en Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries

loans.name: Martha Julia

texts.es:
Martha Julia M. is a married woman responsible for two children. She has sold basic grains for 20 years in the Israel Lewites market in Managua.

Like all Nicaraguan women Mrs. M. is very hard-working as she has worked during all this time and has been able to support her children who are still in school.

She has worked with Ceprodel for a year, and Ceprodel has given her loans which she has used wisely to better her and her family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Martha Julia M. es una dama casada y con dos hijos a su responsabilidad. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la veta de granos básicos los cuales son vendidos en el mercado Israel Lewites de Managua.

Como toda mujer Nicaragüense la señora M. es muy trabajadora ya que todo este lapso de tiempo ha persistido y hasta ahora ha logrado mantener a sus hijos que están en la etapa escolar.

Desde hace un año ha comenzado a trabajar con Ceprodel el cual le ha brindado créditos que los ha aprovechado muy sabiamente para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Señor Antonio G. is married to Seferina Mencia de G., and they have 3 young children.

Don Antonio makes a living repairing engines, and his wife sells charcoal out of their home. He began working repairing engines as an assistant at a company. He became independent 8 years ago after many years of work.

He is requesting the loan because he hopes to add on to his home so he can give more comfort to his family and be able to work better.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El señor Antonio G. esta casado con la señora Seferina Mencia de G. y tienen 3 hijos menores.

Don Antonio se dedica ala rectificación de motores y la señora se dedica a la venta de carbón en su domicilio. Se inicio en el rubro de rectificación desde muy joven como ayudante en una empresa, hace ocho años que logro independizarse luego de muchos años de trabajo.

Solicita el crédito pues desea realizar una ampliación en su casa, de esta forma podrá dar mayor comodidad a su familia y podrá trabajar mejor.

loans.use: To add on to his home

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Selling clothing is an important business as clothing can be sold at any time of the year. Knowing this, Mr.s Marta R. has been selling clothing for 10 years in order to support her 4 children and her husband.

She says that since the two years she has worked with Ceprodel she has had great opportunities through the loans she has received, taking advantage of the opportunities to expand her sales and income. Today she has a history of 14 loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La venta de ropa es un negocio muy importante ya que puede ser comercializado en cualquier época del año. Consiente de esta situación, la señora Marta R. desde hace 10 años se dedica a este negocio para poder mantener a sus 4 hijos apoyando de esta manera a su esposo.

Comenta que desde hace dos año ha trabajado con Ceprodel el cual le ha brindado grandes oportunidades por medio de los créditos habiéndolos aprovechado de manera que ha ampliado sus ventas tanto en volumen de mercadería como en utilidades. Hoy en día tiene un record de 14 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Mirna Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Mirna C. has been selling clothing for 20 years in the city of Managua. She is a married mother of three children for whom she is responsible to support.

She began her business with U$200 with the goal of bettering her living conditions as there have been few resources and to support her small children providing them an education so they may grow up to be successful professionals.

Mrs. C. has worked with Ceprodel for 2 years, obtaining 6 loans that have allowed her to better her living conditions and continue to support her three children for today more than ever they need your support.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Mirna C. se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 20 años en la ciudad de Managua. Es una madre casada y con tres hijos de los que tiene la responsabilidad de mantener.

Inició su negocio con un capital de U$ 200 con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su hogar ya que ha sido de escasos recursos y urge apoyar a sus pequeños brindándole educación para que lleguen a ser grandes profesionales.

La señora C. ha trabajado con Ceprodel desde hace dos años obteniendo 6 créditos que le han servido para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y continuar apoyando a sus tres hijos que hoy mas que nunca necesitan de su apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase clothing

loans.name: Nubia Albertina

texts.es:
Mrs. Nubia G. has been selling vegetables for 20 years. She began with an initial investment of $80, a product of her hard work in savings.

With the hope of little by little succeeding in her business she asked Ceprodel for loans, and Ceprodel has extended its friendly hand and helped her. Today she has been able to develop her business, growing her income.

Mrs. G.’ continuous work has enabled her to support her children and her dream is that they attend the university so they can have a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Nubia G. se dedica a la actividad de venta de verduras desde hace 20 años. Inicia con un capital inicial de $80, producto de sus esfuerzos en ahorros.

Con la esperanza de ir progresando poco a poco en su negocio solicita préstamos a CEPRODEL quien le extiende su mano amiga y le ayuda. Hoy en día ha logrado el desarrollo de su negocio obteniendo un poco mas de ingresos.

El trabajo continuo de la Sra. G. le permite el sustento de sus hijos y el que coronen una carrera universitaria es su mayor sueño para que logren mejorar su nivel de vida.

loans.use: Purchase vegetables

loans.name: Rosa Esmeralda

texts.es:
Rosa M. has sold clothing for 10 years in the city of Managua. She has this business to be able to support her 4 children, who are in school, and also to support her husband with their home's expenses since they have very few resources.

She has worked with CEPRODEL, which has offered her great opportunities to improve her business. Through these credits, she has achieved larger sales volumes, which have benefitted her with her business, but above all, in the support of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La señora Rosa M. se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 10 años en la ciudad de Managua. Se dedica a este negocio para poder mantener a sus 4 hijos en sus estudios y de esta forma apoya a su esposo para mantener su hogar que por cierto es de muy bajos recursos.

Ha trabajado con Ceprodel el cual le ha brindado grandes oportunidades para mejorar su negocio. Por medio de estos créditos ha adquirido mayores volúmenes de venta que le han beneficiado en su negocio pero sobre todo en el apoyo de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar is a happy and responsible father who makes a living by selling and repairing cell phones. He started by just selling new phones as a street vendor, but as he increased the quantity of his sales and acquired greater knowledge of how to repair cell phones, he decided to invest the money he had saved in renting a location and opening a small space to sell and repair these important instruments of communication. Currently, Edgar is separated from his wife and is caring for their only son, Michael, who is 8. Michael is his reason for living, along with his elderly mother, who he supports unconditionally with his care and attention. Edgar's dream is to expand his location and to increase the quantity of cell phones and equipment to offer his clients. This is why he needs to obtain a loan that he promises to repay in 6 months. Let's help this model son and father achieve his objectives.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Edgar, es un alegre y responsable padre, está dedicado a la venta y reparación de celulares. Empezó sólo vendiendo celulares nuevos y en forma ambulatoria, pero conforme aumentaba la cantidad de sus ventas y fue adquiriendo mayor conocimientos sobre la reparación de celulares, decidió invertir el dinero ahorrado que tenía para alquilar un local y aperturar su pequeño espacio de reparación y venta de estos importantes instrumentos de comunicación. Actualmente Edgar se encuentra separado de su esposa, quedando él a cargo de su único hijo, Michael de ocho años, quien es la razón de su vida junto a su anciana madre, quien la apoya incondicionalmente con el un cuidado y atención de su querido retoño. El deseo del señor Edgar, es ampliar su local y aumentar la cantidad de equipos móviles para ofertarlos, es por esa razón que requiere obtener un préstamo de dinero que promete reembolsarlo en un lapso de seis meses.Ayudemos a cumplir los objetivos de este hijo y padre ejemplar.

loans.use: Expansion of his space where he buys and sells cell phones to offer his clients increased comfort

loans.name: Walter Daniel

texts.es:
Walter A. is a married man with responsibility of two children. He has been selling basic grains in the Israel Lewites market in Managua for 5 years.

He began his business with C$500 that he obtained through a loan. Then he invested in his business and increased his products.

He has worked with Ceprodel for a year, reciving loans that has has taken advantage of wisely to improve his and his family’s living conditions. He has a history of 3 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Walter A. es un caballero casado y con dos hijos a su responsabilidad. Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la veta de granos básicos los cuales son vendidos en el mercado Israel Lewites de Managua.

Inició su negocio con un capital de C$ 500 que los obtuvo por medio de un préstamo a un prestamista. Luego fue invirtiendo en su negocio hasta incrementar sus productos.

Desde hace un año ha comenzado a trabajar con Ceprodel el cual le ha brindado créditos que los ha aprovechado muy sabiamente para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia. Actualmente tiene un record de 3 créditos.

loans.use: Purchase basic grains

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
For several years Hugo, Faustina’s husband, has been working at a gas distribution company. Eight months ago Faustina used Hugo’s knowledge of the business to start her own gas distribution service for families in her community.

This business has enabled her to accomplish her goals. She would like to expand her business, which will require more capital. She plans on using the additional revenue to build a home for her family. Your Financial assistance will help this hard working mother fulfill her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace varios años, Hugo, esposo de Faustina, venia trabajando en una empresa privada de distribución de gas, aprovechando el conocimiento de su querido compañero poco a poco por iniciativa de esta trabajadora madre que veía en ésta actividad una forma de apalear el hambre de su hogar, con el dinero ahorrado que tenía logró crear su pequeña empresa de venta y distribución de gas a domicilio.Esta actividad que emprendió hace 8 meses atrás y a la que ahora viene dedicándose diligentemente les ha otorgado mucha dicha por que rápidamente le ha permitiendo cumplir con sus objetivos.El deseo de esta empresaria pareja es lograr ampliar su mercado y para este propósito requiere aumentar el monto de su capital, con las ganancias que obtenga tiene planeado construir su casita con el fin de ofrecerle a su familia un techo propio y seguro. Con su deseo albergado en su corazón recurre en búsqueda de tu ayuda a fin de acopiar la cantidad que necesita.Apoyemos a esta empresaria familia a prosperar con su nueva labor.

loans.use: Purchase of additional gas tanks to increase distribution to more families in her community.

loans.name: Segundina

texts.es:
Here we find Mrs. Eulalia, working anxiously in her small carpentry workshop. This noble profession, to which she's been devoted from four months ago, helps to provide higher education to her three beloved children, while also helping two other children who look after the welfare and safety of their respective families. Mrs. Eulalia's greatest dream is to make her small carpentry shop, one of the largest and most recognized in the city of Juliaca. She plans to realize this goal by working carefully and thoroughly putting her best effort in each piece of furniture she makes. Her desire is to offer beautiful, fine and innovative works to her clients, in order to ensure that they feel very satisfied and pleased with the results of her products. To this end, Mrs. Eulalia wishes to obtain a loan which she'll invest towards the purchase of good quality wholesale lumber, so she can slowly meet the demands of her customers. Eulalia hopes to count on your help. Please don't let her down.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Encontramos a doña Eulalia, trabajando ansiosamente en su pequeño taller de carpintería, este noble oficio al que se dedica desde hace cuatro meses le permite brindarle estudios superiores a sus tres queridos hijos, y al mismo tiempo ofrecerle trabajo a otros dos jóvenes quienes velan por el bienestar y seguridad de sus respectivas familias.El deseo más grande de doña Eulalia es hacer de su pequeño tallercito de carpintería uno de los más grandes y reconocidos de la ciudad de Juliaca, es por ese objetivo que trabaja con sumo cuidado y detalladamente poniendo lo mejor de sí en cada uno de los muebles que realiza, con el fin de ofrecerles hermosos, finos y novedosos trabajos a sus clientes, con el propósito de que sus exigentes usuarios se sientan muy satisfechos y contentos con los resultados que obtienen.En esta oportunidad doña Eulalia desea obtener un préstamo de dinero para invertirlos en la compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima (madera) y así cumplir poco a poco sus metas propuestas.Eulalia espera contar con tu apoyo, no la defraude.

loans.use: To purchase high quality wholesale materials (lumber).  (Compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de materia prima.)

loans.name: Ana  Johanna

texts.es:
Ana rents telephone (like a pay phone), cosmetics, and sends faxes. She began this business when she couldn’t find work and decided to ask for a loan to start this business.

Ana considers Ceprodel’s financial support effective in helping her business prosper as now she can offer more services to her customers and she wants to incorporate the sales of cell phone cards.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Ana se dedica a la actividad de alquiler de teléfono, cosméticos y envió de fax. Este negocio lo inicia en vista de que no encuentra empleo y decide solicitar financiamiento para dedicarse a este negocio.

Ana, considera que el aporte financiero que ha solicitado en CEPRODEL ha sido efectivo en la prosperidad de su establecimiento ya que actualmente ofrece mas servicios a sus clientes y desea incorporar la venta de tarjetas para celulares.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni has always worked hard. From the time she was little, she's been engaged in handcrafts type work and weaves beautiful sweaters, scarfs and gloves. This noble profession/craft which she learned from her beloved mother, will hopefully one day become a recognized and outstanding craftsmanship in the city of Juliaca. Now she has made this profession an important way of generating income for her family, and thus support the household expenses along with her husband, Juan, who works with a lot of determination and hard work as a bricklayer. Marleni, works daily from 9:00 in the morning until 10:00 at night, to create her beautiful items, and finally puts them on sale on Sundays (in the Sunday market in the city of Juliaca). This charming mother of three wishes to increase her production. This requires the purchase of a knitting machine in order to expedite her work. Your generous contribution will be very well spent in the hands of this talented mother.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.
