La señora Marleni, siempre fue una mujer trabajadora, desde pequeña se dedica a la labor artesanal, teje hermosas y novedosas chompas, chalinas y guantes; este noble oficio lo aprendió y heredó de su querida madre, quien un día llegó a ser una reconocida y destacada artesana de la ciudad de Juliaca.Ahora ella ha hecho de este oficio una manera importante de generar ingresos económicos para su familia, y así apoyar con los gastos familiares a su esposo, Juan, quien trabaja con mucha voluntad y ahínco en su noble oficio de albañil.Marleni, realiza diariamente sus excelentes tejidos manuales desde las 9:00 de la mañana hasta las 10:00 de la noche, para finalmente ponerlos en venta los días domingos en el mercado dominical de la ciudad de Juliaca.El deseo de esta encantadora madre de tres niños es incrementar su producción, para esto requiere comprar una máquina de tejer con el fin de agilizar su trabajo. Tu generoso aporte será muy bien invertido en las manos de esta talentosa madre.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale materials of good quality to continue making her beautiful items. (Compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima para seguir elaborando sus bellas prendas.)

loans.name: Aura  Marina

texts.es:
Señora Aura has 8 years of experience in this business that she started with her savings in addition to a small economic contribution from her husband.

She has her business in the market in Managua, and it lets her earn a stable income and attend to her loyal clientele.

CEPRODEL represents an important pillar in the development of her business since they have helped her unconditionally with 4 credits that she has used wisely to improve her location.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Aura tiene ocho años de estar ejerciendo esta actividad que lo inicia con sus ahorro mas una pequeña contribución económica de su esposo.

Tiene su establecimiento en el mercado de Managua lo que le permite un ingreso mas estable y atiende una clientela fija.

En el desarrollo de su negocio CEPRODEL representa un pilar importante puesto que le ha ayudado incondicionalmente con 4 créditos que los ha utilizado sabiamente para el mejoramiento de su localidad.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Mrs. Teresa's restaurant is located at the terminal end of one of the transport companies in the city of Juliaca. Thanks to the delicious stews she prepares, with the help of her younger sister, it has become one of the busiest restaurants due to the variety of dishes and the good care they provide. She eagerly undertook this business from the father of her young daughter, Ximena, nine months ago when he decided to leave her. Since then it has become harder and she is more eager for progress because of her baby, who is the reason for her effort from day to day. This young mother of 25, wants to expand her restaurant, which is why she is asking for your support and makes the request for a loan which she promises to repay within 6 meses. This anxious mother is waiting for your generous contribution.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

El restaurante de la señora Teresa, está ubicado en el terminal final de uno de las empresas de transporte urbano de la ciudad de Juliaca, gracias a los deliciosos potajes que prepara con ayuda de su hermana menor se ha convertido en uno de los restaurantes más concurridos por la variedad de platos y la buena atención que brindan. Ella emprendió ávidamente este negocio desde que el padre de su pequeña hija Ximena de nueve meses decidió abandonarla, desde entonces con más ahínco y muchas más ganas buscó progresar en compañía de su bebé, quien es la razón de su esfuerzo día a día.Esta joven madre de 25 años desea ampliar su restaurante, por esa razón recurre en búsqueda de tu apoyo y hace la solicitud de un préstamo que promete reembolsar en un lapso de 6 meses.Esta ansiosa madre esta en espera de tu generoso aporte.

loans.use: To expand her small restaurant. (Ampliación de su pequeño restaurante.)

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
20 years ago Mrs. J. decided to invest a small savings that she gathered with much effort and sacrifice in purchase meat.

Previously she had her business in her home but for the low sales she decided to move the business to an air conditioned location in the market with the economic help of Ceprodel who provided unconditional help in growing her business little by little and supporting her family.

One of her biggest dreams is to support her family, who is small grandchild she has been taking care of the past two years upon her parents’ death, and she hope the child continues with her studies in school.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 20 años la Sra. J. decide invertir un pequeño ahorro que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio logra reunir y decide invertirlo en la compra de carne.

Anteriormente su negocio lo atiende en su casa de habitación pero por lo bajo en las ventas decide trasladarse al mercado en donde acondiciona un local con el apoyo económico que le brinda su mano amiga CEPRODEL al cual agradece su ayuda incondicional al ir progresando poco a poco en su negocio y en su vida familiar.

Uno de sus mayores sueños es sostener a su familia que lo representa su pequeña nieta a quien por infortunios de la vida cuida desde hace 2 años a raíz de la muerte de sus progenitores y que siga con sus estudios.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Esmelda  Maria

texts.es:
Esmelda began her business with a small amount of capital, C$3000 córdobas, a product of her and her husband’s savings. Now 5 years have passed that they started this business and she always has the unconditional support of her family providing attention to their customers.

With effort, sacrifice, and the goal of improving their children’s day-to-day quality of life she has obtained loans with Ceprodel for the past two years, during which time she has received 6 loans that have contributed to her increased inventory, a variety of seafood products, better conditions in her locale, and, enabled her children to study in school.

Esmelda has as a goal to continue this activity with Ceprodel’s financial support so that she can make reality her dream of her children studying at the university.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Esmelda inicia su negocio con un pequeño capital propio de C$3,000 córdobas, producto del ahorro en conjunto con su marido. Ya han transcurrido 5 años desde que inicia esta actividad siempre con el apoyo incondicional de su familia que le ayudan en la atención de sus clientes.

Con esfuerzo, sacrificio y la meta de mejorar día a día la calidad de vida de sus hijos ha obtenido créditos en CEPRODEL desde hace dos años, durante los cuales ha administrado 6 créditos los que han contribuido en el incremento de su inventario, variedad de productos en mariscos, mejores condiciones en su local, y por ende, permite que sus hijos estudien.

. La Sra. Esmelda tiene como propósito seguir con esta actividad con apoyo financiero de CEPRODEL para que realice su mayor sueño el que sus hijos estudien en la universidad.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of fish

loans.name: Codifun

texts.es:
Codifun learned the work of autobody repair on taxis while working in a factory, but he always dreamed of having his own factory. Thanks to his perseverance, dedication and effort, he has managed to open his own shop, a place in which provides work for four other young people. Now, he is married to Judith and has an infant, so he lives independently in his father's home. The work he produces with great professionalism gives him a lot of joy, because not only does he manufactures the body of mototaxis, but he also performs repair work, an activity for which he has a broad customer base (these customers constantly recommend his work/services to other potential clients). Codifun's desire is to buy additional raw materials (Fierros) so that he can continue to work and provide his family with better living conditions. This young entrepreneur needs your support to continue to prosper in life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Codifun, aprendió la labor de construcción de carrocerías para mototaxis trabajando en una fábrica que construía estos objetos, pero siempre soñó con contar con su propia fábrica; gracias a su perseverancia, dedicación y esfuerzo ha logrado abrir su propio taller, lugar en el que también brinda trabajo a otros cuatro jóvenes.Ahora ya casado con Judith y con un pequeño niño en brazos vive en forma independiente en el domicilio de su padre. Este trabajo que desempeña con sumo profesionalismo le otorga mucha dicha, porque no sólo fabrica carrocerías de mototaxis, también realiza trabajos de reparación, actividad por la cual posee una amplia cartera de clientes que constantemente recomienda su trabajo a otros potenciales clientes.El deseo de Codifun, es comprar materia prima (Fierros) para seguir desenvolviéndose en su trabajo diario y así ofrecer a su familia una vida con mejores condiciones.“ Este joven empresario requiere de tu apoyo para seguir prosperando en la vida”

loans.use: To purchase good wholesale materials so he can continue to work. (Compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima para continuar con su labor.)

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
We find Mrs. Julia in her humble home, eagerly blending the immense variety of wool that she keeps in her house for the tailoring of her beautiful and colorful “chompas” (Peruvian wool sweaters). She is a mother who is a fighter and very innovative, she has three children; for some years she has been knitting “chompas” manually, but as she obtained better economic income bit by bit she acquired sewing machines that perfected her beautiful garments. Nowadays, with her adolescent children whom she diligently takes care of in her free time, she has strengthened her business, converting her workshop into one of the biggest and most renowned that she dedicates herself to the exportation of “chompas”, with the economic profits that she obtains thanks to her management of this activity, she has bettered her home and she has provided studies for her dear children. In this opportunity Julia applies for a loan that she has thought to invest in the purchase of a better quantity and variety of raw material to continue making her elegant “chompas.” Julia is thankful for the opportunity you provide her to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Encontramos a doña Julia, en su humilde hogar, matizando afanosamente la inmensa variedad de lanas que guarda en casa para la confección de sus hermosas y coloridas chompas. Ella es una madre muy luchadora y emprendedora, tiene tres hijos; hace algunos años atrás tejía chompas manualmente, pero conforme obtenía mayores ingresos económicos poco a poco fue adquiriendo máquinas de tejer que le fueron aliviando y perfeccionando sus bellas prendas. Actualmente, ya con sus hijos adolescentes, quienes le apoyan diligentemente en sus horas libres, ha fortalecido su negocio, convirtiendo su taller en uno de los más grandes y reconocidos que se dedican a la exportación de chompas, con las ganancias económicas que obtiene gracias a su desenvolvimiento en esta actividad ha mejorado su vivienda y les ha brindado estudios a sus queridos hijos.En esta oportunidad Julia, hace la solicitud de un préstamo que tiene pensado invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de materia prima para seguir confeccionando sus elegantes chompas.Julia agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas para acrecentar su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase a better quantity and variety of raw material.

loans.name: Fátima

texts.es:
Señora Fátima has made a living by selling dairy products for 10 years. With this small business, she has been able to support her family and provide her children with education.

Through the financing obtained in CEPRODEL, she has managed to increase the amount of her merchandise, which allows her to offer a better variety to her clients. As a result, she has obtained a little more profit and has been able to improve the quality of life of her family.

One of her dreams is to improve the infrastructure of her business to give her clients more comfort, to display her merchandise, and to keep progressing little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Fátima se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos desde hace 10 años, y con este pequeño negocio ha sostenido a su familia, permitiéndole además el que sus hijos estudien.

A través de los financiamientos obtenidos en CEPRODEL ha logrado el incremento de su mercadería lo que permite el ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes y por ende permite que la señora Fátima obtenga un poco mas de ganancia e ir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.

Uno de sus sueños es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio para mayor comodidad de sus clientes y el exhibir su mercadería e ir progresando poco a poco.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for her business

loans.name: Fernando  José

texts.es:
Mr. Fernando started his small business 25 years ago. He has been selling in the streets of Managua .He decided to ask for loan of $275 to CEPRODEL in order to improve a small stand in the market where he has established his business. He sales meals and of his goals is to improve the infrastructure of its business.

The economic contribution and financial help of CEPRODEL has helped Mr. Fernando to improve the conditions of life of him and his small son. He is planning to keep in this business that has helped to provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Fernando inicia su pequeño negocio hace 25 años vendiendo en las calles de Managua, hace 2 años decide solicitar préstamo de C$ 3,000.00 a CEPRODEL para acondicionar un pequeño local en el mercado en donde actualmente establece su negocio ofreciendo al publico general sus comidas y la venta de Atol.

Aunque tiene un pequeño local establecido en las instalaciones del mercado una de las metas del Sr. Fernando es mejorar la infraestructura de su negocio.

Con el aporte económico resultado de los financiamientos de CEPRODEL ha mejorado las condiciones de vida de el y de su pequeño hijo. Y piensa seguir en esta actividad que le han servido de sustento a su familia.

loans.use:
Sales of food and Atol( corn meal)
Venta  de  Comida  y  Atol

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is a happy mother who is 28 years old; ever since she was 5 she has dedicated herself to the sale of skirts and petticoats. She began commercial labor offering American clothes in the sunday market but observed that with the sale of skirts she could obtain a better income and decided to change products; nowadays with a lot of will and diligence she has been able to acquire a higher volume of merchandise to market and thus obtain a better economic benefit for herself and her family. Meanwhile she dedicates herself to the work of her husband, Patricio, who works in a mattress factory and between the two they try to provide a good example and education for their two little children. The desire of Mrs. Hilda is to remodel her little house and offer a stable and safe place to her small children; to make her plans concrete it is required that she obtain a loan that she would return in a lapse of 6 months. Your help is very important to the crystallization of the dreams of Hilda.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

Hilda es una alegre madre de 28 años, desde hace cinco años se dedica a la venta de polleras y enaguas. Inició esta labor comercial ofertando ropa americana en el mercado dominical, pero observó que con la venta de polleras podía obtener mayores ingresos económicos y decidió cambiar de rubro; actualmente con mucha voluntad y diligencia ha podido adquirir mayor volumen de mercadería para comercializarlos y así obtener mejores beneficios económicos para ella y su familia.Mientras se dedica a esta labor su esposo, Patricio, trabaja en una fábrica de colchones y entre los dos tratan de brindarle un buen ejemplo y educación a sus dos menores hijos.El deseo de doña Hilda es refaccionar su casita y ofrecerles a sus pequeños hijos un lugar estable y seguro; para concretar sus planes requiere obtener un préstamo de dinero que retornará en un lapso de seis meses. Tu apoyo es muy importante para la cristalización de los sueños de Hilda.

loans.use: The remodeling of her little house.

loans.name: Geoconda

texts.es:
Geoconda makes mechanical pieces for trucks, industrial machines, and cars.

She began this business with her savings and economic support from her husband.

The initiative to have her own business began from unfortunate circumstances as she was unemployed and by helping her husband with the family income she used her savings to establish this business.

Today she has 9 years running this business located in a good spot in the capital city, Managua, and she has a steady clientele.

The financial support sought from Ceprodel has been used to provide improvements to the locale, such as providing lathes in good condition even though used.

Geoconda believes that she will continue to need financial support from Ceprodel so that her business can prosper and contribute to the family sustenance.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Geoconda se dedica a la actividad de elaboración de piezas mecánicas de camiones, maquinas industriales y automóviles .

Inicia su negocio con sus ahorros mas un aporte económico de su esposo.

La iniciativa de tener su propio negocio nace por infortunios del destino ya que queda en el desempleo y por ayudar a su esposo en la economía familiar utiliza los fondos de su ahorro en el establecimiento de su negocio.

Actualmente tiene 9 años administrando su negocio encuentra ubicado en un buen punto de la ciudad capital, Managua, y tiene clientela fija.

Los aportes financieros que solicita en CEPRODEL los ha utilizado en brindar mejores condiciones a su local así como adquirir tornos en buen estado aunque sean usados.

La Sra. Geoconda considera que seguirá requiriendo del aporte financiero de CEPRODEL para que su negocio prospere y contribuir al sustento de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase materials for her business

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Mrs. Emiliana’s business is located at Bolognesi Square in the city of Juliaca. She is next to its small “ carretita” stand selling with much joy caramels, chocolates, cakes, drinks etc. Emiliana sells its merchandise from 8:00 AM to 8:00 PM every day of the week. The greater wish of this laborious mother is to see how her four smaller children turn out to be excellent professionals. This is her motivation and the reason to work and put all her effort each day. She is the only person who provides for her family.

The desire of this charming mother is to extend her stand, so she can increase the amount and variety of merchandise. In order to be able to do this she is asking for a loan of $ 525 and is committed to return it in a lapse of six months. With your generous contribution you will be able to support Mrs. Emiliana.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer.

En la Plaza Bolognesi, D. la ciudad D. Juliaca encontramos a doña Emiliana al lado D. su pequeña carretita vendiendo con mucha alegría caramelos, chocolates, galletas, bebidas etc. Emiliana oferta su mercadería desD. las 8:00 D. la mañana hasta las 8:00 D. la noche durante todos los días D. la semana, el deseo más granD. que tiene esta laboriosa madre es ver convertidos en unos excelentes profesionales a sus cuatro hijos menores, con ese fin trabaja y se esfuerza día a día, puesto que es la única persona que vela por el bienestar D. su familia. El deseo D. esta encantadora madre es ampliar su carretita para aumentar la cantidad y variedad D. mercadería, para eso requiere obtener un préstamo D. dinero que se compromete a retornarlo en un lapso D. seis meses. Con tu generoso aporte podrás apoyar a la señora Emiliana.

loans.use:
To  extend its small space of sales to offer greater amount and variety of articles.
Ampliación de su pequeño espacio de ventas para ofrecer mayor cantidad y variedad de artículos.

loans.name: Gerardo  Boanerges

texts.es:
Mr. Aleman began his business with his savings, these were a product of his hard-work and sacrifices done throughout the years. He then used his investments to purchase chickens and canned goods.

He began with a small inventory but with his hard work and support from CEPRODEL, he's been able to significantly improve his business. He is now able to offer his clients a wide variety of products.

This has allowed Mr. Aleman support his family and at the same time be able to send his kids to school. His main wish is that his kids go to school and improve their lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. A. inicia su negocio con sus ahorros producto de su esfuerzo y sacrificio que logra reunir a traves de varios años y decide invertirlos en la compra de pollos y productos embutidos.

Inicia con poco inventario pero por medio de su esfuerzo y con el aporte económico de CEPRODEL ha logrado un mayor desarrollo de su negocio al ofrecer a sus clientes varios mas variedad de productos.

Esta actividad le ha permitido al Sr.Aleman el sustento de su familia y el que sus hijos actualmente estén estudiando ya que su mayor anhelo es que sus pequeños hijos estudien en la universidad y mejoren su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Ccatun Sacha Group

texts.es:
The communal bank Ccatun Sacha, which in quechua means "big tree", started a year and 10 months ago. Currently there are 25 members who have been together for 7 cycles. The founding members were Flor D. Maria, Irma, Aurea, DanieL., Norma, and Marleny.

The members tell us that at the beginning, the communal bank went through many difficulties, which they have overcome little by little. At the same time, they say that in the communal bank they learned to be generous, share among members, and to be responsible, punctual, and to save.

The members have different businesses such as food sales, general store, vegetables, cosmetics, fruit, juices, sweets, making breads and selling at fairs.

Each member has a different story to tell, as is the case of Irma, who joined the communal bank through a neighbors' invitation. Irma started with savings of US$ 10. Back then she sold fruit at the fairs and helped selling vegetables at the local market. Right now, with the loan she got from her communal bank, she started a new business selling food at a bus stop.

On her part, Tomasa mentions that thanks to the savings she saved at the communal bank, she built her house. She used to sell tara gum and cochinilL. (an insect used to make pigments)

The members need different sums in loan, some loans are for 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, adding up to 10,200 soles in loans at the communal bank. They will invest the loans buying milk, sugar, rice, potatoes, broad beans, wheat, maize, barley, papaya, banana, orange, pineapple, avocado, yucca, cookies, chocolate bars, flour, and buying a display cabinet.

Their savings will be used in their children's graduations, education, having their own capital, and to get married. The bank's members' dreams are to build their home, start a new business selling glass, have their own locale, for their children to be professional, and traveling abroad.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

El Banco Comunal “Ccatun Sacha”, palabra quechua que significa “árbol granD.”, se inició hace 1 año y 10 meses. Actualmente son 25 socias y ya tienen 7 ciclos juntas. Las socias fundadoras fueron Flor D. Maria, Irma, Aurea, DanieL., Norma y Marleny.

Las socias cuentan que al inicio el Banco Comunal tuvo muchas dificultades, que han sido superadas poco a poco. Pero al mismo tiempo dicen que en el Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser generosas y a compartir entre socias, a ser responsables, puntuales y a ahorrar.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como venta D. comida, abarrotes, verduras, cosméticos, fruta, jugos, golosinas, elaboración D. panes y feriantes.<> Cada socia tiene una historia diferente que contar, como es el caso D. Irma, quien ingresó al Banco Comunal por invitación D. una vecina. Irma inició con un ahorro D. 10 dólares y en ese entonces elL. vendía frutas en las ferias y ayudaba a vender verduras en el mercado local. Actualmente con el préstamo que sacó D. su Banco Comunal implementó otro negocio D. venta D. comida en un paradero D. transporte público.

Por otro lado Tomasa menciona que gracias a los ahorros que reunió en su Banco Comunal construyó su casa, en ese entonces elL. vendía tara y cochinilL..

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 10200 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal. Los préstamos lo invertirán en L. compra D. leche, azúcar, arroz, papa, choclo, haba, trigo, maíz, cebada, papaya, plátano, naranja, piña, palta, yuca, galletas, chocolates, harina y para L. compra D. un exhibidor.

Los ahorros los utilizarán para L. graduación D. sus hijos, los estudios superiores D. sus hijos, tener un capital propio y para casarse. Los sueños D. las socias son construir su casa, iniciar un nuevo negocio D. vidriería, tener un local propio, que sus hijos sean profesionales y viajar al extranjero.

loans.use: buying milk, sugar, rice, potatoes, broad beans, wheat, maize, barley, papaya, banana, orange, pineapple, avocado, yucca, cookies, chocolate bars, flour, and buying a display cabinet.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Mr. Hernandez has been selling toys for 18 years, throughout the years he's been able to make her business grow.

With the loans he's gotten from CEPRODEL he's been able to improve his business and buy more toys.

This holiday season Mr. Hernandez offers bicylces and fans to his customers. For this reason, he is grateful for CEPRODEL's helping hand. CEPRODEL has been able to help him increase his inventory and improve his way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. H. se dedica a la venta de juguetes desde hace ya 18 años tiempo en el cual ha logrado ir prosperando en su negocio poco a poco.

. Con los financiamientos que ha solicitado en CEPRODEL le han contribuido en las mejoras en su local permitiéndole exhibir mejor sus juguetes y compra al contado.

Actualmente el Sr.H. desea aprovechar la temporada navideña para ofrecer a los visitantes de su establecimiento Bicicletas y abanicos por lo que considera que la mano amiga de Ceprodel es vital para que su negocio aumente su inventario y seguir mejorando su calidad de vida y el de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Mrs. Lidia has been working on the hardware business for 15 years. She's been able to get it going with a small inventory and lots of support from her husband.

Throughout time and with the financial help from CEPRODEL, she's been able to improve her store, increase her inventory and improve her family's way of life.

Lidia has been able to manage her business very well.

One of her goals through effort and sacrifices is to be able for her kids to be able to study and have a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Lidia inicia su negocio en el ramo ferretero desde hace 15 años con muy poco inventario y con apoyo económico de su esposo.

A través del tiempo y con el apoyo financiero de CEPRODEL le ha permitido mejorar su local y el incremento de su inventario así como mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

La Sra. Lidia ha logrado administrar muy bien su negocio el cual prospera día a día.

Uno de sus metas es que a través del esfuerzo y sacrificio de trabajar todos los días de la semana le permitan el que sus hijos logren estudiar y coronar una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Banco Comunal Unión Ii Group

texts.es:
Felicitas, Roxana and Adelaida belong to the Communal Bank Unión II for 8, 4, and 8 years respectively. They tell us that their Communal Bank has learned to be responsible, punctual, united, and through the lessons how to run their business and how to educate their children.

Felicitas is 21 years old and has 2 children, she sells “Donofrio” brand ice cream as a street vendor in the Santa Clara market. She has been selling ice cream for 15 years.

Roxana is 25 years old and has 2 children, she sells clothing in the 12 de abril market, an activity she has done with her mother since she was a little girl, and three years ago she began her own business. She bring the merchandise from Lima to sell.

Adelaida is 50 years old and has 4 children. She has a bakery and makes bread typical of Ayacucho, called chapla. Her oven is located in the San Sebastián neighborhood and she tells us she learned this trade from her mother.

Felicitas, Roxana and Adelaida need loans of 900 soles, 900 soles, and 750 soles respectively that will be invested in the purchase of ice cream, jackets, pants, pull overs, shirts, sweaters, flour, sugar and wood. Their savings will be used to purchase machines for the bakery, for the education of their children, and for the construction of a house. Felicitas, Roxana and Adelaida have dreams of having their own homes, a united famly, a large business, and children who finish their schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Felicitas, Roxana y Adelaida pertenecen al Banco Comunal Unión II desde hace 8, 4, 8 años respectivamente. Ellas nos cuentan que en su Banco Comunal han aprendido a ser responsables, puntuales, solidarias y a través de las capacitaciones a cómo manejar su negocio y cómo educar a los hijos.

Felicitas tiene 32 años y 2 hijos y vende helados “Donofrio” ambulatoriamente por las calles del mercado Santa Clara, actividad que realiza desde hace 15 años.

Roxana tiene 26 años y 2 hijos y vende ropa en el mercado 12 de abril, actividad que realiza desde pequeña con su mamá, y desde hace 3 años su negocio es propio. Ella trae la mercadería desde la ciudad de Lima.

Adelaida tiene 50 años y 4 hijos; tiene su panadería y elabora el pan típico de Ayacucho, el pan “chapla”. Su horno está ubicado en el barrio de San Sebastián y nos cuenta que esta actividad la aprendió de su mamá.

Felicitas, Roxana y Adelaida necesitan préstamos de 900 soles, 900 soles y 750 soles que serán invertidos en la compra de helados, casacas, pantalones, polos, camisas, chompas, harina, azúcar y leña. Sus ahorros los utilizarán en la compra de maquinarias para implementar su panadería, para la educación de sus hijos y para la construcción de su casa. Los sueños de Felicitas, Roxana y Adelaida son tener una casa propia, una familia unida, un negocio grande y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios superiores.

loans.use: Felicitas, Roxana and Adelaida need loans of 900 soles, 900 soles y 750 soles respectively that will be invested in the purchase of ice cream, jackets, pants, pull overs, shirts, sweaters, flour, sugar and wood.

loans.name: Maria Alejandrina

texts.es:
Maria is 54 years old and has 4 children. The youngest of her daughters is 13 years old, and all her sons are students. She lives in the neighborhood of Miraflores, San Juan Bautista district.

Maria has belonged to the communal bank Union II for 4 years, having joined her communal bank through her sister's invitation.

Maria sells clothes, cereals, and animals in different fairs in the area, activity she started 30 years ago. She travels to the fairs of Vilcas Huaman, Saurama, taking clothes, and from the fairs, she brings cereals, chickens, guinea pigs, and sheep to then sell them in the city of Ayacucho.

Maria needs a loan for 2500 soles which she will invest buying maize, wheat, quinoa, barley, broad bean, peas, guinea pigs, chickens, sheep, skirts, blouses, polo shirts, pants.

She will invest her savings in the construction of her home and her children's education. Maria's dreams are to build her house, have a bigger business with her own capital, and for her children to be professional.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Maria tiene 54 años y 4 hijos. La menor de sus hijas tiene 13 años y todos sus hijos son estudiantes. Ella vive en el barrio de Miraflores, distrito de San Juan Bautista.

Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal Unión II desde hace 4 años y llegó a su Banco Comunal por invitación de su hermana.

Maria vende ropas, cereales, animales en las diferentes ferias de la región, actividad que inició hace 30 años. Ella viaja a las ferias de Vilcas Huamán, Saurama llevando ropa y de las ferias trae cereales, gallinas, cuyes, carneros para luego venderlos en la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Maria necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles que será invertido en la compra de maíz, trigo, quinua, cebada, haba, arveja, cuy, gallina, carnero, chompas, faldas, blusas, polos, pantalones.

Sus ahorros los utilizará en la construcción de su casa y para la educación de sus hijos. Los sueños de Maria son construir su casa, tener un negocio más grande con capital propio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Maria needs a loan for 2500 soles which she will invest buying maize, wheat, quinoa, barley, broad bean, peas, guinea pigs, chickens, sheep, skirts, blouses, polo shirts, pants.  (Maria necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles que será invertido en la compra de maíz, trigo, quinua, cebada, haba, arveja, cuy, gallina, carnero, chompas, faldas, blusas, polos, pantalones.)

loans.name: Maria  Haydee

texts.es:
Mrs. S. has worked selling dairy products for 10 years. She started in this activity because the small business she tended to in her house was not working for her because her income decreased every day. Because of that, she moved to the market, and that is where she requested a loan to CEPRODEL who offered her a helping hand financially for her business.

Right now her biggest dream is to improve the conditions in her locale and continue the business, which has allowed her to support her family day to day.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. S. se dedica a la actividad de venta de productos lácteos desde hace mas de diez años e inicia esta actividad por iniciativa de que el pequeño negocio que atendía en su casa no le resultaba ya que los ingresos disminuían cada día mas y por tal razón se traslada al mercado y es ahí donde solicita préstamo a CEPRODEL quien le extiende su mano amiga y le financia para su negocio.

Actualmente su mayor sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su local y seguir en su negocio que le ha permitido el obtener el sustento diario de su familia.

loans.use: Buying materials for business (Compra  de materiales para su negocio)

loans.name: Maria   Ofelia

texts.es:
Mrs. Correa P. has worked selling tortillas for twelve years.

She started in this activity since she was a very young girl, because her mother taught her this business as a way to support her family.

To date, the financial loans she has requested from CEPRODEL have helped her buying raw materials with cash, which allows her to offer a better product to her customers.

With this business she helps support her family. her greatest hope is that her children achieve a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. C. P. se dedica a la actividad de venta de tortillas desde hace doce años.

Iniciándose en esta actividad desde muy niña ya que su señora Madre le enseña este negocio como una alternativa de sustento familiar.

Actualmente con los aportes financieros que solicita en CEPRODEL le han ayudado en la compra de materia prima al contado lo que permite ofrecer un mejor producto a su clientes.

Con este negocio se ayuda en el sustento de su familia y su mayor esperanza en que sus hijos mejoren su calidad de vida.<

loans.use: Buying materials for her business (Compra  de materiales para su negocio)

loans.name: Vilma's Group

texts.es:
Esperanza, Vilma and Juana belong to the communal bank Generosidad (generosity) for 1, 5, and 1 years respectively.

Esperanza is 42 years old, has 3 children, and has worked selling food walking through the streets of the Nery Garcia market for 5 years. She used to sell fruit, but she left that business because profits were low. On her part, Juana is 51 years old, has 6 children, and has worked selling food walking through the streets of the Nery Garcia market for 7 years. Vilma has a small cafeteria in an institution of the city of Ayacucho. She used to travel to fairs carrying basic needs products and food, but she stopped that business because it was very heard.

Esperanza, Vilma, and Juana, need loans for 600 soles each. They will invest their loans in buying rice, oil, plates, potatoes, pasta, soft drinks, cookies, chocolate bars, vegetables, and pots.

The dreams of Esperanza, Vilma, and Juana are to build their homes with a good material, having a larger business, and that their children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Esperanza, Vilma y Juana pertenecen al Banco Comunal Generosidad desD. hace 1, 5, 1 año respectivamente.

Esperanza tiene 42 años y 3 hijos y venD. comida ambulatoriamente en el mercado Nery García desD. hace 5 años. Anteriormente vendía fruta pero dejó este negocio porque no tenía muchas ganancias. Por otro lado Juana tiene 51 años y 6 hijos y venD. comida ambulatoriamente en el mercado Nery García desD. hace 7 años. Mientras que Vilma tiene un cafetín en una institución D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Antes viajaba a las ferias llevando abarrotes y comida, pero dejó D. realizar este negocio porque era muy difícil.

Esperanza, Vilma y Juana necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles cada una, que serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, aceite, platos, papa, fideos, gaseosas, galletas, chocolates, verduras y olla.

Los sueños D. Esperanza, Vilma y Juana son construir su casa D. material noble, tener un negocio mas granD. y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.

loans.use: Esperanza, Vilma, and Juana, need loans for 600 soles each to buy rice, oil, plates, potatoes, pasta, soft drinks, cookies, chocolate bars, vegetables, and pots. (Esperanza, Vilma y Juana necesitan préstamos de 600 soles cada una, que serán invertidos en la compra de arroz, aceite, platos, papa, fideos, gaseosas, galletas, chocolates, verduras y  olla.)

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Bùi Thị Lơ, 45 years of age, has been a member of TYM Fund for 9 years. Before joining the fund, her family was in poverty. Whole family relied on only a half acre rice paddy. Income was about 50USD a month. After joining the fund, she took out loans from the fund to invest in wood handcrafting. Her three grown sons also help the family business. The business, in fact, is booming now and the income is steady at 125USD a month. Mrs. Lơ would like to take out a loan of 575USD to purchase more wood.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Bùi Thị Lơ, 45 tuổi, là thành viên năm thứ 9 của Quỹ Tình thương. Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị gặp rất nhiều khó khăn, cả nhà 5 người chỉ trông vào 4 sào ruộng. Thu nhập lúc đó khoảng 50USD/tháng. Sau khi vào Quỹ chị mạnh dạn vay vốn đầu tư vào làm nghề chạm gỗ mỹ nghệ và làm thuê gia công hàng cho một số chủ hàng. 3 con chị Lơ đều đã trưởng thành nên hỗ trợ rất tích cực trong công việc này. Hiện nay ngành nghề đồ gỗ đang phát triển nên chị Lơ rất muốn được vay thêm vốn về để mua gỗ về làm hàng và bán. Chị dự định sẽ xin vay 575USD ở vòng vốn tới. Thu nhập hiện tại của chị là 125USD/tháng.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Mrs. Maritza has worked in the sale of various products since her own adolescence since she would help her respected mother in this same business.

Witht the financing of CEPRODEL she come to better the condition of her business, purchase merchandise for cash, which allowed her a greater profit and with that contributed to the maintenance of her household.

One of her dreams is that her children progess by means of their studies, for which with great sacrifice she sends them to college that they can better their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Maritza se dedica a la actividad de venta de varios productos desde su adolescencia ya que le ayuda a su señora madre en este mismo negocio.

Con los financiamientos de CEPRODEL ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, compra su mercadería al contado lo que le permite una mayor ganancia y con ello contribuye al sustento de su hogar.

Uno de sus sueños es que sus hijos progresen por medio de sus estudios a quienes con mucho sacrificio los envía al colegio para que mejoren su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise - Compra  de mercadería

loans.name: Ta Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ta Thi C., 43 years old, is a participant of the Fund since 2003. She is living in Lam town, Y Yen district, with her husband and 2 children. Because small rice field did not bring about enough income, Mrs. C. stayed at home and carved wood while her husband went doing carpentry for others. When she just joined the Fund, she borrowed 125 USD to buy wood; however, it was a small amount of loan so she still had to work for other businesses. Now, when she is used to weekly repayment method of the Fund, and her husband is no long working for other people, she intends to borrow 575 USD to buy wood to make furniture at home.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Tạ Thị C., 43 tuổi, là thành viên tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2003. Chị hiện đang sống ở thị trấn Lâm, huyện Ý Yên cùng chồng và hai con. Do ruộng ít không mang lại thu nhập nên chị C. ở nhà nhận hàng chạm gỗ về làm còn chồng chị đi làm mộc thuê. Khi mới tham gia vào Quỹ chị xin vay 125USD để lấy gỗ song mức vốn thấp nên vẫn phải đi nhận làm gia công cho các chủ hàng. Đến nay khi đã quen với cách hoàn trả tuần của Quỹ, chồng chị lại không đi làm thuê nữa, chị dự định vay số vốn là 575USD mua gỗ về làm tại nhà.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Martha  Del  Carmen

texts.es:
Previously, Señora Martha had a small grocery store in her home, but as her income diminished, she looked for another way to keep working and to help her family economically. She decided to start selling fruits in a market. She has done this activity for six years now, during which she has invested in her location. Along with her husband, she attends to their small business that is the source of economic support for their family.

During the last two and half years, Martha has obtained 12 loans from CEPRODEL, who has been her helping hand in developing her business. They have contributed financial support to the progress of her business, which has let her increase her inventory, improve the infrastructure of her location, and contribute day after day to the economic support of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Anteriormente la Señora Martha se dedicaba a atender una pequeña pulpería en su casa , pero al disminuir sus ingresos busca la forma de seguir trabajando para ayudar económicamente a su familia y decide trasladarse a vender frutas en el mercado, en esta actividad ya tiene 6 años durante los cuales ha invertido en su local y en conjunto con su esposo atienden su pequeño negocio que es la base económica del sustento de su familia.

Durante los últimos dos años y medio ha obtenido doce prestamos con CEPRODEL que ha sido su mano amiga en desarrollo de su negocio, al contribuir con su aporte financiero en el progreso de su negocio al permitirle el incremento de su inventario, mejoras en la infraestructura de su local, y así día a día se gana su sustento y el de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Tran Thi S., 55 years old, joined the fund since 1998. Before, because of having too many children, Mrs. S. had to stay at home to do house chores while her husband went working for others in Thanh Hoa. Her family life at that time was very difficult. When she started joining the fund, she invested the loan in breeding animals and got a small profit. However, because of small breeding area, she could not expand her project. During recent years, regional people’s businesses are better than before, thus, carpentry has developed. Mrs. S. discussed with her husband and decided to invest borrowed money to buy wood. Since she changes her activity, her husband does not have to work away from home anymore. She carves the wood into furniture and her husband makes tables and chairs. Her business goes very well. Because of heavy workload, she has to hire 4 more workers. This time, she wants to borrow 700 USD to buy more wood, to increase the amount of products.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Trần Thị Sắc, 55 tuổi, tham gia vào quỹ từ năm 1998. Trước đây do nhà đông con nên chị Sắc chỉ ở nhà lo nội chợ trong khi chồng chị đi làm thuê ở Thanh Hóa. Cuộc sống gia đình chị khi đó gặp rất nhiều khó khăn. Khi bắt đầu vào Quỹ chị Sắc đầu tư vốn vay vào chăn nuôi và cũng thu được một khoản lợi nhuận nhỏ. Nhưng do diện tích đất ít nên dự án không mở rộng được. Những năm trở lại đây kinh tế của dân cư tại địa phương cũng khá hơn trước nên nghề làm đồ gỗ như đóng bàn ghế ngày càng phát triển. Chị Sắc đã bàn với chồng và quyết định vay vốn đầu tư mua gỗ về làm hàng. Từ khi chuyển đổi ngành nghề, chồng chị Sắc không còn phải đi làm thuê xa nhà nữa. Chị là người chạm gỗ còn anh làm hàng bàn ghế. Hàng hóa bán chạy, công việc nhiều nên chị Sắc còn thuê thêm 4 nhân công. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay thêm 700USD để mua thêm gỗ, tăng lượng hàng sản xuất.

loans.use: Buy wood

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Señor Luis is 30-years-old. He is single and lives with his parents in their own home. He is the source of economic support for their family. He makes a living buying and selling all types of clothing for women, men, and children.

Luis is one of the suppliers of the stores in his city. Among the garments that he sells are: t-shirts, pants, shirts, shorts, and socks.

He is requesting a credit to be able to buy a large batch of merchandise that is being offered to him at a good price. If he succeeds in acquiring this merchandise, he will be able to offer better prices to his clients since their sales are rather high right now.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El señor Luis tiene 30 años, el es soltero y vive con sus padres en una casa propia siendo él, el sustento de su familia. Luis se dedica a la compra y venta de todo tipo de ropas ya sea para damas, caballeros y niños.

Luis es uno de los proveedores de las tiendas de la cuidad. Entre las prendas que vende podemos citar: remeras, pantalones, camisas, shorts, medias, entre otros.

Solicita el crédito para poder comprar un lote grande de mercaderías que le ofrecieron a un muy buen precio, si el logra adquirir esta mercadería, podrá ofrecer mejores precios a sus clientes ya que en esta época las ventas son bastante altas.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for women, men, and children

loans.name: Renaldy

texts.es:
Renaldy works renting computers because she couldn't find a job, so she decided to invest her small savings and a loan from CEPRODEL in this business, which contributes to supporting her family.

One of her goals is to improve his locale's conditions, buying a photocopier machine to offer a larger variety of services to her customers, who come to her business in search of those services.

Renaldy is hopeful of the development of her business because with the financial help offered by CEPRODEL she is able to offer better computer rental services to her customers and in this way support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Renaldy, se dedica al servicio de alquiler de computadoras por circunstancias de no encontrar empleo y decide invertir un pequeño ahorro y un préstamo que le aporta CEPRODEL en este negocio, el cual le contribuye al sostenimiento de su familia.

Una de sus metas es mejorar las condiciones de su local, comprar una fotocopiadora para brindar una mayor variedad de servicios a sus clientes varios que acuden a su establecimiento en busca de sus servicios.

Renaldy, tiene esperanzas en el desarrollo de su negocio ya que con el aporte financiero que le ha brindado su mano amiga CEPRODEL le permite el brindar un mejor servicios de alquiler de computadoras a sus clientes y de esta forma ha logrado el sustento de su familia.

loans.use: Buying computers for his business (Compra  de computadoras  para  su negocio)

loans.name: Reyna  Del  Rosario

texts.es:
20 years ago Reyna decided to invest a small savings she had gathered with much sacrifice, and was able to invest in the purchase of dairy products. Today her business has grown little by little and with the financial support of Ceprodel she is able to increase her inventory, offer more variety of products to her customers, and improve her and her family’s quality of life.

As Reyna is a single mother, this small business has enabled her to support her son, and her greatest wish is that he completes studies at the university so as to better his quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Reyna hace 20 años decide invertir un pequeño ahorro que con mucho sacrifico logra reunir y lo utiliza para invertirlo en la compra de productos lácteos, hasta la fecha su negocio ha ido progresando poco a poco y con el aporte financiero de CEPRODEL logra aumentar su inventario, ofrece mas variedad de productos a sus clientes y mejora sus condiciones de vida y el de su familia.

Siendo la Sra. Reyna madre soltera con este pequeño negocio ha logrado sustentar a su hijo y su mayor anhelo es que corone una carrera universitaria para que mejore su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Mrs. Gregoria Sanbria is a 65-year-old widow, mother of 6 grown up children. One child still lives with her, and her grandchildren help her out in her business.

Mrs. S. opened her general store 12 years ago. With this business, she was able to raise and provide an education for her children, who now have their own small businesses.

In the future, Mrs. S. would like to broaden her business with the help of loans from Fundación Paraguaya, buying more equipment such as refrigerators and freezers. At this time, she is requesting this loan in order to buy milk, meat, sugar, noodles, and rice, among other things, since sales considerably increase this time of year.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Gregoria S. tiene 65 años, es viuda, tiene 6 hijos, todos mayores de edad, de los cuales uno de ellos vive con ella, además de sus nietos que la ayudan con el negocio.

La Sra. Gregoria hace ya doce años que formo su despensa con los cuales crío y educo a todos sus hijos quienes también ya poseen sus propias micro empresas.

Para más adelante, la Sra. Gregoria desea ampliar la infraestructura de su negocio comprando más elementos de trabajo como congeladores y heladeras con la ayuda de los créditos que le otorga la Fundación Paraguaya. En esta oportunidad, solicita el crédito para comprar mercaderías como leche, carne, azúcar, fideos, arroz, entre otros ya que en esta época del año aumentan considerablemente las ventas.

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, meat, milk, noodles, rice, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Rosa  Cristina

texts.es:
Previously Mrs. L. was a housewife but because of unforeseen circumstances her husband lost his job which forced her to make and sell typical Nicaraguan food to sustain the family.

She has been doing this for 24 years now, and her business has been growing little by little with the financial support of Ceprodel she is able to increase her inventory to buy merchandise at wholesale and better her and her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Anteriormente la Sra. L. se dedicaba a cuidar su casa pero por circunstancias imprevistas su esposo queda desempleado lo que ocasiona que se dedique a la venta de comida típica nicaragüense para lograr sustentar a su famita.

En esta actividad ya tiene 24 años, hasta la fecha su negocio a ido progresando poco a poco y con el aporte financiero de CEPRODEL logra aumentar su inventario al comprar su mercadería al contado y mejora sus condiciones de vida y el de su familia

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.es:
Eliseo is 60 years old, married to Mrs. Maria Benítez, and they have four adult children, of whom one works with Eliseo along with a son-in-law. The other children are professionals, they are independent, working and living in their own homes.

Eliseo makes wooden handles for tools, such as rakes, hachets, and shovels; he has been doing this for 25 years and employs 4 people.

He is asking for a loan to purchase wood and some tools.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Eliseo tiene 60 años, esta casado con la Sra. Maria Benítez y tienen cuatro hijos mayores de edad de los cuales uno trabaja con él y además un yerno. Los demás hijos son todos profesionales, trabajan de forma independiente y viven en sus propias casas.

El señor Eliseo fabrica manijas de madera para herramientas de trabajo, como la asada, el hacha y la pala; y ya van 25 años que tiene su fabrica y emplea a 4 personas en total.

Para comprar maderas y algunas herramientas, Eliseo hoy está solicitando el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase wood and some tools

loans.name: Sofía  Del  Socorro

texts.es:
Mrs. Martinez works selling dairy products since she was very young; she's been working alongside her parents since she turned 8 years old.

With the loans she obtained from CEPRODEL she has been able to set up her business better and offer a variety of products to her customers.

In addition, the loans allow her to buy in cash and thus offer a better price to her customers.

One of her goals is to progress little by little in her business which will allow her a better quality of life as well as improving her house's roof.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. M. se dedica a la actividad de venta de productos lácteos desde muy pequeña quien tiene que trabajar con sus padres desde que cumple los ocho años de vida.

Con los financiamientos que obtiene de CEPRODEL le han permitido el acondicionar mejor su negocio , ofrecer una variedad de productos a sus clientes.

Además los financiamiento le permiten la compra en efectivo y ofrece un mejor precio a sus clientes.

Una de sus metas es ir progresando poco a poco en su negocio lo que permite un mejor nivel de vida familiar así como mejorar el techo de su local.

loans.use: Buying materials for her business (Compra  de materiales para su negocio)

loans.name: Teresa  De  Jesús

texts.es:
Mrs. Teresa G. has been selling dairy products with the help of her husband for 14 years, during which time she has succeeded in supporting her family and improving their quality of life.

With the help of loans from CEPRODEL, she has managed to increase her inventory, which has permitted her to offer her customers a wider selection of goods, in turn leading to greater profits, and consequently a better quality of life for her family.

One of her dreams is to see her children obtain a college degree thanks to the economic contribution made possible by her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Teresa con un pequeño aporte de su esposo decide dedicarse a la venta de productos lácteos desde hace 14 años, tiempo en el cual ha logrado sostener a su familia e ir mejorando su calidad de vida..

A través de los financiamientos obtenidos en CEPRODEL ha logrado el incremento de su mercadería lo que permite ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes y por ende permite un poco mas de ganancia e ir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.

Uno de sus sueños es lograr que sus hijos obtengan una carrera universitaria, a través del aporte económico de su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of goods for her business

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es:
Twenty five years ago Mr. Vidal invested his savings of C$2.000 in a small dairy product business. Through all this time and with the financial support of CEPRODEL he has had a stand in the market. It has allowed him to improve his family style of life as well as his business.

He is asking for a loan of $225 and will pay it in 4 months. At the moment Mr. Vidal thinks that with financial support he will keep progressing little by little in his business as in his family’s life.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 25 años el Sr. Vidal decide invertir sus ahorros de C$ 2,000 en un pequeño negocio de productos lácteos.

A través del tiempo y con el apoyo del financiamiento de CEPRODEL se ubica en un local en el mercado lo que le ha permito el mejorar sus condiciones de vida el de su familia y el de su negocio.

Actualmente el Sr. Vidal manifiesta que con apoyo financiero va a logara progresar poco a poco tanto en su negocio como en su vida familiar.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Yelba Del Carmen

texts.es:
Previously Yelba had a small grocery store in her home but because of the low income she decided to open a hardware store five years ago. She began this business with her savings and economic support from her husband.

As her business is the primary economic source for her family she decided to locate it in the market and she considers the unconditional financial support from Ceprodel key to the development and success to both her business and family. She has a history of 4 loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Anteriormente la Sra. Yelba atendía un pequeño negocio de venta de abarroteria en su casa pero por lo bajo en los ingresos decide dedicarse a la actividad ferretera hace cinco años. Este negocio lo inicia con sus ahorros así como un aporte económico de su esposo.

Siendo su negocio el pilar de la economía de su familia decide ubicarlo en el mercado y considera que el apoyo financiero incondicional de CEPRODEL ha sido fundamental en el desarrollo y prosperidad tanto de su negocio como el de su familia. Ella tiene un record de 4 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: Purchase materials for her business

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda is 59 years old and lives with her husband Sindulfo Mongers, who 10 years ago suffered a stroke which left him semi-paralyzed.

Leonarda started this business with the help of her husband and the contribution of her salary as a teacher. The grocery store is 20 years old. Leonarda is a retired teacher and she reinvests the income she receives into the business.

She has an established clientele and her grocery store is well known in the city. She needs a loan to invest in remodeling and fixing up her business locale.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Leonarda tiene 59 años, vive con su esposo Sindulfo Monges quien hace 10 años sufrió derrame cerebral, dejándolo semi paralizado.

Leonarda, se inició en el negocio con la ayuda de su marido y el aporte de su sueldo como profesora. La despensa cuenta con 20 años de antigüedad, ella en la actualidad es Docente Jubilada y los ingresos que percibe los reinvierte en el negocio.

Actualmente cuenta con clientela formada y su despensa es bien conocida en la ciudad. Necesita del crédito ya que piensa invertir en la refacción de su local comercial.

loans.use: fixing up commercial locale (refacción del local comercial.)

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Mrs. A. sells vegetables such as: yucca, quiquisque (hybrid potato and yucca plant), hard squash, chayote (prickly pear or christophine), onions, tomatoes, and potatoes. This business is the economic base that supports her family and she started it 10 years ago with all her savings.

At first she was a traveling saleswoman, selling her vegetables in bus terminals and from one side to the other at the market until a year ago when she asked for a loan from CEPRODEL. This loan allowed her to establish a locale that, although it may not have the best conditions, at least keeps her from being a traveling saleswoman.

Consider that this financial help has been the economic pillar that has allowed the development of her business and improved the quality of life of her family. She hopes to improve the conditions of her locale little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. A. se dedica a la venta de verduras tales como: yuca, quiquisque, ayote, chayote, cebolla, tomate, papa. Este negocio es la base económica donde se sustenta su familia y en el cual decide invertir hace 10 años todos sus ahorros.

Inicia su negocio ambulante ofreciendo sus verduras en la terminales de buses y de un lado a otro en el mercado hasta que decide hace un año el solicitar financiamiento y es por medio del apoyo de CEPRODEL que ha logrado el establecerse en un un local que aunque no tiene las mejores condiciones por lo menos ya no anda ambulante.

Considera que el apoyo financiero ha sido el pilar económico que la ha permitido el desarrollo de su negocio y a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y espera ir mejorando las condiciones de su local poco a poco.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana has a grocery store in the market. Previously her business was located in her home but because of low sales she decided to change locales.

With time she decided to ask for financing to increase her business’s inventory and offer a greater variety of products at a better price to her customers.

With the financing obtained from Ceprodel she has been able to improve the conditions of her locale and she wants to take advantage of this season to increase her inventory.

With her business she contributes to her family’s sustenance and sends her children to school.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Juana se dedica a la actividad de venta de abarroteria ubicada en el mercado. Anteriormente su negocio lo tenia ubicado en su casa pero por lo bajo en las ventas decide cambiarlo de lugar.

En el transcurso del tiempo decide solicitar financiamiento para aumentar el inventario de su negocio y ofrecer mayor variedad en sus productos así como un mejor precio a sus clientes.

Con los financiamiento obtenidos en CEPRODEL ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de su local y desea aprovechar esta temporada para aumentar mas el inventario.

Con su negocio contribuye al sustento de su familia y le permite el que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Karla

texts.es:
Mrs. Karla M. B. began her walking food-sales business with an initial loan of $300.00. She invested the money in the purchase of seafood for cocktails which she sold in the bus terminals.

With the economic support of CEPRODEL, Karla has managed to develop her business so that currently she has an enclosed store where she waits on her clients.

One of her goals is to gain better air conditioning for her establishment in order to bring her clients better service. She also hopes that through the financial support of CEPRODEL she will be able to purchase refrigeration equipment (freezers) for keeping her products cold, since currently she must store food with neighbors who allow her to rent freezer space.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Karla inicia esta actividad ambulante con un préstamo inicial de $300.00 los que invierte en la compra de mariscos para hacer cócteles y los vende en las terminales de buses.

Con el apoyo económico de CEPRODEL ha logrado el desarrollo de su negocio actualmente tiene un local cerrado en donde atiende a sus clientes.

Una de sus metas es lograr acondicionar mejor su establecimiento para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y espera que a través del aporte financiero de CEPRODEL le contribuya en la compra de equipo de refrigeración ( Frezers) para guardar sus productos puesto que actualmente lo envía donde unos vecinos quienes le alquilan un equipo de refrigeración para que guarde sus productos todos los días.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Confianza Group

texts.es:
The Communal Bank Confianza (Confidence) began 12 years ago. Currently it has 20 members and they have been through 38 repayment cycles together. The members tell us that in their Communal Bank they have learned to be responsible, punctual, and to invest in their businesses. They also note that the Communal Bank allows them to save money, which is not possible at home.

The women operate varied businesses selling meat, cheese, chicken, sausage, clothes, snacks, cosmetics, small animals and grains. Some also make breads, proviD. taxi service, and make clothing as well as beautiful woven crafts.

Each member of the group has a different story to tell, as in the case of Rene. Rene makes curtains, liners, sheets and clothing, skills that she learned from her parents. Rene began this business with a machine that was her parents; she maD. small items but did not have adequate space. Currently she has a store and uses industrial sewing machines, enabling her to proviD. different services. Rene mentions that the secret is to treat customers well, give them good prices, and be punctual with orders.

Nancy provides a different example. She sells Omnilife products, and began her business selling to family and friends. With the loan that she received from the Communal Bank, she opened an office. Currently she has promoters and ads on the radio. Her business has grown, but her hope is to reach out to the provinces.

The Communal Bank members need different sized loans; some need 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, 800 soles, or 1000 soles, making a total of 11,600 soles in loans.

The loans will be used to purchase chickens, pigs, turkeys, milk, sugar, rice, shirts, pants, jerseys, blouses, wool, thread, flour, cosmetics, corn, wheat, beans, peas, fabric, and other natural products. The earnings will be used to purchase a house, furnish a home, increase capital and contribute to the education of their children. The group members dream of buying their own land, building a house, growing their businesses, adding branches, buying cars, and seeing their children become professionals with economic stability.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal Confianza se inició hace 12 años. Actualmente son 20 socias y ya tienen 38 ciclos juntas. Las socias nos dicen que en su Banco Comunal han aprendido a ser responsables, puntuales, cómo invertir en su negocio y han podido ahorrar porque dicen que en L. casa no se pueD. ahorrar. Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como venta D. carnes, queso, pollo, embutidos, ropa, abarrotes, cosméticos, animales menores, cereales, elaboración D. panes, y también servicios D. taxi y confección D. prendas D. vestir, además D. realizar bellos trabajos D. artesanía en telar. Cada socia tiene una historia diferente que contar, como es el caso D. Rene, que hace trabajos D. confección D. cortinas, forros, sábanas y prendas D. vestir, actividad que aprendió D. sus padres. Rene inició con este negocio con una máquina que era D. sus padres; hacía trabajos pequeños y no tenía un local adecuado. Actualmente tiene una tienda y cuenta con máquinas industriales, realizando diferentes servicios. Rene menciona que el secreto es atender bien al cliente, darles precios cómodos y puntualidad con los trabajos. Por otro lado Nancy que venD. productos Omnilife, inició su negocio vendiendo a sus familiares, amigos y con el préstamo que saco D. su Banco Comunal implementó una oficina. Actualmente tiene promotores y hace publicidad por radio; su negocio ha crecido, pero su deseo es llegar a más provincias. Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos; algunos montos son D. 200 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles, 800 soles, 1000 soles, haciendo un total D. 11,600 soles D. préstamos. Los préstamos los invertirán en L. compra D. pollos, lechones, pavos, leche, azúcar, arroz, polos, pantalones, chompas, blusas, lana, lana, hilos, harina, cosméticos, maíz, trigo, haba, arveja, telas, productos naturales, etc. Los ahorros los utilizarán para comprar una casa, artefactos para el hogar, aumentar su capital y para L. educación D. sus hijos. Los sueños D. las socias son comprar su terreno, construir su casa, ampliar su negocio, tener sucursales, comprar un carro, que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener estabilidad económica.

loans.use: The loans will be used to purchase chickens, pigs, turkeys, milk, sugar, rice, shirts, pants, jerseys, blouses, wool, thread, flour, cosmetics, corn, wheat, beans, peas, fabric, and other natural products.

loans.name: Leonardo  Antonio

texts.es:
Mr. Leonardo G. began his business as a walking orange salesman at the bus terminal market. Through loans he has been able to establish a business locale and to improve the locale’s condition little by little. Leonardo has 8 years of experience and is knowledgeable about orange cultivation. His business allows him to support his family, and one of his goals is to improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Leonardo inicia su negocio ambulante en el mercado en donde ofrece sus naranjas en la Terminal de buses.

Actualmente con los financiamientos obtenidos le permiten el establecerse en un local e ir mejorando las condiciones del mismo poco a poco.

En esta actividad ya tiene Ocho años de experiencia y tiene conocimiento en el cultivo de naranjas.

Con su negocio le permite el sustento de su familia y mejorar la calidad de vida en uno de sus metas.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria  De Jesús

texts.es:
Maria de Jesús began her business selling food in the bus terminal with an initial investment of her life savings of $50.00.

She now has been in this business for 15 and it is necessary to note that the loans from Ceprodel have enabled her to better the conditions of her business, make wholesale purchases of materials that she needs to better the quality of life. Being a single mother this business enables her to support her son.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Maria de Jesús inicia su actividad de venta de comida en la Terminal de buses con los ahorros de toda su vida invirtiendo $50.00 inicialmente.

Actualmente ya tiene 15 años de tener el negocio y es necesario destacar que los financiamientos de CEPRODEL le han permitido mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, la compra al contado de los materiales que necesita así como el mejorar su calidad de vida siendo madre soltera esta actividad le sirve para el sustento de su hijo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Maria  Esperanza

texts.es:
Maria Esperanza began her business selling fried food with money her Mother lent to her. Being a single mother she decided to invest the money in making fried food.

With the loans she has from Ceprodel she has been able to buy materials at wholesale prices, maintain more inventory and her customers have grown once she offered a greater quantity of products/

Her business enables her to support her family and her parents who are elderly and need they need a lot of her support.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Maria Esperanza inicia su negocio de venta de frituras con un dinero que le presta su Madre. Siendo madre soltera decide invertirlos en la elaboración de frituras.

Con los aportes financieros que obtiene en CEPRODEL le han permitido la compra de materiales al contado, mantiene mas stock de inventario y su clientela ha aumentado al ofrecer mas cantidad de productos.

Su negocio le permite el sustento de su familia y el de sus padres que ya son ancianos y necesitan mucho de su apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.es:
Señora Rosenda V. is 56-years-old and is married to Eugenio Ayala, who is 75. They have 4 children, who are all independent.

Señora Rosenda runs a family business, a grocery store, and she has an important variety of merchandise, which she hopes to strengthen during this warm season with a variety of drinks like juice and liquor, in addition to over-the-counter medication, meat, animal feed, etc.

With the support of their children, they have picked their business back up, and it has been the source of income that educates the entire family. They are motivated by the risks and challenges that come with every new undertaking. To be useful to society, family, and oneself is one of the fundamental reasons of living. They want to be part of the challenge of generating opportunities for all Paraguayans.

The money requested will go towards the purchase of merchandise like: meat, soft drinks, juice, beer, cider, mineral water, ice cream, over-the-counter medication, animal feel, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Rosenda V., tiene 56 años, está casada con don Eugenio Ayala de 75 años de edad, tienen 4 hijos, éstos ya todos independientes.

La Sra. Rosenda, administra el negocio familiar, una despensa, que cuenta con una variedad importante de mercaderías, que pretende potenciar para esta temporada de calor con una diversidad de bebidas como refrescos y licores, medicamentos de venta libre, carne y alimentos para animales. etc.

Con el apoyo de sus hijos, han reactivado el negocio que a sido la fuente de ingresos para educar a toda la familia, están motivados por los riesgos y desafíos, que implica todo nuevo emprendimiento. Ser útiles a la sociedad, a la familia, a uno mismo, es uno de los principios fundamentales de existir. Quieren ser parte del desafío de generar oportunidades a todos los paraguayos.

El dinero solicitado será destinado a la compra de mercaderías como: Carne, gaseosas, jugos, cerveza, sidras, agua mineral, helados, medicamentos de venta libre, alimentos para animales, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of meat, soft drinks, juice, beer, cider, mineral water, ice cream, over-the-counter medication, and animal feed

loans.name: Maria  Victoria

texts.es:
Maria Victoria has been selling vegetables for 3 years. She began the business with a little bit of capital from her life savings.

In the beginning she didn’t have enough money selling her products due to bad weather but with a positive outlook she decided to ask Ceprodel for a loan which would allow her to better the conditions of her business by establishing a locale even though the locale was not improved but at least she had a small roof and was not out in the bad weather.

In addition, the loans enabled her to buy merchandise at wholesale and one of her goals it to better the conditions of her locale since the walls are actually plastic and in the winter she suffers from the bad weather of the season.

Being a single mother her little business enables her to support her son and his studies in school.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Maria Victoria se dedica a la venta de verduras desde hace 3 años. El negocio lo inicia con un pequeño capital producto de los ahorros de toda su vida.

En un inicio por no tener el dinero suficiente vende sus productos a la intemperie pero con la mente positiva decide solicitar financiamiento a CEPRODEL lo que le permite el mejorar sus condiciones por lo que se establece en un local aunque le faltan mejoras por lo menos tiene un pequeño techo y ya no esta a la intemperie.

Además, los financiamientos le permiten la compra de mercadería al contado y una de sus metas es mejorar las condiciones de su local ya que actualmente las paredes son de plástico y en las temporadas de invierno sufre las inclemencias de la época.

Siendo madre soltera su pequeña venta le permite el sustento de su hijo y el que estudie.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha sells home-made food, she began her business as a street vendor in the Managua city bus terminal markets.

Over time she decided to ask for financing to open her business in a locale, and Ceprodel provided that support to enable her to develop her business and better her quality of life as she would no longer have to be a street vendor but rather have her own location. One of her greatest dreams is to improve the condition of her locale.

She contributes to her family’s needs and her children can study due to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Martha se dedica a la actividad de venta de comida casera iniciando su negocio ambulante en las terminales de buses en los mercados de Managua.

En el transcurso del tiempo decide solicitar financiamiento para instalar su negocio en un local por lo que manifiesta que el aporte económico que la han brindado en CEPRODEL ha sido decisivo en el desarrollo de su actividad y le ha permitido mejorar la calidad de vida de modo que ya no anda ambulante sino que ahora tiene un local propio y uno de sus mayores sueños es mejorar las condiciones de su local.

Con su negocio contribuye al sustento de su familia y le permite que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Wilfrida

texts.es:
Mrs. Wilfrida C., 47, is married and has 3 school age children. Her husband works at a sawmill in the zone of Santaní, which is far from his home, so he only returns sporadically. She runs a small café located in the Coronel Oviedo district. She offers a wide variety of meals, salads, desserts, and drinks on her menu.

She opened her business in the year 2000, the same year her husband went to work at the sawmill. She took on the challenge and risk of starting and maintaining a small business on her own.

Wilfrida tackles the challenges of life, parenthood, and entrepreneurship while maintaining hope and faith in her future. She is requesting this loan in order to buy soft drinks, juice, beer, cider, wine, mineral water, ice cream, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Wilfrida C., de 47 años, es casada, y tienen 3 hijos, todos en edad escolar, su esposo trabaja en un aserradero en la zona de Santaní, de donde regresa en forma muy esporádica, así es que ella y sus tres hijos comparten la casa donde viven. Ella, administra el copetín, situado en barrio de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, el negocio ofrece un variado menú de comidas, ensaladas, postres, bebidas. etc.

El negocio fue abierto en el año 2000, época en que su esposo fue destinado a trabajar a otra ciudad como empleado del aserradero. Ella asumió el desafío y los riesgos de montar y sostener un negocio sola.

Enfrentar los desafíos de la vida, los hijos, el negocio y seguir con esperanzas apostando con fé en el futuro, es la actitud de Wilfrida. El dinero solicitado será destinado a la compra de mercaderías como: gaseosas, jugos, cerveza, sidras, vino, agua mineral, helados, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of soft drinks, juice, beer, cider, wine, mineral water, ice cream, etc.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Mrs. Martha M. has been selling fruit for the past 10 years. Through loans, she has been able to purchase oranges in bulk and sell them in her neighborhood early in the morning.
