Although she currently has only a small plot at the local market with a plastic roof, she has not lost hope that one day her business conditions will improve.

She believes that Ceprodel’s financial support has been the economic pillar that has allowed her to develop her business and improve her family’s quality of life. She hopes to continue developing her business little by little.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Martha se dedica a esta actividad hace 10 años y es por medio de prestamos que logra adquirir naranjas al contado para venderlas en los barrios aledaños a su domicilio desde muy tempranas horas.

Aunque actualmente tiene un pequeño tramo en el mercado con techo de plástico no pierde la esperanza en que algún día las condiciones de su local se mejoren.

Considera que el apoyo financiero otorgado por Ceprodel ha sido el pilar económico que la ha permitido el desarrollo de su negocio y a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y espera ir mejorando las condiciones de su local poco a poco.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Consuelo  Adalila

texts.es:
Mrs. P. currently sells cakes and cheese bread, as well as medicine and other goods. She has owned this business for over three years. What motivated her to start this business is the fact that her husband’s income was not sufficient to cover the household expenses. They therefore had to supplement their income with other jobs in order to meet the needs of the family, which is made up of 3 children, and the oldest are in secondary school

The business has given them the opportunity to provide schooling for their children, since expenses are large in this stage. Good investments in their business, as well as a periodic restocking of inventory, have helped increase their clientele.

She is requesting this loan in order to increase sales and buy glass display cases to improve cleanliness.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Actualmente tiene un negocio de venta de Pasteles y Quesadillas , además de vender medicina y artículos de consumo , este negocio tiene de tenerlo ya por mas de tres años, lo que la impulso a este negocio es que los ingresos del esposo no cubrían sus necesidades y tenia que conseguir otros para poder hacer frente a las responsabilidades dela familia, ya que su familia la componen tres hijos y los mayores estudian en un nivel superior . El negocio le a dado la oportunidad de poder dar estudio a sus hijos, ya que en esta etapa los gastos son muy grandes, la buena inversión en el mismo y surtirlo cada cierto tiempo a dado mas oportunidades con sus clientes, el financiamiento lo ocupara para poder comprar vitrinas y incrementar la venta delos otros productos varios que comercializa en el caso de las vitrinas le darán mayor higiene al negocio de pan.

loans.use: Purchase of glass display cases

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Mrs. M. sells vegetables such as potatoes, tamarinds, yuca, squash, oranges, chilotes and elotes (maize), a business that has provided basic sustenance for her family and into which she has invested all her savings for the past nine years.

Today, with much sacrifice and effort by way of the CEPRODEL loans, she manages to run a small stand located in the market. She has no walls, just a roof, but has hopes that with CEPRODEL’s help she will be able to improve her place of business.

She considers the financial support provided by CEPRODEL the economic pillar that has allowed her to run her business and improve the standard of living of her family. She hopes to continue to enhance her business day-by-day.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. M. se dedica a la venta de verduras tales como: papas, tamarindo, yuca, ayote, naranjas, naranja agria, chilote y elote, siendo este negocio la base económica donde se sustenta su familia y en el cual decide invertir hace 9 años todos sus ahorros.

A la fecha con mucho sacrifico y esfuerzo logra por medio de los créditos de CEPRODEL instalarse en un pequeño tramo ubicado en el mercado donde no tiene paredes sino únicamente techo pero tiene la esperanza de que con la ayuda de CEPRODEL le permitan el mejorar las instalaciones poco a poco.

Considera que el apoyo financiero brindado por Ceprodel ha sido el pilar económico que la ha permitido el desarrollo de su negocio y a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y espera ir mejorando las condiciones de su local día a día.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Emma Luz

texts.es:
Mrs. J. has ten years of experience in this business. She started up her business with little money, approximately sixty dollars that she reinvested depending on the circumstances of how her products were selling. Her customers are from the city with those among whom she has gained a reputation for the baby clothes she sells. In addition to people who come to shop over the weekend in the center of the city coming from the nearby cantons and hamlets. What drives her to continue day after day in the business is the ability to provide a better education for her two children so that they might have better opportunities in their lives. Mrs. J. has had four loans with Apoyo Integral. Her credit history is very good. Her investments are evident in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra J. tiene diez años de experiencia en este negocio, comenzó su negocio con poco dinero aproximadamente sesenta dólares que fue reinvirtiendo nuevamente conforme fue vendiendo los productos, sus clientes son de la ciudad con los cuales se a dado a conocer pór la ropa para recién nacidos que vende, además de personas que vienen los fines de semana a comprar al centro de la ciudad provenientes de cantones y caseríos cercanos al lugar, lo que la impulsas a seguir día tras día en el negocio es el poder dar una mejor educación a sus dos hijos y a si que ellos tengan mejores oportunidades en su vidas , la señora a tenido cuatro créditos con la institución, su historial crediticio es muy bueno ,sus inversiones son evidentes en el negocio.

loans.use: She will buy children's clothes --pajamas, blankets & indoor clothes, also women's clothes --skirts, blouses-- and men's clothes --pants, shirts and whatnot. - Comprara  ropa para niños pijamas  frazadas y ropa interior  además de ropa para mujer ,faldas  blusas y ropa para caballeros, pantalones  camisas y otros.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es:
Mrs. T. used to be an employee of the business called Zona Franca but because her income was so low and the shift so long she decided to invest her cash in purchasing spices such as raisins, plums, cinnamon, and caramel.

She believes the financing from Ceprodel has been important in the development of her business with its unconditional support and through the financing she has been able to buy merchandise at wholesale prices, offering a better price to her customers and actually finding a small locale where she can sell her merchandise.

One of her goals is to better the condition of her locale, change the roof because it is actually made of plastic, and better the quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. T. anteriormente era una empleada activa de la empresa Zona Franca pero por lo bajo en sus ingresos y las largas jornadas de trabajo decide invertir su liquidación en la compra de especies tales como: pasas, ciruela, canela, y dulce.

Considera que el aporte financiero de CEPRODEL ha sido fundamental en el desarrollo de su negocio quien la apoya incondicionalmente y que través de los financiamiento le permiten la compra de mercadería al contado, ofrece un mejor precio a sus clientes y actualmente cuenta con un pequeño local en donde ofrece su mercadería.

Una de sus metas es mejorar las condiciones de su local, cambiar el techo ya que actualmente es de plástico y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mirna Arely

texts.es:
Mirna’s family group is composed of two children and her life companion. At present they are paying off their house. They live the La Libertad. For the moment she has a tortilla shop in her house. This business allows her to care for her children and to generate a source of extra income extra for the family, since they are paying for their house. Her husband’s income does not cover all the family expenses. The sale of tortillas gives Mirna the opportunity to sell to these same clients sandals, footwear and clothes. When people come to her house to buy tortillas, she can show them the various articles that she sells. She will use the loan to buy corn for the production of tortillas, footwear and clothes for women. Already these are the products that her clients request most.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Su grupo familiar esta compuesto por dos hijos y su compañero de vida, su vivienda actualmente la están cancelando, viven el La Libertad, por el momento tiene una venta de tortillas en su casa, este negocio le permite el estar al cuidado de sus hijos y generar una fuente de ingreso extra para la familia ya que como están pagando su vivienda lo que gana su esposo no alcanza para poder cubrir todos estos gastos familiares, la venta de tortillas le a abierto la oportunidad de poder vender a sus mismos clientes sandalias y ropa a si como calzado, al llegar a comprar a su casa las tortillas ella puede mostrar los artículos varios que vende , su inversión la hará en maíz que es su materia prima para la elaboración de tortillas a si como calzado y ropa para mujer ,ya que son los productos que mas le solicitan.

loans.use: to buy corn for the production of tortillas, women's clothes and footwear, shoes for children and the other products that she sells in her tortilla shop

payments.comment: Mirna was able to pay off her loan early. Thank you for your support!

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Mrs. Lucia H. is 55 years of age, married to Mr. Catalino Maciel, and has 6 grown up children. Lucia was previously a street vendor who sold different types of goods. However, 3 years ago, she was able to open a general store with the help of her husband, who is a carpenter and used his savings to start the business.

She sells essential goods in her general store. She is requesting this loan in order to increase her stock of goods, such as fruits, vegetables, canned goods, noodles, flour, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Lucia tiene 55 años y esta casada con el señor Catalino Maciel y tienen 6 hijos todos mayores de edad. Lucia anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de distintos tipos de mercaderías de forma ambulante, pero hace 3 años logro montar su despensa con la ayuda de su esposo que trabaja como carpintero y le facilito unos ahorros para iniciar su negocio.

En su despensa vende todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad. Solicita el crédito para poder aumentar su stock de mercaderías como frutas, vegetales, productos enlatados, fideos, harina, etc.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Corina

texts.es:
The family group is composed of five children who currently depend from the loan requester. Their income depends on her business and on what her husband contributes. The business has been a great source of help, because being a large family, they require additional income. She has seven years of experience selling tortillas, which has given her some ideas with time. She started only with the tortilla business, but then he decided to start a little store, which she has been stocking with her profits and loans she has obtained for her business. Now she wants to invest in dairy products and corn, because these are the products for which there is high demand for their daily consumption among her customers and neighbors. Her greatest source of inspiration is to help her five children succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

El grupo familiar lo componen cinco hijos que actualmente dependen D. la solicitante sus ingresos dependen del negocio y delo que ayuda su esposo, el negocio a sido una gran fuente D. ayuda ya que por ser una familia numerosa se necesitan otros ingresos, ella tiene siete años D. experiencia en la venta D. tortillas lo cual le ha ido dando ideas con el tiempo inicio solo con la tortillería pero D. ahí decidió poner una media tienda , la cual ha ido surtiendo con la ganancia y los prestamos que a tenido para su negocio, actualmente quiere invertir en lácteos y maíz ya que son productos que son muy buscados para el consumo diario por sus clientes que son los D. la colonia en la cual vive, su mayor fuente D. inspiración en la vida es sacar adelante a sus cinco hijos.

loans.use: buying dairy products and maize for her store

payments.comment: This entrepreneur prepaid the balance on her loan. She is very grateful for your loan and appreciates your support.

loans.name: Silvia Ester

texts.es:
Silvia is a single mother and has 3 children who are the ones she fights for at present. Her only source of income is her business, which she has tried to maintain for several years. It has not been easy with the responsibility of the children. In some cases their illnesses throw everything out of balance and one must use the profits to cover expenses. But, in spite of all this and thanks to the financing she has received, Silvia has been able to supply some products that her clients request. He has had five years experience in the business which has helped her to date to be able to keep up with expenses and give her children the necessary education. With the credit she plans to buy some consumer goods that her clients want so that she can proviD. better service to them and keep them from going to other businesses when they can’t find what they want at her shop.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos que son por quienes lucha actualmente ,su fuente D. ingreso es únicamente su negocio, lo cual a tratado D. mantenerlo durante los años, no a sido fácil ya que con la responsabilidad D. los hijos y en algunos casos las enfermedades la desequilibran y hay que hacer uso D. las ganancias para cubrirlas, pero a pesar D. todo esto, gracias a los financiamientos a podido surtir algunos productos que sus clientes les piden ,tiene cinco años D. experiencia en el negocio lo cual le ayudado hasta la fecha para poder ir saliendo con los gastos y darle la educación necesaria a sus hijos, su propósito con el crédito es comprar algunos artículos D. primera necesidad que buscan sus clientes y a si poder prestar un mejor servició a ellos y no dejar que se vallan a otros negocios por no tenerlos en existencia.

loans.use: To buy corn, rice, and sugar in large quantities as well as cleaning supplies such as detergent, soap, etc.

loans.name: Ana Lidia

texts.es:
In 1993, when Ana Lidia's mother was diagnosed with diabetes, she started looking for a way in which she could acquire money. That is how she started applying facials professionally, since she was a cosmetologist. She started working in a room in her house and little by little, and since her son (who is now 15) needed more money to pay for his schooling, in 1998 she started selling shoes, which is easy for her because her customers are housewives and she offers them a good price.

However, right now Ana Lidia needs two chairs to apply the facials to her customers. This is why Ana Lidia is requesting a loan for US $925, which she is determined to pay in a period of 6 months. With this money Ana Lidia will be able to buy the chairs so her customers can be more comfortable while she applies the treatments, and so they will return more often because of the good work and comfort she offers. With your help, Ana Lidia will be able to support her son.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

1993 cuando a la madre de Ana Lidia se le detectó diabetes comenzó a buscar la manera de poder adquirir dinero, fue así que comenzó a aplicar tratamientos faciales en forma profesional ya que cursó la carrera de cosmetología e inició en un cuarto de su casa poco a poco fue creciendo, y como su hijo quien hoy tiene 15 años necesitaba más dinero para poder costear los gastos de su escuela en 1998 comenzó a vender calzado, ya que se le facilita esta venta por que su clientela son amas de casa y les ofrece buen producto a bajo precio.

Sin embargo actualmente, Ana Lidia necesita dos sillones para poder aplicar los tratamientos a sus clientes. Es por eso que Ana Lidia está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Ana Lidia podrá comprar los sillones para que sus clientes puedan sentirse más cómodos en el momento en el que les aplican sus tratamientos. Y así ellos regresen más seguido por el buen trabajo y la comodidad. Con tu ayuda Ana Lidia podrá sacar adelante a su hijo.

loans.use: Buying chairs for beauty salon

loans.name: Ana Mariela

texts.es:
Ana Maricela is a woman who likes to work very much, but at the same time she likes to be with her children in order to care for them and be sure that they do not get in trouble in the streets. It is for this reason that she started to sell beauty products from a catalog to her friends and neighbors: to be able to earn money for the expenses of her three children who must study and who want to go to the university to prepare for a career.

This is Ana’s dream and the reason that she fights constantly to make her business prosper: With the salary that her husband earns as a security guard and that which she earns from her cosmetic sales, they want their children to study at the university. Ana is requesting a loan of $375 which she promises to repay in six months. With this money Ana Mariela will be able to buy new merchandise to offer to her clients. With your help Ana Mariela will be able to bring up her children to be people of means with better opportunities than she had.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana Maricela, es una mujer a la que le gusta mucho trabajar, pero al mismo tiempo le gusta estar con sus hijos para poder cuidarlos y que éstos no se vayan por el mal camino. Es por eso que comenzó a vender productos de belleza por catálogo entre sus amigos y vecinos para poder sacar dinero para los gastos de sus tres hijos a quienes tiene estudiando y desean que en un futuro estudien una carrera universitaria.

Y con el sueño que tiene Ana, a luchado constantemente para que su negocio prospere y así con el sueldo que tiene el esposo de Ana como guardia de seguridad, y lo que gana Ana con las ventas de cosméticos. Ana está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Ana Mariela podrá comprar mercancía nueva para poder tener productos qué ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Ana Mariela podrá sacar a sus hijos adelante y sean unas personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades que ella.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as cosmetics and beauty supplies for resale

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
In 1992, with the goal of expressing the ideas and opinions of her husband, who is a writer, they created a poetry magazine, which was introduced in a local newspaper and was successful. This is how they started selling and creating magazines and books. Little by little they became better known and they are not a local editorial house.

Because most of their sales are on credit, the flow of cash is slow, and this is why Elsa is requesting a loan for US $1125, which she is willing to pay in 6 months. With this money, Elsa will be able to produce another edition of the magazine and pay the expenses of her house and children. With your help, Elsa will be able to continue her and her husband's dream of having a medium for expression, which little by little grows and becomes stronger.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

En 1992 con el propósito de expresar las ideas y opiniones que tiene su esposo, quien es escritor, crearon una revista de poesía la cuál introdujeron en un periódico local adquiriendo éxito. Y fue así como comenzaron a vender y crear revistas y libros. Poco a poco se fueron dando a conocer y actualmente ya se hicieron una editorial local.

Debido a que las ventas la mayoría son a crédito, el flujo de dinero es más lento es por eso que Elsa está solicitando un crédito de US $1125 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Elsa podrá producir otra edición de la revista y así poder pagar los gastos de su casa y de sus hijos. Con tu ayuda Elsa podrá continuar con el sueño de ella y su esposo de tener un medio de expresión que poco a poco vaya creciendo y adquiriendo fuerza.

loans.use: Buying raw materials to create magazines and small books (Comprar materia prima para elaborar las revistas y libros pequeños)

loans.name: Neyza

texts.es:
Neyza started taking care of her neighbors' children because they work and don't have anyone to leave their children with. She started since she moved to the neighborhood where she is living now, one year ago. In the beginning she took care of 3 children, and her business has been growing so now she takes care of 10 children.

Thanks to her effort, her business promises to increase because it is the only daycare service in her neighborhood. Neyza would like to set up her house better to be able to better take care of the children, and because of this she is requesting a loan for US $925 which she is determined to pay in a period of 6 months. With this money, Neyza will be able to buy toys and educational materials for the children. With your help, Neyza will be able to help the working mothers who have nobody to watch their children, and at the same time help Neyza establish well her daycare.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Neyza inició cuidando niños de sus vecinas ya que trabajan y no tiene con quien dejar a sus hijos. Empezó desde que se cambio a la colonia donde actualmente vive desde hace 1 año, al principio cuidaba 3 niños, su negocio ha ido creciendo hasta completar 10 niños actualmente.

Gracias a su esfuerzo, su negocio promete ir incrementándose porque es la única guardería de su Colonia, Neyza desea acondicionar mejor su casa para poder ofrecerles un mejor cuidado a los niños es por tal motivo que está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, y con este dinero Neyza podrá comprar juguetes y material didáctico de entretenimiento para los niños. Con tu ayuda Neyza podrá ayudar a las madres que trabajan y no tienen con quién dejar a sus hijos, y al mismo tiempo ayudar a Neyza a crecer su guardería y poder establecerse.

loans.use: Buying toys and setting up a space for children (Comprar juguetes y acondicionar un espacio para los niños)

loans.name: San Juana

texts.es:
San Juana sells snack type items because it’s not necessary to dedicate much time and this allows her to have an extra source of income in addition to a full time salaried job that she works during morning hours. In the afternoons, she sets up a small locale outside her home to sell the snacks; and with these to two sources of income it’s easier to cover economic problems.

Now more than ever she needs higher sources of income as unfortunately 2 years ago one of her children suffered an accident that left after-effects, due to the accident he can’t stand for long periods of time. This is just one more motive for Mrs. San Juana to put more effort into her side business so she can pay her child’s expenses such as treatments. San Juana is asking for a $375 loan that she’ll pay back in 6 months. With this money San Juana will be able to buy merchandise and have new products to offer thus acquiring more income. With your help, San Juana will be able to help her son move past his accident and recuperate total mobility.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

San Juana se ha dedicado al negocio de snak porque no es necesario dedicarle todo el tiempo y esto le permite tener un ingreso extra, a parte de tener un empleo con sueldo fijo en el que trabaja por las mañanas y por las tardes pone un pequeño local fuera de su casa, es así que con los 2 ingresos le es más fácil solventar problemas económicos.

Ahora más que nunca necesita de mayores ingresos ya que desafortunadamente hace 2 años uno de sus hijos sufrió un accidente el cual le dejó secuelas y su hijo, debido al accidente no puede estar de pie por mucho tiempo, siendo esto un motivo mas para que la Señora San Juana le ponga mas empeño a su negocio para poder pagar los gastos de su hijo así como los tratamientos. San Juana está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero San Juana podrá comprar mercancía para poder tener nuevos productos que ofrecer y tener la oportunidad de adquirir nuevos ingresos. Con tu ayuda San Juana podrá ayudarle a su hijo para que éste salga delante de su accidente y pueda recuperar su movilidad total.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: José Guadalupe

texts.es:
Jose Guadalupe began selling seasonal fruit when he was 19 years old by helping his dad. After that time, he began working at different jobs, but realized that his work wasn't bringing in enough income to run his home and provide for the expenses for his four children. This is why he decided to re-engage in the sale of seasonal fruit independently. Gradually he is becoming known in his area, especially since with his truck, he can sell door to door to housewives.

But now because of problems in his home, the capital with which to purchase goods has fallen. That, and given that this is high season, he's applying for a loan of $ 575 USD, which he's is willing to pay within 6 months. With this money, Jose will be able to buy seasonal merchandise and parts for his truck (which he uses for the distribution of his orders). With your help, Jose will be able to repair his truck and buy more goods to offer his customers, and in turn help his children move forward to complete their university studies.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

José Guadalupe se dedicó a la venta de fruta de temporada desde los 19 años ayudándole a su papá, después dejó de dedicarse a esta actividad y empezó a trabajar en otra actividad distinta, pero al ver que no tenía los ingresos necesarios para la economía de su hogar y los gastos de la escuela de sus cuatro hijos, decidió nuevamente dedicarse a la venta de fruta de temporada pero independientemente. Poco a poco fue haciéndose conocido en su localidad puesto que con la camioneta que trae recorre todas las colonias para así ofrecerle a los domicilios a las amas de casa.

Sin embargo actualmente por problemas en su casa el capital con el que contaba para la compra de mercancía se redujo. Y por ser temporada alta, está solicitando un crédito de US $575 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero José podrá comprar mercancía de temporada y comprar refacciones para su camioneta en la cual hace el reparto de pedidos. Con tu ayuda José podrá reparar su camioneta y comprar más mercancía para poder tener algo nuevo que ofrecerle a sus clientes y así sacar adelante a sus hijos para que terminen una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: To repair his truck and purchase additional products for his business. (Arreglar su camioneta distribuidora así como comprar mercancía)

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
After looking for a job for several days and not being able to find anything, Concepcion decided to start her own business that would generate income. She decided to work in transportation with a used bus she bought with her savings. In the beginning her income was low, but little by little her clientele grew.

However, right now she is not able to work because her bus is used and has several problems. This has affected her household finances negatively, because she has 4 children to support. This is why Concepcioon is requesting a loan for US $925, which she is willing to pay in a period of 4 months. With this money she will be able to buy spare parts for her bus, and so continue offering the service to her customers. With your help Concepcion will be able to overcome this problem that stopped her business, and at the same time help support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Después de buscar por varios días trabajo y no encontrar, Concepción decidió iniciar su propio negocio que le dejara ingresos, el cual decidió dedicarse a manejar transporte público que con sus ahorro compró un camión usado, los primeros días fueron pocos sus ingresos, pero poco a poco fue adquiriendo clientela.

Sin embargo actualmente no a podido trabajar debido a que su autobús es usado ya tiene varias fallas, y esto está afectando la economía de su casa, puesto que tiene 4 hijos que mantener. Es por eso que Concepción está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses, y con este dinero Concepción podrá comprar refacciones para su transporte, y así seguirle brindando el servicio a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Concepción podrá salir delante de este problema que paró su negocio y al mismo tiempo ayudar a solventar los gastos de sus hijos.

loans.use: repairing her bus (Reparar el autobus)

loans.name: David

texts.es:
After his dismissal from his previous job, David decided, with some small savings, to start selling grocery products outside his house. With help from his wife, his business began to grow. In order to move forward and to provide for his son, (he is currently 10 years old, and goes to elementary school), David and his wife want to create savings so that they can consider sending him to university so that he can have better opportunities than they had. Now, David's business is becoming known in his town, but they would like to have a larger inventory since some of the products his customers request, are not available.

This is why David is applying for a loan of $ 575 USD, which he's willing to pay back within a period of 6 months. With the money he plans to buy some wholesale goods and some new products so that he can offer a greater variety to his clients. With your help David and his family can move forward and be able to help their child with his education and future career.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Después de que fue despedido David decidió, con unos pequeños ahorros, comenzar a vender productos de abarrotes fuera de su casa. Con la ayuda de él y de su esposa comenzaron a crecer poco a poco su negocio. Para poder sacar adelante a su hijo que actualmente tiene 10 años y va a la primaria, sin embargo David y su esposa desean crearle un ahorro para que pueda estudiar una carrera universitaria para que sea una persona de bien y con mejores posibilidades que ellos. Poco a poco el negocio de David se fue haciendo conocido entre los de su colonia. Sin embargo actualmente no cuentan con tanto repertorio de productos como ellos quisieran. Puesto que sus clientes le solicitan productos que ellos no tienen.

Es por eso que David está solicitando un crédito de US $575 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar mercancía por mayoreo además de poder comprar nuevos productos para tener mayor variedad en su negocio. Con tu ayuda David y su familia podrán salir adelante y podrán ayudar a que su hijo estudie una carrera.

loans.use: To purchase wholesale merchandise and additional products for his grocery business. (Comprar mercancía de mayoreo)

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
Unfortunately, Leonor's husband, who was a police officer, died while stopping a bank robbery in their town. Leonor remained to take care of their son, who she fights to take good care of. Her family recommended that she start a business to come out of the depression that she was in from losing her husband and also to have money to pay for her son's education. She started to buy grocery items to sell out of her house. This is how she began growing her grocery business little by little.

Currently Leonor is ready to sell meat, but she needs to buy a meat grinder and a scale to be able to offer these products. This is why Leonor is requesting a loan of $925, to be repaid in 6 months. Leonor will buy these products and therefore be able to offer her clients more variety. Also, her business will grow with the sale of these products. With your help, Leonor will be able to get ahead and take good care of her son.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Desgraciadamente el esposo de Leonor quien era policía murió al impedir que asaltaran un banco de su localidad. Sin embargo Leonor quedó a cargo de su hijo por quien tenía que luchar y salir adelante. En su casa le recomendaron crear un negocio para salir un poco de la depresión de perder a su esposo, además de tener dinero para poder pagar los estudios de su hijo. Comenzó a comprar artículos de abarrotes para vender fuera de su casa. Y así poco a poco fue creciendo su negocio de abarrotes.

Actualmente Leonor está por vender carne, pero necesita comprar una máquina moledora de carne así como una báscula para poder ofrecer estos productos. Es por eso que Leonor está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Leonor podrá comprar sus productos y así poder brindarles más variedad a sus clientes. Además de que su negocio crecerá con la venta de estos productos. Con tu ayuda Leonor podrá salir adelante y sacar adelante a su hijo.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es:
Roberta's husband is a high school teacher, but his salary isn't enough to cover the expenses of their son and their home. This is why Roberta decided to start a business to help her husband. After thinking about it a lot, she decided to start a business of repairing and selling computer equipment, making the most of her and her husband's knowledge.

Nevertheless, Roberta doesn't have enough merchandise to offer to her clients. This is why she is requesting a loan of $925, which she is willing to repay in 6 months. With this money, she will be able to buy more merchandise since technology is changing constantly and her business can't stop evolving. With your help, Roberta will be able to take good care of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El esposo de Roberta es maestro de secundaria. Sin embargo con el sueldo que el gana no les alcanza a pagar los gastos de su hijo y de la casa. Es por eso que Roberta decidió iniciar un negocio para poder apoyar a su esposo. Después de pensarlo bien se decidió por poner un negocio de reparación y venta de equipo de cómputo. Aprovechando los conocimientos de Roberta y su esposo.

Sin embargo actualmente Roberta no cuenta con suficiente mercancía para ofrecerle a sus clientes. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar más mercancía puesto que la tecnología está cambiando constantemente y su negocio no puede dejar de evolucionar. Con tu ayuda Roberta podrá Sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: To purchase more electronic merchandise

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
In 1999, after having lived in common marriage with her partner, and had two little ones, her partner left them without offering anything to support their children. This is why Leticia decided to start selling shoes through catalogues so she could make money to support her children's expenses. Little by little she has become well known in her neighborhood because she goes door to door offering her products.

However, she has covered the whole neighborhood and she thinks it is necessary to expand even more to be able to get more customers. This is why Leticia is requesting a loan for US $925 to be able to buy a used 1997 van so she can distribute the shoes in towns and neighborhoods near her home. Leticia is determined to pay back the money in 6 months, because she is sure that with this expansion she will be able to increase her income and make sure her two children lack nothing. With your help Leticia will be able to support her two children without needing a man in the family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

En 1999 después de haber vivido en unión libre con su pareja y procreado a dos pequeños, su pareja la abandonó sin brindarle algún apoyo para la manutención se sus hijos. Fue por eso que Leticia decidió comenzar a vender zapatos por catálogo para poder sacar dinero para mantener los gastos de sus dos hijos. Poco a poco se a dado a conocer en su colonia puesto que va casa por casa ofreciendo los productos.

Sin embargo ya recorrió toda la colonia y cree que es necesario expandirse más para poder captar más clientes. Es por eso que Leticia está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para poder comprar una camioneta usada de 1997 para poder distribuir los zapatos en los pueblos y colonias cercanas a su casa. Leticia está dispuesta a pagar el dinero en un plazo de 6 meses puesto que está segura que con esta expansión podrá obtener mayores ingresos y así procurar que a sus dos hijos no les falte nada. Con tu ayuda Leticia podrá sacar adelante a sus dos hijos sin necesitad de un hombre en su familia.

loans.use: Buying a van to sell her products (Comprar una camioneta para vender sus productos)

loans.name: María Cruz

texts.es:
Maria Cruz has three children (the youngest is 3 and the oldest is 10). Her husband works as a laborer. On one occasion the youngest son became ill and Maria didn't have money to buy medicine, which caused her to become sad and desperate. This is when Maria decided that it was time that she begin to sell something in order to gain extra income. On the recommendation of her sister, Maria began selling cosmetics through catalogues, and she began to do so through friends and neighbors. Currently, Maria has several clients who purchase items from her regularly. Maria says that sometimes distributors sell beauty products at auction, so this is why she's applying for a loan of $ 475 USD, which she's willing to pay within 6 months. With this loan she'll be able to buy products cheaper and make a larger return when selling to her clients. With your help Maria can grow her business so that her family doesn't have to do without especially should any emergencies arise.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Cruz tiene tres hijos, el más pequeño tiene tres y el mayor tiene 10 años, su esposo trabaja como obrero. En una ocasión el hijo más pequeño enfermó y ni Maria tenían dinero para poder comprar las medicinas, cosa que puso muy triste y desesperada a María es por eso que decidió que era momento de que ella empezara a vender algo para poder tener ingresos extras. Por recomendación de su hermana María comenzó a vender artículos de belleza por catálogo y fue así como comenzó. Poco a poco ofreciéndoles a sus amigas y vecinas. Poco a poco se dio a conocer y actualmente ya cuenta con varias clientas que la buscan para que les surta los artículos.

Sin embargo María comenta que en ocasiones las distribuidoras tienen productos de belleza en remate. Es por eso que María está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María podrá aprovechar las baratas y surtirse de productos para poder ofrecerle a sus clientas. Con tu ayuda María podrá crecer su negocio para que en su familia no falte nada y en especial no falte dinero en el momento de alguna tragedia.

loans.use: To purchase products for her inventory. (Comprar mercancía)

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
For many years Lidia's husband has worked running a Hot Dog cart. They have 5 children to support and her husband's income wasn't enough to pay the expenses of all of their children because Lidia had all of her children in school. For this reason over 5 years ago Lidia established another cart so that she could help her husband. Little by little in their neighborhood Lidia's cart became well-known and people came at night to buy her products and occasionally on weekends she had a good income.

Currently Lidia does not have enough merchandise to make her products and is thus asking for a loan of $375 which she will repay over 6 months. With this money she will be able to purchase merchandise to sell Hot Dogs. With your help Lidia will be able to succeed and help her 5 children to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Desde hace mucho años que el esposo de Lidia trabaja con un carretón de Hot Dog. Sin embargo tuvieron 5 hijos que mantener y lo que ganaba su esposo no era suficiente para pagar los gastos de todos sus niños, puesto que Lidia tiene a todos los niños estudiando. Fue por eso que hace más de 5 años que puso un carretón, para poder ayudarle a su esposo. Poco a poco se fue dando a conocer Lidia en su colonia llega la gente por las noches a comprarles y hay ocasiones por lo general el fin de semana cuando sacan buenas ganancias.

Sin embargo Actualmente Lidia no cuenta con mercancía suficiente para poder elaborar sus productos es por eso que Lidia está solicitando un crédito de US $375 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar mercancía para poder vender Hot dogs. Con tu ayuda Lidia podrá salir adelante y sacar adelante a sus 5 hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to make her products

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Ever since she was little, Flor saw how her family worked selling meals, which gave her many recipes to be able to carry a business of this sort. On one occasion, her two sons came home with lists of school supplies, but her husband did not have money to buy the supplies. It was then that Flor decided to start the business of meals in a little room in her house. She started in 2002 and nowadays she has several customers who request meals.

However, the utensils with which she cooks are very worn out and this is why Flor is requesting a loan for US $925 to be paid in a period of 6 months. With this money Flor will be able to buy new utensils to make her meals faster and with better presentation. With your help Flor will be able to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Desde pequeña Flor vio que en su casa se dedicaban a la venda de comidas, lo cual le brindó muchas recetas y la manera de poder llevar un negocio de este tipo. En una ocasión sus dos hijos llegaron con las listas de útiles escolares, sin embargo el esposo de Flor no tenía dinero para poder comprarle los útiles. Fue ahí donde Flor decidió comenzar el negocio de las comidas en un cuartito de su casa. Y así comenzó en el 2002 hasta hoy ya tiene varios clientes que le solicitan comidas.

Sin embargo los utensilios con lo que cocina ya están muy gastados es por eso que Flor está solicitando un crédito de US $ 925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Flor podrá comprar utensilios nuevos para poder hacer más rápido y presentables sus comidas. Con tu ayuda Flor podrá sacar a su familia adelante.

loans.use: Buying utensils (Comprar utencilios)

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena is married and has three children who are married and with children of their own. She began her business selling underwear and shoes via catalog to family an dfrieds in order to be able to pay her children’s educational expenses until they could do so themselves. Today each one of the children has a job and a family. Nevertheless now the struggle for Magdalena and her husband who works as a bricklayer, is on many occasions they don’t have any money. Therefore Magdalena continues with her business in addition to having the conviction of growing it as she has now air conditioned a space in her home where she will be able to offer her products.

Magdalena doesn’t have a place to store her merchandise so she is asking for a loan of US$925 that will be repaid in 6 months and with this money she will buy some display cases to accommodate her products. With your help Magdalena will be able to grow her business in order to have enough money for her and her husband’s expenses and be able to have a financial future for the two of them.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Magdalena, está casada y tiene tres hijos los cuales ya están casados y varios con hijos. Inició su negocio de venta de ropa interior y calzado por catálogo entre sus familiares y amigos para poder pagar los gastos de educación de sus hijos hasta donde pudieron lo lograron. Actualmente cada uno tiene su trabajo y su familia. Sin embargo ahora la lucha es para Magdalena y para su esposo quien trabaja como albañil. Sin embargo en muchas ocasiones no cuentan con dinero. Es por eso que Magdalena continúa con su negocio además de que tiene la convicción de crecerlo puesto que ya acondicionó un espacio en su casa para poder ofrecer los productos.

Sin embargo Magdalena no tiene en dónde acomodar su mercancía es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar unas vitrinas para poder acomodar los productos. Con tu ayuda Magdalena podrá crecer su negocio para así poder tener dinero para los gastos de ella y su esposo y así poder formar un patrimonio para los dos.

loans.use: Purchase display cases to display her products

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
More than 6 years ago, Margarita found out how people who work natural products work, and she likes it because with what she made as a cleaning lady she did not make enough money to pay for her daughter's school supplies. She needed more money also because her daughter's father does not help them with money. After finding out how the sale of these products works, she started selling them and little by little increased her clientele.

However, right now she does not have enough merchandise to sell, and her customers place orders, so Margarita is requesting a loan for $475, which she is determined to pay in 6 months. With this money Margarita will be able to buy the products so she can sell them to her customers. With your help, Margarita will be able to make her business succeed and offer her daughter a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Hace mas de 6 años que Margarita se enteró de cómo trabajaban las personas que venden productos naturistas y le gusto, puesto que con lo que gana en su trabajo como empleada doméstica no le alcanza para pagar los útiles escolares de su hija. Además de que el padre de su hija nos las apoya con dinero. Después de enterarse comenzó a vender estos productos y poco a poco fue adquiriendo más clientela.

Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con suficiente mercancía para poder vender. Y sus clientes le piden, es por eso que Margarita está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Margarita podrá comprar los productos para poder tener que venderle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Margarita podrá salir adelante en su negocio además de poder brindarle un mejor futuro a su hija.

loans.use: Buying products for her customers (Comprar productos para su clientes)

loans.name: María Antonieta De L

texts.es:
Maria Antonieta is mother of 3 little ones; an 8-year-old, a 4-year-old, and a 3-year-old. Her husband works as welder's aide, and the money he makes is enough to cover the expenses of their three children. In December of 2006, Maria Antonieta started selling natural products, because one of her sisters recommended the products because she had tried them herself and lost a lot of weight, and from that, she became a distributor and later convinced Maria so she would also sell the products. Maria started making a demonstration in her home and little by little acquired more customers. Nowadays she is recognized because of the products she sells.

However, currently, her existing customers have increased their orders, and because of this Maria Antonieta is requesting a loan for US$375, which she will pay in 4 months. With this money Maria Antonieta will be able to buy more products to offer to her customers. With your help, Maria Antonieta will be able to support her children.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

María Antonieta es madre de 3 pequeños, uno de 8 otro de 4 y de 3 años, su esposo trabaja como ayudante de soldador y con el dinero que gana el no les alcanza para pagar los gastos de sus tres hijos. María Antonieta En Diciembre del 2006, comenzó a vender productos Naturistas puesto que una hermana le recomendó los productos ya que ella los había tomado y bajó bastante de peso y a raíz de eso se convirtió en distribuidora de dichos productos, y fue ella la que convenció a María para que ella también se dedicara a venderlos y fue así como empezó, haciendo una demostración en su casa y así adquirió clientes poco a poco. Actualmente ya es reconocida por los productos que vende.

Sin embargo actualmente los clientes que tiene le van pidiendo más y más productos es por eso que María Antonieta, está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero María Antonieta podrá comprar más productos para poder tener qué ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda María Antonieta podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buying products (Comprar productos)

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
Maria de Jesus' husband works as a laborer's aide, which was not enough to pay all the expenses of the household and their three children. In addition, his job is on contracts and sometimes it can take him months to get a new job, so Maria needed to have an extra source of income so they would not be unprotected in case her husband went without a job for a long time. With the help of a comadre (very close female friend) who suggested she sell natural products, she started her business. First she did a demonstration in her home, and that is where she started selling these products.

However, she is being requested more and more products, because through the recommendation of her customers she is acquiring new customers who are placing orders which Maria de Jesus cannot cover. This is why Maria de Jesus is requesting a loan for US $375, which she will pay in a period of 4 months. WIth this money, Maria de Jesus will be able to buy more products to increase her profit and cover all the expenses of her family, who need her so much. With your help, Maria de Jesus will be able to support her family and her business

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

. El esposo de María de Jesús trabaja como ayudante de albañilería lo cual no era suficiente para poder pagar los gastos de la casa y sus tres hijos. Además de que su trabajo es por contratos y en ocasiones tarda meses en encontrar otro contrato es por eso que María necesitaba tener una fuente extra de ingresos para poder obtener dinero y así no quedarse desprotegidos en caso de que su esposo se quede mucho tiempo sin trabajar. Con la ayuda de una comadre que fue quien le recomendó que vendiera productos naturales que comenzó a venderlos. Primero hizo una demostración en su casa y fue ahí donde comenzó a vender estos productos.

Sin embargo cada vez le están pidiendo más productos y con la recomendación de sus clientes tiene nuevos clientes quienes le están haciendo pedidos que María de Jesús no a podido surtir es por eso que María está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero María de Jesús podrá comprar más productos y así acrecentar sus ganancias para poder sacar para los gastos de su familia que tanto necesitan de ella. Con tu ayuda María de Jesús podrá sacar adelante a su familia así como a su negocio.

loans.use: Buying merchandise

loans.name: Oralia

texts.es:
Oralia L. was married and had a young daughter. However, she divorced her husband, remaining in charge of her daughter. This is why she started working as a seamstress.

Twenty years ago, she enjoyed sewing, but back then she did not take it very seriously. After the separation, she had to get into the work more, because it was her job and she had to realize that, because it was her source of income for food and the expenses requires to support her house and her daughter's schooling. Little by little, because the work Oralia does is very good, her clientele grew and grew.

However, right now she has several orders pending because she does not have enough material to do the jobs. This is why Oralia is requesting a loan for US $925, to pay them in 6 months. With this money, Oralia will be able to buy the raw materials necessary to create her products. With your help, Oralia will be able to make this business succeed, as well as offer her daughter a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Oralia L. estaba casada y tuvo una pequeña hija. Sin embargo se divorció de su esposo quedándose a cargo de su hija, fue por eso que comenzó a trabajar como costurera. Hace 20 años que le gustaba la costura pero en aquel entonces no lo tomaba tan enserio hasta que le sucedió lo de la separación y tuvo que trabajar más a fondo porque ya era su trabajo y debía tomarlo como tal, puesto que de ahí tiene que sacar para comer y los gastos que implicaba mantener en pie la casa y los estudios de su hija. Poco a poco y por que el trabajo que realiza Oralia es muy bueno, fue como comenzó a adquirir más y más clientela.

Sin embargo actualmente tiene varios pedidos pendientes puesto que no cuenta con material suficiente para poder hacer los trabajos. Es por eso que Oralia está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Oralia podrá comprar la materia prima para poder elaborar sus productos. Con tu ayuda Oralia podrá sacar adelante este negocio así como poder ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su hija.

loans.use: Buying material to create her products (Comprar material para elaborar sus productos)

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago B. works in radio. Nevertheless this job doesn’t provide enough money to pay his family’s expenses so he began to look for a business to be able to have extra income to pay all his household expenses. After thinking about it, he decided to sell candy and groceries taking advantage of the fact that he has a motorbike to deliver his products. Little by little he became known in the neighborhoods and he himself delivers candy to the houses of the people that have parties and other events.

Nevertheless today he doesn’t have a lot of merchandise because of the Christmas season and he needs to restock for other events so therefore he is asking for a loan of US$575 that will be repaid in 6 months and with this money he will be able to buy merchandise and not have his stock be empty. With your help Santiago will be able to keep his family moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Santiago B. trabaja en la radio. Sin embargo este trabajo no le deja suficiente dinero para poder pagar los gastos de su familia y fue así como comenzó a buscar un negocio para poder obtener ingresos extras para pagar todos los gastos de su casa. Después de pensarlo, se decidió por vender dulces y abarrotes aprovechando que cuenta con una moto que es en la que reparte sus productos. Poco a poco se dio a conocer entre los de sus colonias y el mismo les lleva los dulces a sus casas para las personas que tengan fiestas y otros eventos.

Sin embargo actualmente ya no cuenta con mucha mercancía por la temporada navideña y necesita surtirse para otros eventos que hay por su casa es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $575 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar mercancía para no tener vacío su repertorio. Con tu ayuda Santiago podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Qalsoom's Group

texts.en:
“I have been living in Riawind, Pakistan for the past two decades. I have five children and all of them work except one who is mentally challenged. I look after the house. One of my sons operates a breakfast food stand and we need a loan to purchase stock for it. We have taken loans for this business before and we are able to put food on the table.

I am a group leader as we know each other and are nieghbours and can guarantee repayments. One of them is Nusrat wants to have her husband’s wagon fixed. Shehnaz wants to purchase a buffalo and Gulnaz makes boxes for fruits and vegetables. Suriaya wants to invest in the shoe business and she makes shoe straps.”

loans.use: Buy stock for the food stall

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
“I have been living in Riawind for the past five years with my husband and six children. I want to take out a loan to purchase a buffalo. With the profits, I will build my house for which we have already purchased land.

I want to help other women in my neighbourhood and I know them and guarantee that they will invest loans in their businesses. The other group members include P., who wants to open a public call office at home; Safia, Suriya and Asia will invest the loan in making traditional designs for shoes using sequins.”

loans.use: Purchase buffalo

loans.name: Eeng

texts.en: Eeng H. is a 32-year-old woman who raises duck livestock at her house. She has to raise and fatten them before she can selling them. She can earn up to US$50 per month. Her husband, Apoi, has no fixed income. She requests a $150 loan to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Suryamah

texts.en: Suryamah is a 34-year-old woman whose husband, M., has no fixed income. She sells foods such as noodles, fried snacks, etc., and usually earns US$4 per day. Suryamah is a member of MBK and requests a $150 loan to buy more goods and pay for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her stall

loans.name: Imoh

texts.en: Imoh is a 36-year-old woman whose business is collecting and selling waste and scrap materials. Sometimes she sells spare parts upon request. She earns up to US$5 per day and that is just enough to cover her family's daily needs. Her husband, R., has no fixed income. She requests a $125 loan to expand her business and make it more sustainable. She is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sulastri

texts.en: Sulastri is s 27-year-old woman. Since joining MBK, she has been selling motorcycle spare parts. Her husband, H., has no fixed income. She requests a $100 loan to buy more goods and expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Asminah

texts.en: Asminah is a 33-year-old woman whose her husband, M. used to be the sole breadwinner. But since joining MBK, Asminah has started her own bamboo-matting business at her house. She usually earns US$22 per month. She requests a $125 loan to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Roiyah

texts.en: Roiyah is a 39-year-old woman who has a small shop and sells crackers, snacks, etc.  She usually earns US$12 per day. Her husband, I., has no fixed income.  Roiyah requests a $125 loan to buy more goods to fill the shop. She hopes that this loan could help her cover her family needs and get more income for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her shop

loans.name: Anih

texts.en: Anih is a 38-year-old woman who produces bamboo matting at her house. She usually earns US $21 per month. Her husband, N., has no fixed income.  She is member of MBK and requests a $125 loan to expand her business.  She is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Yeni

texts.en: Yeni is a 24-year-old woman. Before she joined MBK, her husband, M. was the sole breadwinner. But since joining MBK, Yeni started her own bamboo-matting business at her house. She usually earns US$22 per month. She requests a $125 loan to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Amsiah

texts.en: Amsiah is a 48-year-old woman who has a small store that sells snacks, food and drinks, along with household products. She earns up to US$5.50 per day. Her husband, A., has no fixed income. She requests a $150 loan to fill her store with more inventory. Amsiah hopes that she can increase her income for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her store with more inventory

loans.name: Rohaeni

texts.en: Rohaeni is a 35-year-old woman who sells plastic rope and usually earns US$3 per day. Her husband, I., has no fixed income. Rohaeni asks for a $150 loan to expand her business. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
“I live in Riawind, about 50 km from Lahore, Pakistan. I am borrowing money in a group because I and my neighbours want to help each other out. My husband trades firewood used for cooking and my husband needs a loan to purchase stock.

The other groups members include Razia M. whose husband makes sewerage pipes using cement. Subran’s husband makes summer bed sheets and Kausar sells cloth from home. Razia B.’s son wants to purchase an over-lock machine used in making clothes.”

loans.use: Buy stock of firewood

loans.name: Wahid Allah

texts.en:
Wahid Allah lives in district 8 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and educated and lives with his own family. He is a property dealer who rents and sells houses and land. He has good experience and has worked in this business for over 8 years.

Wahid has the responsibility for supporting his family and he wants to expand his business so he wants to take an individual loan to complete his necessary materials so that he can launch his business to make good income for his family.

loans.use: To complete necessary materials

loans.name: Ruhaya

texts.en: Ruhaya is a 37-year-old woman who obtains clothing for re-sale on credit and then goes door-to-door around the village. She usually earns about US$ 2.75 per day. Her husband, S., has no fixed income. Ruhaya is requesting this loan of US$ 150 to expand both her business and her husband's. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her clothing sales business

loans.name: Sarnah

texts.en: Sarnah is a 42-year-old woman. Before she joined MBK, her husband, A. was the only one who worked in the family. But since she joined MBK, she started her own bamboo matting business at her house. She usually earns about US$ 23 per month. She needs a loan of US$ 125 to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her bamboo matting business

loans.name: Kusmawati

texts.en: Kusmawati is a 33-year-old woman who has been selling cosmetics and clothes obtained on credit for a living. She can earn about US$ 5 per day. Her husband, S., has no fixed income.  She needs a loan of US$ 125 to expand her business. Some of the loan will be used to buy more goods and the rest will be spent to expand her husband's business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her little sales business and her husband's business

loans.name: Janiah

texts.en: Janiah is a 45-year-old woman. She sells gasoline and usually earns about US$ 5.50 per day,  just enough for their daily needs. She would like to expand her business and increase her capital by receiving a loan of US$ 150. Her husband, S., has no regular income. Janiah is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To increase the working capital for her little sales business

loans.name: Nuriniso

texts.en:
K. Nuriniso is 41 years old. Together with her husband, who is the entrepreneur, Nuriniso raised two children. The daughter is already married and independent of the parents and the younger son is still living with their parents.

Nuriniso has been running the drug store already for 7 years. She sells only certified medicines. The drug store is located in the center of the city which allows her to have many clients and customers. Nurinisso has been the client of IMON for about one year.

Now she requests a new loan. As a result of expansion of the business and consequent increase of income, and with the help of the loan, Nuriniso is planning to open one more drug store. Being very accurate person by nature, Nuriniso would like to ensure the lenders that she is able and ready to pay the loan in 4 months.

loans.use: Opening a new drug store

loans.name: Hanati

texts.en: Hanati is a 52-year-old woman who sells fresh fruit such as jackfruit. She usually earns about US$ 5 per day.  Her husband, A., has no fixed income. Hanati is requesting a loan of US$ 125 to expand her business, as well as her husband's business. She hopes that this will earn them more income for their children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her little fresh fruit business

loans.name: Husnul

texts.en: Husnul K. is a 37-year-old woman who has been collecting and selling waste and scrap materials as her business. She can earn about US$ 12 per day. Her husband, Inen, has no fixed income. She is requesting a loan of US$ 125 to expand her business and she is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her little recycling business

loans.name: Soleha

texts.en: Soleha is a 41 year old woman who began a food stall after becoming a member of MBK. She sells meat balls and snacks at her stall, earning US$5.50 per day which is just enough for her daily needs. Her husband, S., has no fixed income. Soleha would like a IDR 700,000 loan to expand her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her business

loans.name: Houwayda

texts.en: Houwayda is a 36 year old woman who lives with her family in the region of Nabatieh, in South Lebanon. Houwayda sells cosmetics. This is the second time she is asking for a loan from A. Majmoua. She needs $400 to buy enough merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy enough merchandise

loans.name: Sarhani

texts.en: Sarhani is a 40 year old woman who has a small food shop from which sells snacks, food and drinks, along with household products. She can earn US$5.50 per day. Her husband, M., has no fixed income. She requests a IDR 800,000 loan to expand her business. Sarhani hopes that she can increase her income for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her business

loans.name: Ecih

texts.en: Ecih is a 46 years old woman. She sells vegetables at home, earning US$11.50 each day. Previously, she sold food, but that business did not grow enough so she would like to concentrate on vegetable sales further. Her husband, S., has no fixed income. She requests a IDR 1,100,000 loan to add capital to her business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To add capital to her vegetable business

loans.name: Salem

texts.en:
Salem lives in the region of Nabatieh, in South Lebanon. He is 35 years old. Salem fixes cars' steering wheels. He also sells wheels and offers wheel maintenance services.

Salem needs $1200 to purchase the needed material for his business sustainability and development. He is planning to get married and the additional income will help him pay for the wedding expenses.

loans.use: To purchase the needed material

loans.name: Rumsinah

texts.en: Rumsinah is a 47 year old woman. She sells vegetables door-to-door around the village, earning US$11.50 each day. Previously, she sold food, but that business did not grow as expected so she would like to concentrate on vegetable sales further. Her husband, I.,  has no fixed income. She requests a IDR 1,200,000 loan to expand her vegetable business and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her vegetable business

loans.name: Unaejah

texts.en: Unaejah is a 34 year old woman who has a small shop from which she sells snacks, household goods, cigarettes, and many other things. She can earn US$44.50 per day, due to the amount and variety of goods she has in stock. Unaejah requests a IDR 1,400,000 loan to fill her shop with more goods. Her husband, M., has no regular income, so she has to work hard for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her shop with more goods

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti R. is a 31 years old woman who has a small shop from which she sells snacks, household goods, vegetables, cigarettes, rice and many other things. She can earn US$44.50 per day, due to the amount and variety of goods she has in stock. Siti R. requests a IDR 900,000 loan to fill her shop with more inventory. Her husband, Dahlan, has no regular income, so she has to work hard for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her shop with more inventory

loans.name: Napsiah

texts.en: Napsiah is a 37 years old woman with three children. She has a small shop from which sells rice, snacks, vegetables etc... She usually earns US$10 per day. Her husband, N., has no fixed income. Napsiah requests a IDR 700,000 loan to buy some goods to fill her shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy some goods for her shop

loans.name: Ooy

texts.en: Ooy is a 42-year-old mother of 2 children, aged 30 and 25. She makes and sells an Indonesian salad called “gado-gado”, working from her small food stall from 8 am until the evening. She also sells meat balls and chicken noodles at her house. She usually earns US$30 per day. Her husband, S.,  works in the factory and can earn US$70 per month. Ooy is a member of MBK and requests a IDR 800,000 loan so that she can earn more income for her children’s education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of food stall business

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Despite Tanzania's being a "developing" country, it is amazing how many people have mobile phones here -- not just professionals, but grandmothers in villages, school kids and street sellers. These phones are the only form of phone communication available to most people, because there are few landlines, and they are relatively inexpensive to own and use.

Selina N. is one of the many sellers trying to satisfy Tanzania’s insatiable appetite for anything mobile phone-related. She owns a phone from which people can make calls, and sells phone credit and accessories (such as batteries, chargers, earphones and cases). Selina requires a loan of $275 to purchase more of this stock. At just 38 she is already a widow, and the business enables her to support her two children, Issak, 19, and Barnaba, 15.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback."

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of phone accessories for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
In Dar es Salaam there is no government-run public transport, so the equivalent are dalla dallas, minibuses that are owned by private individuals and subject to loose regulations. Mary K. owns a number of dallas and employs drivers and conductors to run the often crowded vehicles. Mary established the business in 2005 and requires a loan of $275 to have some repairs done on the vehicles so that they can continue to run well (a day off the road means big losses). She and her husband, James, have two daughters, Neema, age 8, and Anna, age 3.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback."

loans.use: To service her business vehicles

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
The foresight and insight of people who have never received any training in business management can be amazing. Stationery sales is a business where such wisdom is demonstrated, with most sellers strategically placing their shops, stalls, tables or bodies strategically near to post offices, banks, schools and universities.

Jane M. is no exception. In 2006 she established a business selling stationery, which continues to provide her with a steady income. She now requires a loan of $275 to purchase additional stock, such as paper, envelopes, tape, pens and papers.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback."

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of stationery

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Salama G.. In 2005 she established a food processing business, where she produces chili sauces, mango chutney, honey and a range of other condiments and sauces. She now requires a loan of $450 to expand her range of delicious products. Salama is a widow and has four grown-up children. She cares for two of her grandchildren, Nandi, age 11, and Johary, age 9.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback."

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients in bulk for her food processing business

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Romana M.. In 2000 she established a business selling flour, oil and beans, staple foods in Tanzania, that provides a steady income. Romana requires a loan of $700 to purchase additional stock in bulk and expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback."

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of flour, oil and beans in bulk

loans.name: Ari Mpya A Group

texts.en:
Ashura, age 47, is married with 4 children (ages 25, 12, 20, and 18). She owns a fruit and vegetable stand, which she began three years ago. Each month, she makes a profit of about $200 from this business.

Ashura is a member of subgroup Ari Mpya, which totals 20 members. Her subgroup hopes to take out a loan in order to enhance their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ari Mpya B Group

texts.en:
Vicky, age 30, is married with 3 children (ages 10, 7, and 3). She is a food vendor, and has had this business for 5 years now. She makes a profit of about $250 a month from selling various types of food.

Vicky is a member of the group Ari Mpya B and she hopes to share a loan with her subgroup members to enhance her business.

loans.use: To increase food stock

loans.name: Maenih

texts.en: Maenih is 46 year old woman. Before joining MBK, her husband, M. was the only one who worked in the family. Since joining MBK, Maenih started her own bamboo-matting business from her house. She usually earns US$23 per month. She needs a IDR 1,000,000 to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion bamboo matting business

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en: Fatimah is a 39 years old woman. Before joining MBK, her husband, Y. was the only one who worked in the family. Since joining MBK, Fatimah started her own bamboo matting business from her house. She usually earns US$20 per month. She needs a IDR 1,100,000 to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her Bamboo matting business

loans.name: Alfiah
