texts.en: Alfiah is a married 27 year old woman. She has a small shop from which sells snacks, and a little household items. She usually earns US$5.50 per day and earns a small profit. Her husband, Y., is a tailor with no regular income. Alfiah needs a IDR 1,300,000 loan to buy more goods for her shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop

loans.name: Nanih

texts.en: Nanih is a 53-year-old woman who has a small shop from which she sells snacks, household goods, cigarettes, rice and many other things. She can earn $44.50 per day, due to the amount and variety of goods she has in stock. Nanih requests a IDR 700,000 loan to fill her shop. Her husband, M., has no regular income, so she has to work hard for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her shop

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena B. is a Trader who is into the selling of oil and Rice. She is not married; she is focused on establishing herself. Most people in her location can not afford to buy the 50kg and 25kg bag of Rice, so she buys the bags of Rice and then sells them in the quantity her costumers can afford. Business is going on very well and she wants to increase her sales but she lacks capital to meet her target.

Helena is asking for $1,200 as an additional capital to buy more bags of Rice and oil to meet the growing demand of her costumers.

loans.use: As an additional capital to buy more bags of Rice and oil to meet the growing demand of her costumers.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima M. is a trader who sells “kenkey”, a native Ghanaian food which is commonly eaten by travelers and manual workers because it can sustain them throughout the day. Fatima is married to a trader whose daily income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family. They have no children. Fatima is working very hard to support her husband with the family’s finances. She wants to increase her sales so that she can improve upon her income.

She is asking for $1,200 as additional capital to buy more corn dough, fish, oil and other raw materials for her food production.

loans.use: Buy more corn dough, fish, oil and other raw materials for her food production

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina B. is a trader who sells food supplies (cooking oil, canned foods, washing and toilet soaps and other items). Christina is a single parent of two children. Her current income is not sufficient to meet the financial needs of her family. She therefore wants to increase her sales to improve her income. She is asking for $1,200 as additional capital to buy more food supplies for her shop.

loans.use: Buy more food supplies for her shop.

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Fredy is 20 years old, originally from the City of Juliaca. He comes from a poor and hardworking family. For the past three years he’s been working in a company that sells and delivers residential gas tanks. He starts work at 6:00 am and finishes at 8:00 pm everyday of the week.

He would like to go back to school and learn a technical skill. Since his schedule is really hectic during the day, he would like to study at night. This is the reason why he comes to you seeking a loan, so he can start going to school and look for a better future. He will pay this loan in full in a period of 6 months.

Translated from Spanish to English by Mayra Villegas, Kiva Volunteer

Fredy es un hacendoso joven de 20 años de edad, desde hace tres años viene trabajando en una empresa privada de venta de gas, exactamente en el área de distribución de gas a domicilio. Él como el resto de sus compañeros de trabajo inician su labor diaria a las 6:00 de la mañana y la culminan a las 8:00 de la noche, todos los días a la semana.El deseo de este joven muchacho, proveniente de un humilde hogar de la ciudad de Juliaca, con grandes deseos de superación, es estudiar por las noches después de concluir su labor diaria, una carrera técnica, con el fin de alcanzar su superación personal. Es por esa razón que recurre a tu buen corazón y hace la solicitud de un préstamo de dinero que se compromete a reembolsar en un lapso de seis meses.Este empeñoso joven requiere de tu pronta ayuda para salir adelante.

loans.use: Registration and first month tuition for the college where Fredy would like to go.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Surrounded by her customers we see Mrs. Dina, selling her delicious and nutritious quinoa and maca juices. She starts her business daily routine at 4:00 am and finishes at 11:00 am; this business has allowed her to improve her life style and has innumerable plans for her two children’s future.

Her kids are her first priority and that’s why she’s asking for your help to expand her business increasing the amount of sales and this way she’ll be able to save money to send her kids to college. With your help she’ll be able to achieve her dreams.

Quinua: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quinoa

Maca: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maca

Translated from Spanish to English by Mayra Villegas, Kiva Volunteer

Rodeado de sus asiduos clientes encontramos a la señora Dina, vendiendo afanosamente sus deliciosos y nutritivos jugos de quinua y maca, esta empeñosa madre con innumerables planes para la vida futura de sus dos menores hijos, quienes son la razón de su esfuerzo diario, inicia la venta cotidiana de sus deliciosos néctares a las 4:00 de la mañana culminándola a las 11:00 a.m.Este negocio le ha permitido mejorar su condición de vida y sobre todo ofrecerle una buena educación a sus pequeños retoños. La señora Dina observó que podía mejorar la cantidad de sus ventas, es por esa razón que tiene proyectado ampliar su puesto de negocio, cree que con esta ampliación mejorará aún más su situación económica, para finalmente concretar uno de sus más grandes anhelos observar a sus pequeños convertidos en unos excelentes profesionales con un futuro promisorio.Con vuestra ayuda podrá conseguir la meta que se ha planteado.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz is 28 years old and immediately after finishing her high school she started working to contribute with the household expenses and help support her younger brothers. Three years ago she started selling underskirts and vests.

Thanks to her dedication and persistence her sales have increased. She buys her merchandise in the city of Juliaca and brings it to Cuzco, where she has most of her clients. She is asking for this loan in order to increase the amount and variety of merchandise she takes to sell to Cuzco and this way she will increase her income; offering her parents and smaller brothers a better life style. Luz is seeking for your support to help improve her financial situation.

Translated from Spanish to English by Mayra Villegas, Kiva Volunteer

Luz es una joven de 28 años de edad. Inmediatamente después de concluir sus estudios secundarios se puso a trabajar desempeñando diferentes actividades con el fin de apoyar a sus padres en la solvencia económica de su familia. Actualmente se dedica a la comercialización de enaguas y chalecos, negocio en el que ya ha cumplido tres años dedicación y con el que gracias a su diligencia y empeño va teniendo mucho auge y popularidad.Ella adquiere su mercadería en la ciudad de Juliaca, luego las lleva para comercializarlos al Cuzco y el deseo de esta empeñosa joven es incrementar la cantidad y variedad de sus productos con el fin de obtener mayores ingresos económicos para brindarles comodidad y bienestar a sus queridos padres y hermanos menores.Luz confía que con tu apoyo desinteresado su situación económica mejorará.

loans.use: Increase the quantity and variety of merchandise

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma is a young mother of a small six year old daughter. Upon noticing that the situation with the father of the small girl was very uncomfortable and damaging to the young one, she decided to separate from him. Since then, her small girl Emily has given her strength to move forward. She works incessantly selling ceviche, a type of seafood salad, and chicken broth in a small space that she has rented. Thanks to the effort, dedication and patience that she invests in the preparation of her delicious dishes, she is achieving good results in a short period of time. The wishes of this hard working mother is to further fix up her small place of business to make it more comfortable and elegant for her customers. This is the reason she is requesting this loan which she promises to repay in six months. Thanks to her perseverance and your support she will be able to see her business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Vilma es una joven madre de una pequeña niña de seis años., Al observar que la situación con el padre de su pequeña era muy incómoda y perjudicial para su pequeña, decidió separase en común acuerdo con éste. Desde entonces su pequeña niña Emily le da fuerzas suficientes para seguir adelante, trabaja incansablemente vendiendo ceviche y caldo de pollo en un pequeño local que alquiló. Gracias al empeño, dedicación y paciencia que pone diariamente en la preparación de sus agradables platos, está obteniendo en poco tiempo muy buenos resultados.El deseo de esta trabajadora madre es implementar aún más su pequeño espacio de ventas con el fin de brindarles mayor comodidad y elegancia a sus clientes. Por esa razón desea obtener un préstamo de dinero que se compromete a reembolsarlo en un lapso de seis meses.Gracias a su perseverancia y a tu importante apoyo podrá contemplar el crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Expansion of her small place of business

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian has always identified herself as a very active woman. She's from the city of Cuzco but, due to family reasons, she's been living in Juliaca. She is currently living with her mother in company of 3 of her 4 kids. She set up shop in a small section of the house in which she sells canned goods and drinks. She runs this business from 8am until late hours of the night with the help of her children. She always dreamed of having her own business, which is why she is very happy at this moment. However, she would like to increase her inventory since she has lots of customers. She hopes to get the loan she requested and promises to pay it back within six months. With your support and Lilian's effort you will be able to offer her kids a good education and improved lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

L. señora Lilian, desD. siempre se identificó como una mujer y madre muy activa, elL. es natural D. L. ciudad D. Cuzco pero por cuestiones familiares radica en Juliaca.Actualmente vive en el domicilio D. su madre en compañía de4 sus tres hijos y un espacio que acondicionó se dispuso a aperturar su pequeña tiendita D. venta D. abarrotes y bebidas, negocio que atienD. desD. las 8:00 D. L. mañana hasta altas horas D. L. noche con apoyo siempre D. sus queridos hijos.Siempre soñó con contar con su propio negocio, por lo que ahora se siente muy feliz, sin embargo le es menester implementar y aumentar aún más L. cantidad D. mercadería puesto que tiene gran clienteL..A fin D. que su negocio surja como elL. lo espera requiere recibir tu importante apoyo con el firme compromiso D. retornarlo en un período D. seis meses.Con tu apoyo y el esfuerzo que Lilian realice podrá brindarle una buena educación y mayor bienestar a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase more items of better quality  for her store

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
Emiliana is a humble mother, with low economic resources which barely allowed her to complete her education. She got married at teh age of 18 years old with great hopes and dreams of starting a family. Unfortunately, she was emotionally and physically abused by her husband. He did not watch over the children who he gave life to. Finally, after many years, she was able to break free. Her children have grown up and gave her the moral support she needed. She separated from her husband and opened the store she always wanted, she offers canned goods. She runs this store from a small area in her home. She requests a loan to purchase more goods for her business. This hard-working mother requests your help and support in order to move ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Emiliana, es una humilD. madre, sus bajos recursos económicos apenas le permitieron concluir sus estudios primarios, contrajo matrimonio a la edad D. 18 años con muchas ilusiones D. formar un hogar donD. reine la unión y amor familiar, desafortunadamente su esposo la maltrataba física y moralmente sin ninguna contemplación con sus dos hijos, quines desD. muy corta edad constantemente recibían agravios del hombre que les dió la vida.Después D. muchos años D. sufrimiento ahora con apoyo incondicional D. sus hijos ya mayores finalmente pudo separarse D. su esposo y abrir su tiendita D. abarrotes en su pequeño y humilD. domicilio, desD. entonces con la tranquilidad ya recuperada desea progresar y ocuparse completamente D. la atención D. su bodeguita. Es por esa razón que hace la solicitud D. un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra D. artículos D. primera necesidad para comercializarlos en su pequeña bodeguita.Esta empeñosa madre requiere D. tu apoyo para salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of high-quality, high needs products

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Over 30 years ago, Eleuteria left her hometown, Sicuani, to find a better future. Since then she has worked effectively doing many different things thanks to her ability to learn innumerable jobs and taking advantage of each opportunity. With the little savings she had, she began manufacturing mattresses. Currently, with this small workshop, she provides work for 4 other men who with much patience and hard work carefully produce the mattresses which later will be sold nearby. At the beginning this business did not appear very profitable due to the large competition already in the market, but finally after much diligence and due to the good quality materials they used, they have been making great progress and successfully have shown growth in their business. Eleuteria, mother of two small children, wishes to continue the progress they have maD. and take the local market. This is why she requests a loan. Your generous support will be well invested in the hands of Mrs. Eleuteria.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace más D. 30 años Eleuteria, salió D. su pueblo natal, ,Sicuani, en busca D. un mejor futuro. DesD. entonces se desempeñó eficientemente en diversas actividades, gracias a ello pudo aprender innumerables oficios y sacando provecho D. cada uno D. sus labores, con el poca cantidad D. dinero ahorrado que poseía aperturó un taller D. confección D. colchones.Actualmente con esta pequeña fábrica, brinda trabajo a otros cuatro caballeros, quienes con mucha paciencia y diligencia van confeccionando cuidadosamente los colchones que luego ofertarán a sus paisanos.En un principio esta actividad no parecía ser muy rentable porque existían muchos competidores en el mercado, finalmente con mucha diligencia y debido a los buenos materiales con los que están confeccionados han ido progresando ampliamente en su oficio, contemplando satisfactoriamente el crecimiento D. su negocio.El deseo D. Eleuteria madre D. dos pequeños niños, es seguir progresando y conquistando el mercado local, para eso requiere obtener un préstamo D. dinero que después D. tu aporte generoso será muy bien invertido en las manos D. la señora Eleuteria.

loans.use: Purchase additional materials for the production of her excellent mattresses.

loans.name: Bernarda

texts.es:
Mrs. Bernarda C. M. is 48 years of age and has a small basket and candy stand in the Santa Bárbara market in the city of Juliaca. She started her business 29 years ago. At first, she only sold candy, but now, thanks to her great initiative and perseverance, she has found a way to generate more income for her family through this business. Since getting a separation from her husband—who never stopped giving her economic support for her children’s schooling—Bernarda, like all mothers who worry about their offspring, has always looked for ways to generate extra income to sufficiently cover her 4 children’s higher education. She is proud to say that they are all independent now and have professional careers. This concerned mother’s wish is to finish providing a post-secondary education for her youngest son. In order to accomplish this feat, she would like to keep dedicating her time and effort to her business. Bernarda needs your help to realize her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Bernarda de 48 años de edad, tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de canastas y golosinas en el mercado Santa Bárbara de la ciudad de Juliaca, inició su negocio hace 29 años, en un principio sólo vendiendo golosinas pero ahora gracias a su iniciativa y perseverancia con este negocio encontró la manera de generar mayores ingresos económicos para su familia.Desde que se separó de su esposo, quien en ningún momento dejó de brindarle su apoyo económico para la educación de sus hijos, Bernarda como toda madre preocupada por la educación de sus retoños siempre buscó la manera de generar ingresos extras para cubrir satisfactoriamente los estudios superiores de sus cuatro hijos, de los cuales tiene la satisfacción de decir que tres de ellos ya son independientes y profesionales.El deseo que tiene esta preocupada madre es terminar de brindarle estudios superiores a su hijo menor y para concretar este anhelo desea seguir dedicándose a su negocio de siempre.Bernarda requiere de tu ayuda para concretar sus anhelos.

loans.use: Purchase of greater amount of merchandise

loans.name: Sonia Ayde

texts.es:
I have a women’s shoes, clothing, and accessories business in my home. I would like to invest in the purchase of more merchandise this season. Thank God I have been able to establish a good group of clients who pay me in installments. My children and I make a living off this business. I got a divorce sometime ago, so now I have to work double for my family. I am requesting $ 1,200.00 USD to invest it in the purchase of merchandise for my business. 
 Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.
“Tengo un negocio en mi casa de venta de calzado, ropa y accesorios para dama, en esta temporada me gustaría invertir un poco en la compra de mercancía, gracias a dios he logrado hacer una buena lista de clientes, los cuales me pagan a plazos de este negocio vivimos mis hijos y yo ya que hace algún tiempo me divorcie de mi esposo así es que ahora hay que trabajar al doble. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para invertir en la compra de mercancía para mi negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Sofía Guadalupe

texts.es:
I have been selling clothes and home products throughout different areas in the city of Nuevo Laredo for 4 years. This business, in which my husband and I work, is my family’s sole source of income. We wish to invest in buying toys for the holiday season without losing profits. We are requesting a loan of $1,200.00 USD in order to buy new toys.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 4 años en la venta de ropa y artículos para el hogar en diferentes partes de la Ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia.En el negocio trabajamos mi esposo y yo. Queremos invertir en juguetes para esta temporada de navidad sin tener que descapitalizarnos. Solicitamos un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la comprar de juguetes nuevos.

loans.use: Purchase of new toys

payments.comment: correction due to overpayment for business 30329

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
I have had my beauty salon for more than 5 years. I mainly do haircuts and hairdos for men and women. I am in need of more furniture and equipment. This business is my family’s sole source of income. I am requesting this loan of $1,200.00 USD to buy beauty salon furniture and equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo ya mas de 5 años con mi negocio de estética mas que nada me dedico al corte, peinados de damas y caballeros me esta haciendo falta mas inmobiliario y equipo. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de mi familia. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls para la comprar de inmobiliario para le estética.

loans.use: Purchase of beauty salon furniture and equipment

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
Mrs. G. has been manufacturing and selling women’s handbags for over 3 years. This is her family’s sole source of income. She would like to buy more materials and a sewing machine so that one of her daughters can help her make the bags, and as such be able to finish her customer’s orders on time. She is requesting a loan of $1,200.00 to buy materials and a sewing machine.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Martha Alicia se dedica a la elaboración y ventas de bolsas para damas desde hace ya más de 3 años. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia. Quiero comprar mas material y una maquina de coser para que una de mis hijas me ayude con le elaboración de las bolsas y así poder entregar los pedido a tiempo. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls para la compra de materia prima y una maquina de coser.

loans.use: Purchase of materials and a sewing machine

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
I have a children’s party entertainment business. This is my family’s sole source of income, and my whole family is involved. I have been in business for over 20 years because it is one of the happiest types of jobs around. My family and I would like to buy a higher capacity sound system in order to provide our customers with better service. I am requesting a loan of $1,200.00 USD to buy the sound system.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Juan Carlos se dedica a la animación de fiestas infantiles. Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de mi familia ya que en el trabajamos todos. Tengo ya mas de 20 años dedicándome a este trabajo ya que es uno de los más alegres trabajos que hay. Mi familia y yo queremos comprar un equipo de sonido con mejor capacidad y así darles un mejor servicio a las personas que contratan nuestro show. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls. para la compra de un sonido.

loans.use: Purchase of DJ sound system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more merchandise for the holiday season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase the number of products they sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of other video machines - Comprar otras maquinas de video juegos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improve his shop and buy an industrial kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more merchandise for the upcoming beach season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversify her product lines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of tires to sell

loans.name: Rosa Ilda

texts.es:
Rosa is 36 years old and has 3 kids. She has belonged to Nobleza Comunal bank for 12 years. In this last 12 years she have saved Money and raised her capital and built her house.

Rosa sells materials used for construction, activity that she learned from her parents. In the beginning she used to re-sell materials provided by her sister and now she brings the materials herself directly from the quarries. Additionally she buys bricks and burns them to get more revenue. Rosa needs a loan of $500, which will be invested in the purchase of concrete, sand and brick. Rosa’s dreams are to buy a car to transport the construction materials, to have a bigger business and that her kids will go to college.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa tiene 36 años y 3 hijos y pertenece al Banco Comunal Nobleza hace 12 años. En estos 12 años en su Banco Comunal ella pudo ahorrar y con ello pudo aumentar el capital de su negocio. Además construyó su casa, y nos cuenta que en su Banco Comunal aprendió a ser responsable, puntual, solidaria y a compartir. Rosa vende materiales de construcción, actividad que aprendió de sus padres. En un inicio vendía materiales que le proveía su hermana pero en la actualidad Rosa trae los materiales directamente de las canteras. Además compra los ladrillos sin quemar y ella misma se encarga de quemarlos. Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles que será invertido en la compra de hormigón, arena y ladrillos. Los ahorros de Rosa son para pagar las letras del mototaxi que compró hace 1 mes. Rosa sueña con comprar un carro para trasladar los materiales, que su negocio sea más grande y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Rosa needs a loan of $500, which will be invested to buy concrete, sand and brick.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more auto repair items and put more products out for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase another tricycle for delivering his product

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more fruits to make juice and buy a juicer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more raw materials and a display cabinet to keep her products in

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Luisa's Group

texts.es:
Sabina, Luisa and Yolanda have belonged to the communal bank “Nobleza” (Nobility) for 13, 13, and 12 years respectively. They told us that in the communal bank, they learned to save, to be responsible and punctual, to be united, and to have the respect of other people. Luisa mentioned that upon entering the communcal bank, she learned what a dollar was. Sabina is 50 years old and has 8 children. She has sold meat for 35 years in the F. Vivanco Market in Ayacucho. Additionally, she dedicates herself to fattening animals. Besides these activities, Sabina brings cooking services for various commitments.

Luisa is 40 years old and has 4 children. She sells fruits and vegetables at various market fairs in the region, and at the fairs, she buys grains and young animals to sell in Ayacucho.

Yolanda sells kitchen and household goods on order. At first, she sold cosmetics and jewelry out of a catalog, but she decided to change her business because her earnings were so low. Currently she sells different products according to the needs of her customers, and she brings her merchandise from Lima.

Sabina, Luisa and Yolanda need loans of 1000, 400, and 1200 soles (Peruvian currency) that will be invested in purchasing ram, sheep, pig, hens, guinea pig, animal feed; broad beans, barley, wheat, pea, corn, quilts, blankets, cooking utensils, and sheets. Their savings will be used for the education of their children, an operation for her sickly son, and for the rehabilitation of her disabled daughter. Sabina’s, Luisa’s, and Yolanda’s dreams are to have a store, to have a business that earns them more money, that her daughter will recover, that their children be professional, to purchase some land and build a house, and to live happily.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Sabina, Luisa y Yolanda pertenecen al Banco Comunal Nobleza desD. hace 13, 13 y 12 años respectivamente. Ellas nos cuentan que en su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar, ser responsables, puntuales, solidarias, el respeto a las personas. Luisa menciona que al ingresar al Banco Comunal conoció lo que era el dólar. Sabina tiene 50 años y 8 hijos, y venD. carne hace 35 años en el mercado F. Vivanco D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. También se dedica al engorD. D. animales y además D. estas actividades, Sabina brinda servicio D. cocina para diferentes compromisos. Luisa tiene 40 años y 4 hijos y venD. frutas y verduras en las diferentes ferias D. la región y en las ferias compra cereales y animales menores, que son vendidos en la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Yolanda tiene 33 años y 1 hijo, Yolanda venD. productos D. cocina y D. casa por pedido. En un inicio vendía cosméticos y joyas por catalogo pero decidió cambiar D. negocio porque sus ganancias eran mínimas. En la actualidad venD. diferentes productos D. acuerdo a los pedidos que le hacen sus cliente, su mercadería lo trae desD. Lima. Sabina, Luisa y Yolanda necesitan préstamos D. 1000 soles, 400 soles y 1200 soles que serán invertidos en la compra D. carnero, oveja, cerdo, gallina, cuy, alimento para engorD., haba, cebada, trigo, arveja, maíz, edredones, frazadas, utensilios D. cocina, sabanas. Sus ahorros los utilizarán para la educación D. sus hijos, la operación D. su hijo quien está mal D. salud y para la rehabilitación D. su hija que es discapacitada. Los sueños D. Sabina, Luisa y Yolanda son tener una tienda, tener un negocio que les D. más ganancias, que su hija se recupere, que sus hijos sean profesionales, comprar un terreno y construir su casa y vivir felices.

loans.use: For the purchase of goods to support their three businesses: animals and animal feed; grains and vegetables; household goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversify her product line

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy tables and chairs for his business

loans.name: Thi Duyen

texts.vi:
Mrs. Duyên, 41 years old, and her husband, Đạt, have three school age children. She tends a hardware store while her husband is driving truck. He also helps her tending the store in his spare time. She has this store many years now and keeps a good reputation. She used to take out loans from banks but she would like to join the fund since its financing models fit her financial need better and with lower interest rates. She is applying a loan to replenish her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Duyên 41 tuổi, có 3 con đang đi hoạc. Chị kinh doanh thiết bị điện dân dụng và một số mặt hàng ốc vít. anh Đạt chồng chị làm nghề lái xe, lúc rảnh rỗi cũng giúp chị trông nom cửa hàng. Chị bán mặt hàng này đã lâu và có uy tín. Để mở rộng kinh doanh, gia đình chị cũng vay vốn ngân hàng. Tuy nhiên chị vẫn muốn tham gia vay vốn thêm với chương trình tài chính vi mô vì rất thuận lợi cho chị. Chị vay vốn để mua thêm các mặt hàng mà chị đang kinh doanh để bán.

loans.use: To purchase more hardware for sales

loans.name: Thi Tinh

texts.vi:
Miss Tĩnh, 18 years old, is an hair stylist and a cosmetic trader. Though she is still young, Miss Tĩnh has been doing this for few years. Her mother left her when she was three and she did not have opportunity to go to school. She lives with her father who tends a tea stand at home for living. She would like to take out a loan from Binh Minh because it would lift her confidence and help her learning to save. Her weekly income would easily cover the loan repayments.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Tĩnh 18 tuổi, chị làm nghề cắt tóc và bán mĩ phẩm. Chị rất trẻ nhưng đã làm nghề này được nhiều năm. Mẹ chị bỏ đi khi chị khoảng 3 tuổi vì vậy chị không có điều kiện đi học như những đứa trẻ khác. Một mình bố chị nuôi chị cho đến tận bây giờ. Chị vay vốn để mua thêm hàng mỹ phẩm để bán. Bố chị mở cửa hàng bán nước chè tại nhà. Thu nhập từ việc cắt tóc giúp chị trả dần hàng tuần dễ dàng. Chị thích tham gia vay vốn của binhminh cdc vì nó giúp chị tự tin hơn và học thêm được cách tiết kiệm.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic for sales

loans.name: Musharaf

texts.en:
J. Musharaf is 45 year old lady. Musharaf’s husband is a mechanic. Musharaf and her husband have 3 children of school age and live together with Musharaf’s husband's parents. They both are working hard in order to support this large family and to ensure their children shall have opportunity to have higher education.

Musharaf sells fabrics for sewing national dresses. She has been in this business for more than 30 years. The national dress in Tajikistan is very beautiful and is one of the most important items in the dowry of a girl. Tajikistan is located in Central Asia and the spring is the most beautiful season for this region. When you see all these national dresses it seems that you are admiring the scenery awakening from a cold winter; the green leaves and grasses, bright red and yellow tulips in the mountains, and a blue sky which is so close to you in spring.

Musharaf has a very good taste and she is ready to advise her clients which textile to choose for this or that occasion. That is why she has customers. Moreover, Musharaf’s prices for fabrics are attractive for various levels of the population as she has a wide range of goods for any taste and any wallet.

Now Musharaf needs a loan for purchasing new fabrics. She has been the client of IMON for about 4 years. She was provided with loans for enlarging her range of goods. She has the positive credit history with IMON. Musharaf promises to pay the loan in 4 months.

loans.use: Purchasing of new fabrics

loans.name: Mohiniso

texts.en:
Z. Mohiniso is 45 years old. Mohiniso and her husband, a driver, have a large family. There are 7 members in their family, of whom 3 are dependents and 1 is underage.

Mohiniso sells clothes for kids in the local market. She has been running her business already for 18 years. Mohiniso tries to purchase goods of a good quality. At the same time, the prices for the goods are attractive for the population with average income. Moreover, her trading place is located in a very good place in the market. All these things help her to serve more and more clients from year to year and to make her business successful, which allows her to improve the living conditions of her family.

Mohiniso has been working with IMON already for 4 years. She was provided with several loans for expanding her business. Each time Mohiniso was very precise in the loans payments.

Now she requests $ 400.00 US Dollars in order to buy clothes for kids for the spring which comes in Tajikistan quite early in the beginning of March and sometimes late February. Mohiniso is planning to pay the loan completely in 4 months. She would like to thank everybody who made the decision to support her.

loans.use: Purchasing of new clothes for kids for the season of spring

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en: Mrs. Chuon P., 27, is married and has three little children. She works with her husband on a rice paddy growing rice crops and vegetables earning around $5 each day from selling their outputs to the people in a market. In order to raise her family’s income, Mrs. Chuon P. would like to use this loan to purchase mangoes from the growers and resell them for a good profit. In the future, she hopes to save enough money to purchase a mini-truck so that she will use to buy and carry a large quantity of seasonal fruits from everywhere in her area much faster and easier for sale.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes to sell

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Mrs. Suy K., 51, works with her husband selling clean water to the people in her area, making on average around $2.50 a day of profit. One of her children is currently employed at a garment factory earning $100 each month; another one is a student and the rest are married and live separately.

Mrs. Suy K. seeks this loan to purchase a water pump to facilitate and make her business more productive. (Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Suy K. was unavailable).

loans.use: Purchase a water pump

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Suy Koeun has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana A. is a trader who deals in smoked fish. She is a well known fishmonger at Elmina where she lives. She is married with eight children who assist her in the business during school holidays. Her husband is also a trader. She buys her fresh fish from Axim, Sekondi in the western part of Ghana and smokes them before selling them.

Diana has a lot of customers, but one major challenge that she faces is that she is not able to buy the fish in large quantities because of lack of capital and also, part of the capital is being used as her transportation expenses. She is therefore asking for a loan of US $1,200 to enable her buy the fresh fish in large quantities to enable her meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: She is asking for a loan of US $1,200 to enable her buy the fresh fish in large quantities to enable her meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Kasi Mpya A Group

texts.en:
Salma, age 35, is married with 2 children (ages 7 and 3). She owns a grocery store, which she began 4 years ago. Her business is open from 8am to 11pm daily, and she makes a monthly profit of about $140.

In the past, Salma took out 3 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business. She now hopes for a new loan to start a water business and chicken business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in selling various foods, clothes, and charcoal.

In the picture, Salma is in the front row, third from the left.

loans.use: To start two additional businesses

loans.name: Mount Meru B Group

texts.en:
H., age 42, is married. He owns a timber business which he started 2 years ago. His business is opened from 7a.m to 6p.m daily, and makes a monthly profit of around $27.

He hopes to take a loan with Tujijenge to increase his business. He will be sharing his loan with sub group members who have business dealing in selling charcoal, clothes, tailoring, shop, drinks, tools, and telephone.

In the picture, H. is second from left in the 1st raw.

loans.use: To increase his business

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
I am Nasreen A. from a small, lush, green town - Raiwind, Pakistan. I am married and a mother of six: three boys and three girls. Currently, only three kids attend school while the others are done with their studies. My husband is a painter and one of my sons has had a vegetable business for past six years and we need a loan to expand it.

I have few friends who all are my loan group members and require loans. They are Samina Bibi, Sumaira Bibi, Sughran Bibi and Shaheen Bibi. All of them have vegetables business and need loans to improve and expand them.

loans.use: Expand vegetables business

loans.name: Please Delete Group

texts.en:
Dafroza , age 26, is married with 1 child (age 4). She owns a business of making bread, which she began 1 year ago. She opens her business from 7am to 10am, and makes a monthly profit of about $136.

Dafroza hopes to take a loan with Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business. She will be sharing this loan with her sub group members, who have businesses dealing in selling shop, charcoal, livestock, and stationary.

In the picture Dafroza is in the centre.

loans.use: to increase business

loans.name: Gulbahar

texts.en: Gulbagar is 40-year-old woman who owns a small livestock farm in the southern part of Azerbaijan in Imishli region. She is married and has three children. She has five years of experience in rising livestock and selling to the local bazaar traders for meat production. Now she is s successful businesswoman and she would like to borrow 1200 USD to be repaid over an 18 month repayment period. With this loan she will purchase an additional three cows for estimated cost of 300 USD and she will use the rest of the loan to buy fodder.

loans.use: Going to  purchase additional three cows and fodder.

loans.name: Azad

texts.en: Azad A. is a 35 year old husband and father of two boys from Sabirabad, Azerbaijan. Three years ago, to support his family financially and to bring a necessary service to his region, he started selling clothing at his local bazaar. He has strengthened his business through competitive trading, importing high quality goods from Turkey, and above all by developing strong relationships with loyal customers. To further expand his business he is requesting a loan of 1100 USD, and he needs your help.

loans.use: Going to expand his business.

loans.name: Shukur

texts.en: Shukur is 59 years-old and is farmer who raises sheep in a southern small village in Imishli region. He raises and sells sheep to the local businesses and traders.  He has more than fifteen years of experience in breeding sheep. He is married and has six children. It is very hard to cover the family’s needs, as breeding sheep is the only income in his family. Now he needs $1200, he will repay it in 18 months. He needs this amount to buy more sheep to continue to expand his herd.  He thanks you in advance for the loan.

loans.use: Going to build sheep herd

loans.name: Nazakat

texts.en: Nazakat is a 32-year-old woman who runs her livestock in the small village in the Imishli regions. She started her business in 2003 when she purchased her first calf. Now her business is going well, and she purchase calves and sells it to the local bazaar traders for meat production. Meat is a very popular product all across Azerbaijan and people use meat in their everyday life. Nazakat married and has one son. Breeding animals is the only one source of income in the family and she needs to expand her business and increase financial resources. She needs 1100 USD to purchase one milk cow for an estimated cost of 700 USD and one calf for an estimated cost of 400 USD.

loans.use: Going to purchase one milkier cow and one calve

loans.name: Jafar

texts.en: Jafar is 47-years-old trader who sells cosmetics, cigarettes and different beverages in Sabirabad region. He is married and has two children. He has seven years of experience. He is doing very well in his business, but his store is the only one source in his family and all income he gain he spend on his family needs and he needs additional financial source to expand his business and increase and diversify number of products for selling. He applied for 1200 USD to purchase foods products and increase his income

loans.use: Going to [urchase additional consigment of  foods products and increase his income

loans.name: Jafar

texts.en: Jafar is 47 years old, married, and has two children. He has been selling cosmetics, cigarettes and other beverages to the Sabirabad region for a period of seven years. He is doing extremely well in his business, but his store is the only source of income for his family. In order to expand his business and broaden his customer base, Jafar is applying for a loan of 1200 USD to purchase food products, and increase his income.

loans.use: Purchasing additional consigment of  foods products and increase his income

loans.name: Bayramali

texts.en: Bayramali is a 45 year-old man who runs his small farm in the southern village in the Imishli region. He raises sheep and sells them to the local bazaar traders for meat production. Azerbaijani people like meat very much, especially mutton. It is in very high demand all across country. He works very hard to raise sheep and raise them as healthy animals. He has three years of experience in breeding animals and now he needs more funds to continue to improve conditions for his sheep. He needs 1200 USD for his repayment period of 18 months to build good herds.

loans.use: Going to build good herd

loans.name: Janali

texts.en: Janali is 21-year-old farmer who breeds sheep in the small village of Imishli. He has three years of experience in breeding sheep and selling them to the local bazaar traders. Meat is in very high demand all across the country. Janali has a very small herd and he would like purchase additional sheep to increase his herd, he applied for 1200 USD to purchase 12 sheep for estimated price 60-70 USD, he will use the rest of the money to purchase fodder.

loans.use: To purchase 12 sheep and fodder

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.en: Eldaniz is 31-year-old man who raises livestock in a small village of the Imishli region. He has three years of experience in breeding calves. Now he needs $1200 to expand his farm and purchase additional four claves for cost an estimated $300 each.  He thanks you very much for this opportunity.

loans.use: Going to purchase additional four claves

loans.name: Tariyel

texts.en: Tariyel is 30 years old, married, and has two children. He is a butcher at his own small meat store in the Sabirabad region. He began his business in 2005, and since then, his business has grown tremendously and brings his family support and income. Tariyel is currently applying for 1200 USD to improve his store conditions, and attract more customers.

loans.use: Going to improve his store conditions

loans.name: Gladys Doris' Group

texts.es:
Gladys, Ilda and Marcial have been part of the Virtud Communal Bank for 1, 2 and 1 year respectively. Since they join Virtud Communal Bank they’ve learned to be responsible, punctual and how to encourage their children to save money.

Gladys is 35 years old and has 2 children. She's been selling potatoes in Nery Garcia's produce market for the last 13 years. Ilda is 30 years old and has 3 children. She has been selling emollient for the last 8 years. Martial is 35 years old and has 4 children. He has been working as a construction worker for the last 10 years and he works in Lima city.

Gladys, Ilda and Marcial need a $134 loan each. These loans will be invested in the purchase of potatoes, tile cutter, linaza, herbs, sugar and firewood. Gladys, Ilda and Marcial’s dreams are to send their kids to college, build their own house and expand their businesses.

Emollient: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Emollient

Translated from Spanish to English by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer

Gladys, Ilda y Marcial pertenecen al Banco Comunal Virtud desde hace 1, 2 y 1 año respectivamente. Ellas nos dicen que en su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser responsables, puntuales, cómo educar a los hijos y a ahorrar. Gladys tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, y vende papa en el mercado Nery García, actividad que realiza desde hace 13 años, inicialmente era ambulante y ahora ya tiene un puesto. Ilda tiene 30 años y 3 hijos y vende emoliente ambulatoriamente en un grifo, actividad que realiza desde hace 8 años. Marcial tiene 35 años y 4 hijos y es albañil; realiza trabajos de construcción, actividad que aprendió hace 10 años cuando trabajaba como peón en la ciudad de Lima. Gladys, Ilda y Marcial necesitan préstamos de 400 soles cada uno, que serán invertidos en la compra de papa, cortador para cerámicas, linaza, hierbas, azúcar y leña. Los ahorros de Gladys, Ilda y Marcial son para el futuro de sus hijos, para comprar su terreno y construir su casa. Los Sueños de Gladys, Ilda y Marcial son sus hijos sean profesionales, construir su casa para alquilar y que sus negocios sean grandes.

loans.use: Gladys, Ilda and Marcial need a $134 loan each. These loans will be invested in the purchase of potatoes, tile cutter, linaza, herbs, sugar and firewood.

loans.name: Norma's Group

texts.es:
Norma, Mery and Beatriz have been part of Huascahura Communal Bank for 3, 1 and 3 years respectively. Since then, they’ve learned to be responsible, punctual and how to save money.

Norma is 34 years old and has 2 children. She sells cheese, hens and bread in the Ayacuchana forest fairs and brings fruits from Ayacuchana to sell to Nery Garcia produce market.

Mery is 35 years old and has 3 children. She works in different activities. Sells treats and candies at Huascahura high school entrance, she makes beautiful tapestries and hand maD. doilies that are sold to brokers and on Sundays makes typical Peruvian food to sell in her neighborhood.

Beatriz is 40 years old and has 1 son. She’s been selling groceries and vegetables in the Hatún, Rumi and Pichari fairs for the past 18 years.

They need this loan to invest in the purchase of celery, carrot, onion, potato, sugar, noodle, beverages, flour, hen, cheese and bread. Their dreams are to buy a grocery store, buy a car to transport their produce and to send their kids to college.

Translated from Spanish to English by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer

Norma, Mery y Beatriz pertenecen al Banco Comunal Huascahura, hace 3, 1 y 3 años respectivamente y el Banco Comunal lleva el nombre del lugar D. donD. son las socias. Norma tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Beatriz tiene 40 años y 1 hijo, mientras que Mery tiene 35 años y 3 hijos. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar, a ser puntuales y responsables. Norma venD. quesos, gallina, pan, en las ferias D. L. selva Ayacuchana, y D. L. selva trae frutas, que son vendidos en el mercado Nery García. Por otro lado Mery venD. golosinas en L. puerta del colegio D. Huascahura, y también es artesana textil, realiza bellos trabajos en telar como tapices, pasadizos que son vendidos a los intermediarios, además D. estas dos actividades Mery venD. comidas típicas los días domingos. Mientras que Beatriz venD. abarrotes y verduras en las ferias D. Hatún Rumi y Pichari hace 18 años. Ellas necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 1000 soles, 300 soles, que serán invertidos en L. compra D. apio, poro, zanahoria, cebolL., papa, azúcar, fideos, gaseosas, harina, gallina, queso, pan. Sus ahorros los utilizarán para las emergencias, enfermedad y para incrementar el capital D. sus negocios. Los sueños D. Norma, Mery y Beatriz son tener una tienda D. abarrotes, un carro para trasladar su mercadería y para L. educación D. sus hijos.

loans.use: Norma, Mery and Beatriz need a $650 loan to be invested in the purchase of celery, potatoes, carrots, onions, sugar, noodles, beverages, flour, hens, cheese and bread.

loans.name: Silvestra's Group

texts.es:
Florisa, Rosario and Silvestra belong to the Communal Bank Azucenas for 5, 3, and 10 years respectively. In their Communal Bank they learned to be responsible, punctual, supportive, and to save.

Florisa is 28 years old and has 1 daughter. Florisa sells groceries and vegetables in the markets of Cangallo, Vilcas Huamán and Huamanguilla. She began her business 5 years ago with her first loan from the Communal Bank.

Rosario is 70 years old and has 7 children, and she sells cheese in the different stores and homes in Ayucucho.

Silvestra is 40 years old and has 4 children, she sells wool in a stand in the Las Américas market. Before Silvesetra had a grocery store in her home, but closed it due to lack of sales.

Florisa, Rosario and Silvestra need loans of 1600 soles, 400 soles, and 1200 soles, respectively, which will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, noodles, preserves, oil, milk, carrots, celery, onion, pumpkin, tomato, cheese, wool of different colors and brands. Their savings will be utilized to build a house, to increase capital for the business, and for unforeseen expenses.

Florisa, Rosario and Silvestra have dreams of having a car to transport their products, build their houses, have their own money and be great businesswomen.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

Florisa, Rosario y Silvestra pertenecen al Banco Comunal Azucenas desD. hace 5, 3 y 10 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ser responsables, puntuales, solidarias y a ahorrar.

Florisa tiene 28 años y 1 hija, Florisa venD. abarrotes y verduras en las ferias D. Cangallo, Vilcas Huamán y Huamanguilla. Su negocio se inició hace 5 años con su primer préstamo que sacó D. su Banco Comunal.

Por otro lado Rosario tiene 70 años y 7 hijos, y venD. queso en las diferentes tiendas y casas D. Ayacucho.

Mientras que Silvestra tiene 40 años y 4 hijos y venD. lanas en un puesto del mercado Las Américas. Antes Silvestra tenía una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa, pero lo cerró porque no tenía venta.

Florisa, Rosario y Silvestra necesitan préstamos D. 1600 soles, 400 soles y 1200 soles, respectiamente que serán invertidos en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, fideo, conservas, aceite, leche, zanahoria, apio, cebolla, zapallo, tomate, queso, lanas D. diferentes colores y marcas. Sus ahorros los utilizarán para la construcción D. su casa, para incrementar el capital D. su negocio y para imprevistos.

Los sueños D. Florisa, Rosario y Silvestra son tener un carro para transportar sus productos, construir su casa, tener capital propio y ser grandes empresarias.

loans.use: Florisa, Rosario and Silvestra need loans of 1600 soles, 400 soles, and 1200 soles, respectively, which will be invested in the purchase of sugar, rice, noodles, preserves, oil, milk, carrots, celery, onion, pumpkin, tomato, cheese, wool of different colors and brands.

loans.name: Timotea's Group

texts.es:
Timotea, Ortencia and Esther have been part of Azucenas Communal Bank for 7, 2 and 7 years respectively. Since then, they’ve learned to be responsible, punctual and learned how to save money. Timotea is 47 years old and has 6 children, two of them in high school. Timotea is craftswoman and along with her family make this beautiful work in stone, pieces that are carved in white stone of the zone (Huamanga). Timotea tells us that her family was displaced from her native village Vinchos by political violence and moved to Ayacucho, where she began to work washing clothes, her husband worked carriying groceries for shoppers in fair markets and her son began to work in stone carving. Little by little her son was perfecting his technique and they open a little workshop where the whole family started working. Timotea’s son obtained a loan from Azucenas Communal Bank, which allowed him to buy a cutting machine and now his production has increased. Her family bought a place in the Ayacucho city’s artesian market and now they would like to export their products.

Ortencia is 53 years old and has 9 children. Ortencia tells us that she began selling treats and candies at high school’s entrances and now she has a small grocery store. Additionally, on Sundays she makes typical Peruvian food to sell in local fairs.

Esther is 62 years old and has 10 children. She sells vegetables, spices and fruits in the Putaja fair.

They need a $1075 loan, which will be invested in the purchase of stone, fava beans, corn, rice, sugar, pasta, milk, banana, mango, grape, apple, onion, cilantro, carrot and tomato. Timotea, Ortencia and Esther's dreams are to expand their businesses, export their products, build their house and send their kids to college.

Translated from Spanish to English by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer

Timotea, Ortencia y Esther pertenecen al Banco Comunal Azucenas desD. hace 7, 2 y 7 años respectivamente. Ellas dicen que en su Banco Comunal ellas aprendieron a ser responsables, puntuales, cómo tratar a los hijos y sobre todo el ahorro. Timotea tiene 47 años y 6 hijos, D. los cuales 2 todavía son estudiantes. Timotea es artesana y junto a su familia realiza bellos trabajos en piedra D. Huamanga, piezas que son talladas en piedra blanca D. la zona. Timotea cuenta que su familia fue desplazada por la violencia política D. su tierra natal Vinchos y al establecerse en Ayacucho comenzó a trabajar lavando ropas y su esposo se dedicó a ser cargador en los mercados. Además, Timotea dice que su hijo mayor, que era muy hábil, comenzó a tallar la piedra D. Huamanga. Poco a poco su hijo fue perfeccionando su técnica y fue así que instalaron un pequeño taller y comenzaron a trabajar todos en familia. Con uno D. los préstamos que sacó del Banco Comunal compró una máquina cortadora y actualmente su producción es mayor y tienen un puesto en el mercado artesanal D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Su deseo es formalizar y exportar directamente sus productos. Por otro lado Ortencia tiene 53 años y 9 hijos. Ortencia cuenta que en un inicio vendía dulces en las puertas D. los colegios y actualmente tiene una tienda D. abarrotes y además venD. comida en la feria D. animales los días domingos. Mientras que Esther tiene 62 años y 10 hijos y venD. verduras, condimentos y frutas en las feria D. Putaja. Ellas necesitan préstamos D. 1200 soles, 1000 soles y1000 soles respectivamente, que serán invertidos en la compra D. piedra D. Huamanga, Haba, maíz, arroz, azúcar, fideo, leche, plátano, mango, uva, manzana, cebolla, culantro, zanahoria, tomate. Los sueños D. Timotea, Ortencia y Esther son formalizar su empresa y exportar directamente sus productos, construir y mejorar su casa, dar una buena educación a sus hijos y tener una tienda D. abarrotes.

loans.use: Timotea, Ortencia and Esther need a $1075 loan, which will be invested in the purchase of stone, fava beans, corn, rice, sugar, pasta, milk, banana, mango, grape, apple, onion, cilantro, carrot and tomato.

loans.name: Betilu

texts.es:
Betilu is 30 years old and has two small children, one is 5 years old and the other is 7. Since two years ago she has been a member of the Community Bank Azucenas. Betilu and her husband were born in Amazonas and Plura, respectively, and have come to Ayacucho 5 years ago to work. Betilu and her husband sell crockery and glassware. In the beginning they did not have much merchandise and sold as street vendors in the city of Ayacucho. They sold varied items based on seasonal demand. Currently she has a stall at the Galeria S. Rosa that she manages, her husband at times still sells on the streets. Betilu wishes to be able to rent a space that is centrally located and large to be able to have more customers.

Betilu needs a loan of 3000 soles ( approximately USD $ 1,025) that she will invest in the purchase of covered dishes, stemware, saucepans, tea pots, jars, glasses, cups, knives, mugs, porridge pots, ladles.

Betilu dreams of capitalizing her business, educating her children, owning her place of business, seeing her children become professionals and having a united family,

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Betilu tiene 30 años y 2 hijos pequeños de 5 y 7 años, y es socia del Banco Comunal Azucenas desde hace 2 años. Betilu y su esposo son naturales de Amazonas y Piura respectivamente y llegaron a Ayacucho hace 5 años por motivo de trabajo.

Betilu junto a su esposo vende locería y cristalería y al inicio tenían muy poca mercadería y vendían ambulatoriamente por las calles de la ciudad de Ayacucho; vendían productos variados de acuerdo a la demanda y estación. Actualmente tiene un puesto en la Galería S. Rosa que ella administra y su esposo algunas veces todavía vende por las calles. El deseo de Betilu es alquilar un local céntrico y grande, para poder tener más clientes.

Betilu necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles que serán invertidos en la compra de platos cubiertos, copas, ollas, teteras, jarras, vasos, tazas, cuchillos, tazones, mazamorreros, cucharones.

Los sueños de Betilu son capitalizar su negocio, dar una buena educación a sus hijos, tener un local propio, que sus hijos sean profesionales y que su familia sea unida.

loans.use: Betilu needs a loan of  USD $1,025 to buy inventory, such as covered dishes, stemware, saucepans, tea pots, jars, glasses, cups, knives, mugs, porridge pots, ladles

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria de los Angeles has been selling food for over 2 years. This the main source of income for her family since she is a single mother. Her daughters work with her and help her selling prepared foods. However, they need to purchase more cooking supplies in order to prepare foods at a faster speed. They request a loan for $550 to purchase this equipment.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Maria De Los Ángeles se dedica a la venta de comidas ella tiene ya mas de 2 años con su negocio. Esta es la fuente de ingreso de mi familia soy madre soltera en mi negocio trabajamos una de mis hijas y yo vendemos comida preparada. Pero nos esta haciendo falta más material y equipo de cocina para preparar más rápido los alimentos. Solicito un préstamo de $ 550.00 Dlls para la compra de equipo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es:
I've had my business for over 10 years, I sell new and used clothes. This business is a strong source of income for my family since I'm a single mom. I would like to invest and purchase new clothes and shoes. I request a loan for $500 to purchase more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo ya más de 10 años con mi negocio de venta de ropa nueva y usada. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de mi familia ya que soy madre soltera. Quiero invertirle mas al negocio sin descapitalizarme comprar más ropa nueva y zapatos. Solicito un préstamo de $500.00 Dlls para la comprar de mercancía

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Gusti Ayu Kade Arian

texts.id:
Gusti Ayu Kade Ariyani raises several pigs in her home. With persistance Ayu raises mother pigs. The mother pigs have given birth 3X. With an initial capital of Rp 1,000,000 (Translator's note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp 9,000-9,500.00) Ayu bought 1 mother pig, and after raising for 6 months, this pig gave birth to 7 piglets. Ayu feeds the pigs 2X/day, mornings and evenings. Before feeding, she bathe the pigs and also clean the stalls. She sold them for Rp250,000/piglet, at a nett profit of Rp80,000/piglet, after deducting Feed expenses. She used the profit to pay for living expenses, and her 2 children's school aged education. Now Ayu like to raise additional 1 mother pig and 2 fattening piglets. The hope is that with the loan from Dinari, Ayu could buy feedsock to be raised as mother pig, and the rest for feed expenses.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Gusti Ayu Kade Ariyani memelihara banyak babi dirumahnya. Dengan tekun Ayu memelihara induk babi. Induk babinya sudah melahirkan sebanyak 3 kali. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000,- Ayu membeli 1 ekor induk babi dan setelah dipelihara selama 6 bulan induknya melahirkan anak babi sebanyak 7 ekor. Ayu memberi makan babinya 2 kali sehari pada pagi dan sore hari. Sebelum diberi makan, babinya dimandikan dahulu dan kandangnya juga dibersihkan. Keuntungan yang diperoleh setelah anak babinya dijual perekor Rp. 250.000,- dan keuntungan bersihnya Ayu mendapat Rp.80.000,- setelah dikurangi biaya pakan. Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya dan juga pendidikan kedua naknya yang masih sekolah. Sekarang Ayu memelihara 1 ekor induk dan 2 penggemukan. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari Ayu akan membeli beberapa bibit lagi untuk dipelihara sebagai induk dan sisanya untuk biaya pakan.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and feed

Membeli bibit babi dan pakan

loans.name: Ni Komang Warti

texts.id:
Ni Komang Warti as a mother has a hobby of farming pigs. With an initial capital of Rp5,00,000 (translator's note: 1US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00), Warti bought 2 piglets to be fattened. Warti feeds the pigs 2X/day, mornings and evenings. Besides feeding rice and wheat shell clippings, Warti also feeds additional food, like Banana or talas leaves, and banana trunks. Before feeding, she bathe her pigs till clean. After subtracting feed cost, Warti profits about Rp200,000/piglet. This profit was used to pay for living expenses, and also to pay for her 6th grade child's education expenses. Warti's husband, Ketut Kawiarta, who works in a workshop, also helps in fulfilling living expenses. The house was built simply on rented land. Loan from Dinari are expected by Warti to improve the stalls, and buy additional pig feedstock.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Komang Warti seorang ibu rumah tangga yang mempunyai hobi memelihara babi. Dengan modal awal Rp. 500.000,- Warti membeli 2 ekor bibit babi untuk penggemukan, Warti memeberi makan babinya 2 kali sehari, pada pagi dan sore hari. Disamping memberi dedak padi dan dedak gandum , Warti juga memberikan makanan tambahan seperti daun pisang, daun talas dan batang pisang. Sebelum diberi makan babinya dimandikan dulu sampai bersih, dan kandangnya dibersihkan juga. Setelah bibit babi dipelihara selama 6 bulan, laku terjual seharga Rp.1.000.000,- perekor. Setelah dikurangi biaya pakan Warti memperoleh keuntungan sebesar Rp.200.000,- perekor. Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya, dan juga untuk biaya pendidikan anaknya yang duduk di kelas 6 SD. Suami Warti, Ketut Kawiarta, yang bekerja sebagai bengkel, juga ikut membantu pemenuhan kebutuhan hidupnya . Rumahnya dibangun sangat sederhana dan tanahnya masih berstatus kontrakan . Pinjaman dari Dinari diharapkan Warti untuk memperbaiki kandangnya agar lebih bagus dan membeli bibit babi lagi.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock

Membeli bibit babi

loans.name: Desak Made Sarini

texts.id:
Living in a field quite far from residence living area, made Desak Putu Sarini ideal to raise pigs, and with husband Gusti Permadi, also raise cows. To pay for living expenses, Desak Putu Sarini raises 1 mother pig, 1 male pig, and 2 to be roasted piglets (Translator's Note: Bali delicacy). Now the mother pig is pregnant, and will give birth in about a month, Desak Putu Sarini bathed the mother pig 2X/day, while feeding. Profit from the roasted piglets are about Rp80,000/piglet (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00), after raising them for 3 months. That profit was used to pay for living expenses, and also schooling expenses for their 9th grade child. Her hope is that with Dinari's loan, Desak Putu Sarini would build a pig stall, so that the pigs would not walk around her house yard.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Tinggal di ladang yang cukup jauh dari pemukiman penduduk ,membuat Desak Putu Sarini sangat cocok beternak babi dan bersama suaminya, Gusti Permadi, juga memelihara ternak sapi. Untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya, Desak Putu Sarini memelihara induk 1 ekor, pejantan 1 ekor, dan anak babi untuk gulingan 2 ekor. Sekarang induk babinya sedang hamil dan lagi 1 bulan akan melahirkan . Desak Putu Sarini memandikan induk babinya 2 kali sehari, sambil memberi makan. Keuntungan yang diperoleh untuk babi yang diguling sebesar Rp. 80.000,- perekor selama masa pemeliharaan 3 bulan. Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya dan juga untuk pendidikan anaknya yang masih sekolah di SMP kelas III. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari Desak Putu Sarini akan membuat kandang babi agar babinya tidak berkeliaran di pekarangan rumahnya.

loans.use:
To buy piglets and feed

Membeli bibit babi dan pakan

loans.name: I Wayan Tantra

texts.id:
Living in a village, made Wayan Tantra with his wife Wayan Wantri, to be in the pig and cow farming business behind their house. With an initial capital of Rp 1,000,000 (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00), Tantra bought 4 piglets to be fattened. Tantra fed his pigs 2X/day, besides feeding rice and wheat shell clippings, Tantra also feed greeneries, like banana, talas leaves, and also banana trunks. Before feeding the pigs are bathed, and the stall brushed until clean. After 4 months, the piglets was sold at between Rp800,000-Rp1,000,000/piglet. Nett profit could reach about Rp100,000/piglet. That profit was used to pay for living expense, and also schooling expense for their 2 children, who are in 12th and 8th grade. His hope is that with Dinari's loan, Tantra could buy several piglets, and the rest for feed expenses.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Hidup didesa membuat Wayan Tantra bersama istrinya, Wayan Wantri, menjalankan usaha beternak babi dan juga beternak sapi dibelakang rumahnya. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000,- Tantra membeli 4 bibit babi untuk dipelihara sebagai penggemukan. Tantra memberi makan babinya 2 kali sehari, didamping memberi dedak padi dan dedak gandum, Tantra juga memberi daun-daunan hijau seperti daun pisang, daun talas, dan juga batang pisang. Sebelum diberi makan babinya dimandikan dan kandangnya dibersihkan sampai bersih. Setelah dipelihara selama 4 bulan anak babinya laku terjual perekor dari harga Rp. 800.000,- sampai dengan Rp.1.000.000,- Keuntungan bersih perekor mencapai Rp.100.000,- Keuntungan ini dipakai utnuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya dan juga untuk biaya pendidikan 2 anaknya yang masih sekolah di SMA kelas 3 dan SMP kelas 2. Harapannya dengan pinjaman yang diperoleh dari Dinari Tantra akan membeli beberapa bibit lagi dan sisanya untuk biaya pakan.

loans.use:
To buy piglets and feed

Membeli bibit babi dan pakan

loans.name: Gede Merta Wijaya

texts.id:
Gede Merta Wijaya is a head of household who is a hard worker, besides having a workshop at his house, Gede Merta also raises pigs. Together with his wife, Ni Kadek Manis Ardani, Gede Merta raises 1 piglets at the back of his home. With an initial capital of Rp 1,000,000 (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00), Gede Merta bought 4 piglets, and after raising them for 4 months, the pigs was sold at a price of Rp800,000 to Rp1,000,000/pig, at a nett profit of Rp80,000/pig, after deducting feed expenes. The profit was used to pay for living expenses, also Merta is still repairing his house, which is quite large. His hope is with Dinari's loan Merta could buy more piglets, and the rest for feed expenses.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Gede Merta Wijaya termasuk kepala rumah tangga yang rajin bekerja , disamping membuka usaha bengkel dirumahnya Gede Merta juga memelihara ternak babi . Bersama dengan istrinya, Ni Kadek Manis Ardani, Gede Merta memelihara 1 ekor anak babi dibelakang rumahnya. Dengan modal awal Rp.1.000.000,- Gede Merta membeli 4 bibit babi dan setelah dipelihara selama 4 bulan, babinya laku terjual perekor mencapai harga Rp.800.000,- sampai dengan Rp. 1.000.000,- dan mendapat keuntungan perekor sebesar Rp.80.000,-. Setelah dikurangi biaya pakan . Keuntungan yang diperoleh dipakai utnuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya dan juga Merta masih memeperbaiki rumahnya yang cukup besar . Harapannya dengan pinjaman dari Dinari, Merta akan membeli beberapa bibit babi lagi dan sisanya untuk biaya pakan.

loans.use:
To buy piglets and feed expenses

Membeli bibit babi dan biaya pakan

loans.name: Ni Komang Murni

texts.id:
Besides being a farmer, Ni Komang Murni also has an activity of raising a mother cow. Today Ni Komang Murni only owns 1 mother cow because of capital shortage. Today Ni Komang Murni needs additional capital of Rp 4,000,000 (Translator’s note: 1 US$ fluctuates between Rp9,000-9,500.00), which would be used to buy one additional mother cow, so that within a year she could harvest 2X. From her experience with 1 mother cow, within a year she could bore calf only 1X. And, after 5-6 months the calf could be sold. Calf prices differ - depending on gender. If it were a male calf it would sell more than female, whose price would fluctuates between Rp2,200,000-2,500,000. If Ni Komang Murni raises 2 mother cow, surely within a year she could harvest about 2X, with more income. Then those cow income sales would be used to pay for their living expense, and also for future schooling expenses of their small children, who are still pre-school age.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Selain sebagai petani, Ni Komang Murni juga memiliki kesibukan memelihara induk sapi. Saat ini Ni Komang Murni hanya memelihara 1 ekor induk sapi karena kurangnya modal yang dimiliki. Saat ini Ni Komang Murni membutuhkan tambahan modal Rp 4.000.000 yang akan dipergunakan untuk membeli tambahan satu ekor induk sapi supaya dalam setahun bisa panen sebanyak dua kali. Dari pengalaman yang lalu satu induk sapi dalam setahun hanya bisa melahirkan anak satu kali. Dan setelah 5 sampai 6 bulan akan bisa dijual. Harga anak sapi berbeda – beda sesuai dengan jenis kelaminnya. Jika anaknya jantan maka akan laku terjual lebih mahal dibandingkan sapi yang betina yang harganya berkisar Rp. 2.200.000.- sampai Rp. 2.500.000.- Jadi Jika Ni Komang Murni memelihara dua ekor induk sapi tentu dalam setahun bisa panen sebanyak dua kali dengan pendapatan yang lebih banyak lagi. Dan nantinya dari hasil penjualan sapi ini akan dipergunakan untuk biaya hidup mereka dan juga biaya sekolah anak –anaknya kelak karena sekarang memang masih kecil dan belum bersekolah.

loans.use:
To buy a cow

Membeli sapi

loans.name: Dira B Group

texts.en:
Edward, age 38, is married with 4 children (ages 15, 12, 10, and 8). He owns a cafeteria business which he began 2 years ago. His business is open from 5am to 11pm daily, and makes a monthly profit of about $164.

Edward hopes to take a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase on his business. He will be sharing this loan with sub group members, who have businesses dealing in a retail shop, selling food stuffs, and a kiosk.

In the picture, Edward is in the centre.

loans.use: To increase on business

loans.name: Ni Wayan Karsini

texts.id:
At the moment Ni Wayan Karsini, a housewife and a mother of two, is having a business of pig farming. She has 3 piglets at the moment which are farmed under a simple bamboo hut behind her house.

She has been farming these 3 piglets for 2 months now. With pig foods costing of IDR 10,000 (approx US$ 1.1) per day, the profit after 6 months of farming from 3 piglets can be IDR 900,000 (approx of US$ 95). This money is really significant to help her to provide for her family's daily needs. This additional income is very important to supplement the income from her husband, Putu Yasa, who works as a seasonal driver and he doesn't have a fixed income.

With this business, she wants to expand the pig farming so she can provide more to her family.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Saat ini Ni Wayan Karsini sedang menjalankan usaha memelihara babi pengemukan disamping sebagai ibu rumah tangga yg mengurusi 2 orang anak. Karsini memelihara 3 ekor babi penggemukan. Dengan kandang yang terbuat dari bambu yang berada dibelakang rumahnya. Sudah dua bulan tiga ekor babi ini dipelihara. Setiap pagi sebelum memberi makan Karsini menyiram kandang terlebih dahulu, lalu diberi makan saat siang dan sore hari. Dengan modal pakan perhari Rp.10.000.- keuntungan selama 6 bulan dari 3 ekor babi sebesar Rp. 900.000,-Keuntungan ini sangat membantu biaya rumah tangganya. Karena suaminya, Putu Yasa, hanya sebagai sopir yang mendapat upah tidak menentu dan hanya tergantung dari orderan. Jika ada orderan maka suaminya akan mendapatkan penghasilan. Dengan usaha ini Karsini ingin mengembangkan untuk kedepannya memperbanyak bibit penggemukannya agar nantinya bisa menopang kebutuhan keluarganya

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig foods (Membeli pakan dan bibit babi)

loans.name: Dira A Group

texts.en:
Dafroza, age 26, is married with 1 child (age 4). She owns a business of making bread, which she began 1 year ago. She opens her business from 7am to 10am, and makes a monthly profit of about $136.

Dafroza hopes to take a loan with Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business. She will be sharing this loan with her sub group members, who have businesses dealing in a retail shop, charcoal selling, livestock, and stationery.

In the picture, Dafroza is in the centre, front row.

loans.use: To increase business

loans.name: Ni Putu Budiasih

texts.id:
As a housewife, Ni Putu Budiasih has a dual roles, to taking care of the children and family and also to do the other household chores. In addition to that, she has to assist the family by earning additional income to supplement her husband income who works as a truck driver.

Ni Putu Budiasih has been doing the pig farming for the last 5 years, and this helps her family's economy. She can earn IDR 500,000/ month (approx of US$ 53) from the selling of her 4 pigs. With the loan money of IDR 4 million (approx of US$ 450), she bought more piglets and pig foods. At the moment she has 8 piglets.

She wants to see this business growing so she can earn more money for the family and to finance the education of her children, Kadek Dedy and Komang Ary who are in High School and Primary School, respectively.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Sebagai seorang ibu rumah tangga ,Ni Putu Budiasih memiliki peranan ganda yakni mengurus anak-anak dan mengerjakan semua pekerjaan rumah tangga lainnya.Disamping itu ,Istri dari I wayan Wirta ini juga ikut mencari nafkah untuk menambah penghasilan suaminya yang bekerja sebagai sopir truk . Pekerjaan yang di lakukan Ni Putu Budiasih adalah memelihara ternak babi. Usaha ini telah ditekuni sejak 5 tahun lalu dan telah banyak membantu perekonomian keluarganya.bahkan hasil yang didapatpun tak kalah dengan pendapatan suaminya. Penghasilan Ni Putu Budiasih dari hasil penjualan 4 ekor ternak babinya dalam sebulan mencapai sebesar Rp 500.000 .Apalagi saat ini telah mendapat tambahan modal dari Dinari Sebesar Rp 4.000.000,- yang di pergunakan untuk membeli tambahan bibit baru lagi serta sisanya untuk membeli pakan . Saat ini ada 8 ekor ternak babi yang di pelihara oleh Ni Putu Budiasih dalam dua lokal kandang yang dimiliki. Ni putu Budiasih ingin menjadi wanita yang sukses baik dalam menjalankan usaha maupun dalam menunjang biaya pendidikan dua orang anaknya yaitu Kadek Dedy dan Komang Ary yang kini masing –masing telah duduk di bangku SMA dan SD. Untuk itu Ni putu Budiasih sangat tekun menjalankan usahanya dan tanpa melupakan pekerjaan pokoknya sebagai Ibu rumah tangga .

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig foods (Membeli bibit babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Ni Komang Sudarmi

texts.id:
Ni Komang Sudarmi started the pig farming business since she got married to I Komang Marwa. The reason for her to start this business was to get additional income to supplement her husband income who worked as a truck driver.

With 2 pigs at the beginning, Ni Komang Sudarmi was able to get a profit of IDR 150,000/ month (approx of US$ 16) which was very helpful to finance their daily living needs that cost them around IDR 15,000/ day (approx of US$ 1.6)

Ni Komang Sudarmi is hoping that with the loan money from Dinari, she is able to expand her business by buying another 5 piglets. The rest of the loan money will be used to buy the pig foods. She is put a high hope on this as her husband now is sick so her business is now the main source of income for the family.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Sejak menikah dengan I Komang Marwa ,Ni Komang Sudarmi, telah menekuni usaha ternak babi untuk dapat membantu pendapatan suami yang bekerja sebagai sopir Truk. Dengan bermodalkan tekad dan ketekunan yang dimiliki Ni Komang sudarmi memulai usaha kecil yang bisa mendukung penghasilan suaminya itu. Usaha itupun masih dikembangkanya sampai saat ini. Dari 2 ekor ternak babi pada awalnya Ni Komang Sudarmi memperoleh ke untungan sebesar Rp 150.000,-/bulan , hasil yang menurutnya sangat berarti untuk memenuhi biaya kebutuhan sehari-hari yang mencapai Rp 15.000,-Hal ini juga yang mendorongnya untuk mengembangkan usaha itu ,walau dengan modal pinjaman dari Dinari Ni Komang Sudarmi bermaksud membeli 5 ekor bibit babi lagi untuk mengisi 2 dari 4 lokal kandang yang di miliki. sedangkan sisa uangnya di pergunakan untuk tambahan biaya pakan ternak. Besar harapan Ni Komang Sudarmi dengan tambahan modal ini usahanya akan lebih maju sehingga hasilnya bisa mendongkrak perekonomian keluarganya , Apalagi saat ini suaminya sering mengalami sakit karena ke banyakan duduk sehingga harus beristirahat . Satu- satunya tumpuan harapan kelangsungan keluarga ini adalah dari usaha ternak ini ,sementara satu -satu nya anak yang dimiliki yaitu I Putu Agus sumerta telah menjalankan kehidupan barunya dengan membentuk Rumah tangga yang baru.

loans.use: To buy piglets (Membeli bibit untuk penggemukkan)
