loans.name: Ni Nyoman Notri

texts.id:
Mrs. Ni Nyoman Notri, wife from the late Mr. Ketut Jingga, started the pig farming business 2 years ago. She started this business with 2 pig huts and 4 piglets. With a monthly average of profit IDR 400,000/ month (approx. US$ 42), this business is the main source of income for Ni Nyoman Notri. Apart from this, sometimes she also receives money from her children who have already married.

Ni Nyoman Notri's daily activities are centered into taking care of the piglets, starting from cleaning the hut to feeding them. Now she already got the additional capital from DINARI which she used to buy 5 additional piglets and pig foods. The pigs are grown quite well and the monthly average profit is now IDR 800,000/ month (approx. US$ 84), enough to provide for daily needs.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Dengan dua lokal kandang yang dimiliki dan 4 ekor bibit babi yang hidup di dalamnya , Ni Nyoman notri istri dari Ketut Jingga (Almarhum) memulai merintis usaha ini sejak 2 tahun yang lalu. Dengan ke untungan rata-rata Rp 400.000 /bulan, usaha ini menjadi sumber pendapatan utama dari Ni Nyoman Notri sejak sepeninggal suaminya , disamping kadang –kadang mendapat kiriman uang dari anaknya yang sudah pada berkeluarga. Keseharian Ni Nyoman notri di sibukan dengan mengurus ternak babi peliharaannya ,memulai dari membersihkan kandang sampai memberi pakan .Kini Ni Nyoman Notri telah mendapatkan tambahan modal dari Dinari yang olehnya di pergunakan untuk tambahan modal ,membeli bibit baru lagi sebanyak 5 Ekor dan sisanya di belikan beberapa sak polard maupun dedak padi untuk pakan ternaknya .pertumbuhan babinya cukup baik dan hasil yang di perolehpun sangat lumayan yaitu Rp .800.000 / bulannya.sehingga cukup untuk memenuhi segala kebutuhan / keperluan sehari-hari .

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food (Mmbeli bibit babi dan pakan)

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru:
Bahtiyor is 24 years old, is married, has two children and is expecting a third. He sells toys. This is a family business. Bahtiyor’s father and mother sell stuffed toys in one store and he sells them in another store.

Bahtiyor imports his products himself from neighboring countries – China and Kyrgyzstan. He would like to expand his inventory and has many regular customers. He would also like to increase his profits and to purchase a car.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Бахтиёр, 24 года, женат, имеет двоих детей, скоро у него родится третий. Продает мягкие детские игрушки. Этот бизнес у них семейный. Его отец и мать продают мягкие игрушки в другом магазине а он в другом. Товары привозит он сам из других соседних странах Китай и Киргизстан. Хочет расширить свой ассортимент товаров. У него много постоянных клиентов. Хочет увеличить свой прибыл и купить себе машину.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Rahim

texts.ru:
Rahim A. sells tangerines, bananas, lemons, oranges and apples at the central market in Khujand. He is married and has 4 children. His wife helps him in his business. Rahim purchases fruits by the box from wholesalers using all of his working capital. He earns a good profit daily and based on the findings of the loan officer his business has very high turnover. Because Rahim makes regular payments on his Kiva loan, the loan committee has decided to allow him to take out another loan via Kiva.

Rahim will use the parallel loan to increase his inventory.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Ахмедов Рахим, продает мандарины, бананы, лимоны, апельсины и яблоко на центральном рынке Худжанда на Панчшанбе . Он женат и имеет 4 детей.Его жена помогает продает вместе с ним.Он закупает фрукты ящикамии коробками у оптовиков . Закупку делает на все активы.Ежедневно он получает хорошую прибыль и по показаниям мониторинга кредитного офицера его бизнес в данное время имеет очень быстрый оборот. Так как он регулярно оплачивает свой текущий займ с КИВЫ на комитете было принято решение о повторном размешеннии на сайт КИВА.Сейчас он запрашивает параллельный займ на увеличение товарооборота.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Zinnatoi

texts.ru:
Zinnatoi O. has been selling women’s and children’s clothing for 5 years. She is married and has 3 children. She rents a space in store #226. She purchases her products herself and brings them from Bishkek weekly. Her husband does not have a job and helps her by carrying heavy packages and meeting her at the border when she brings products in. Thus, Zinnatoi’s business is the sole source of income for her family.

Zinnatoi has turned to Kiva for a loan to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Олимова Зиннатой продает женские и детские одежды протяжении 5 лет на Панчшенбе. Замужем имеет 3 детей . Она арендует место в магазине №226.Товары привозит сама из Бишкека еженедельно.Муж нигде не работает, он помогает поднимать тяжелые сумки с товаром встречает её на границе. Так что её бизнес единственный источник в семье.Она обратилась в Кива для расширения своего ассортимента.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 43 year-old Lucy A.. She is married with 5 children, aged 7,14,17,20, and 25. In 2001 Lucy established a clothing business. Lucy has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stocks of clothing. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 35 year-old Mariamu K.. She is married with 4 children, aged 3,5,9, and 14. In 2006, Mariamu established a ‘vitumbua’ business, and now requires a loan of $275 in order to to purchase ingredients such as rice flour and oil, which are used to prepare vitumbua (deep fried rice balls, which are a breakfast snack in Tanzania). She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients such as oil and rice flour in bulk, for her snack food business.

texts.en:

texts.en:
Salma K. is 45 years old and is married with seven children. In 2005 Salma established a grains business. Salma has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $625 in order to purchase stocks of rice in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

loans.name: Stellah

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 34 year-old Stella M.. She is single with one child, aged 6. In 2001 Stella established a pharmacy, and now requires a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.name: Erica

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 42 year-old Erica K.. She is married with five children, aged 5,13,16,18, and 20. In 2006 Erica established a small shop selling general items, and now requires a loan of $450 in order to to purchase additional stock. She thanks you for your support.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 27 year-old Marim S.. She is married with one 4 year old child. In 2000 Marim established a livestock business. Marim has already received and successfully repaid two loans from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $875 in order to purchase additional cows and chickens. She thanks you for your support. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku. Who or what are ‘kuku’, you may ask. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. Firstly, they require little start-up capital, you can start with one or two and either add to them as you go or wait for them to multiple naturally! Secondly, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Thirdly, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons why raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow. About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional cows and chickens.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Mambo (hello) from 34-year Sarah M. in Dar es Salaam. She is married and has a six year child. In 1998 Sarah started a business a street vender in 1998. The business originally sold snacks, but recently she has expanded the business to sell fruit as well. She is requesting a loan to buy more produce and ingredients for her snacks. She needs you to give her the support she needs to strengthen and expand her business, asanti sana (thank you very much) for your considering awarding her a loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock and ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Pia

texts.en:
Pia K. is 39 years old and is married with four children. In 1999 Pia established a vegetable farming business, and now requires a loan of $275 in order to purchase seed and fertilizer for her garden. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
My name is Rehana B.. I have lived all my life in a small town, Raiwind. I am a mother of five kids. My husband sells vegetables on a cart. We have earlier invested a loan in this business which turned into better profits. He buys vegetables from a nearby vegetable market and has been in this business since his teens.

Now he wants to expand his business for which he requires a loan. I want to help my loan group members and get them loans. These women are very responsible and have never delayed paying their installments. Now, I introduce them to you: Rani B. needs a loan to invest in their vegetables business, Sufia B. requires a loan for their rice business, Mukhtar B. will invest her loan to buy cloth for her cloth selling business, Haneefan B. has a livestock trading business and plans to expand it.

loans.use: Expand vegetables business

loans.name: Rubina's Group

texts.en:
I am Rubina M. from a small town - Raiwind, Pakistan. I am married and mother of five, all of them below 12. Three of my kids attend school whereas two are small and stay at home.

My husband has a scrap business. He is in this business for past ten years. Now he is in the process of expanding his business for which he requires a loan. My group members who need loans are: Sakina I. needs loan to buy a stitching machine, Inayat P. she will invest loan in their vegetables business, Sakina B. needs a loan to invest in her son’s food stall.

loans.use: Expand scrap business

loans.name: Allah's Group

texts.en:
I am a widow, Allah R., from a small town - Raiwind, Pakistan. I am a mother of three boys and four girls. We have a family business selling milk and possess four cows. Now, I need to buy an additional cow to increase milk production so that I can increase our household income. I have earlier acquired loans for this business that generated higher profits which enabled me to marry three of my kids.

I have several group members: Maqbool B. needs a loan for their milk business; Zubaida B. requires a loan for her husband’s shoes business; Seema B. will invest loan in her fruits business; Naymat B. needs a loan for her shoe business.

loans.use: Buy an additional cow

loans.name: Haneefa's Group

texts.en:
I am a widow, Haneefa D., and I have lived all my life in a small town - Raiwind, Pakistan. I live with my two boys and one girl. One boy has a vegetable business and we also rent a piece of land on contract and plant vegetables in it. Now, we need a loan to take another piece of land on contract and hence increase our income. This is a very profitable business.

I have a few other group members who wish to get loans and help them solve their economic problems. My group members are Parveen B., who needs a loan for their cloth business; Samina R., who intends to invest the loan in their stitching business; Rani B. requires a loan for their vegetables business. We all are responsible for each other's loans.

loans.use: Take a piece of land on contract to raise vegetables

loans.name: Leornard

texts.en: Leonard is a hard working entrepreneur who has a fruit and vegetable shop in the Vituka area, a business he has been doing for the past five years. He has been with Youth Self Employment Foundation for the last four years, and has been graduating from one loan to the next, a sign of growth of his business. He gets his fruits and vegetables from the surrounding agricultural regions. He is in need of USD 1200 to help him buy storage equipment for his perishable fruits and get more space.

loans.use: Buy storage equipment and get more space

loans.name: Isabel's Group

texts.es:
Ruth is a single mother, 24 years old and has a 4 year old son. Isabel is single and 39 years old. Edilberta is a 53 year old widow with 10 children, 2 of whom are still students.

Ruth, Isabel and Edilberta are members of the Communal Bank Pura Vida for 4, 10, and 11 years respectively. In their Communal Bank they learned how to run their businesses, how to invest in their businesses, how to save and the high value of the woman.

Ruth has a restaurant located at kilometer 63 on Vía Libertadores in the Vinchos district.

Isabel makes clothing, something she has done for 6 years.

Edilberta has sold candy at the door of the Abraham Valdelomar school in Vista Alegre for 16 years.

Ruth, Isabel and Edilberta need loans of 1600 soles, 800 soles, and 600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of pop, beer, rice, sugar, oil, noodles, fabric, needles, chocolates, cookies, caramels, and gum. Their savings are for an emergency, their children’s future and the graduation of a daughter.

Ruth, Isabel and Edilberta have dreams of owning their own homes, having their own businesses near the city, that their businesses grow and that their children grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Ruth es madre soltera, tiene 24 años y 1 hijo pequeño de 4 años. Isabel es soltera y tiene 39 años, mientras que Edilberta es viuda, tiene 53 años y 10 hijos de los cuales 2 todavía son estudiantes.

Ruth, Isabel y Edilberta son socias del Banco Comunal Pura Vida hace desde hace 4, 10 y 11 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron cómo manejar su negocio, cómo invertir su negocio, a ahorrar y la revaloración de la mujer.

Ruth tiene un restaurante ubicado en el kilómetro 63 de la Vía Libertadores, en el distrito de Vinchos.

Por otro lado Isabel confecciona prendas de vestir, actividad que realiza desde hace 6 años.

Mientras que Edilberta vende golosinas en la puerta del colegio Abraham Valdelomar de Vista Alegre desde hace 16 años.

Ruth, Isabel y Edilberta necesitan préstamos de 1600 soles, 800 soles, 600 soles, que serán invertidos en la compra de gaseosas, cerveza, arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideo, telas, hilos, chocolates, galletas, caramelos, chicles. Sus ahorros son para alguna emergencia, futuro de sus hijos y para la graduación de su hija.

Los sueños de Ruth, Isabel y Edilberta son tener una casa propia, un negocio propio y cerca de la ciudad, que sus negocios sean más grandes y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Ruth, Isabel and Edilberta need loans of 1600 soles, 800 soles, and 600 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of pop, beer, rice, sugar, oil, noodles, fabric, needles, chocolates, cookies, caramels, and gum.

loans.name: Maribel's Group

texts.es:
Maribel, Indira, and Magna have belonged to the communal bank Pura Vida (Pure Life) for 2, 6, and 2 years respectively. In their communal bank they learned to save, manage their business, and be supportive. They mention that in their communal bank they are united, and when one of the members has a problem, they support and help as much as they can.

Together with her husband, Maribel has a carpentry shop, which they set up 6 months ago with savings they had and a loan from their communal bank. On her part, Indira sells clothing in the fair of Nazarenas on Mondays and the other days of the week she travels to Lima, where she has a store in a mall of Gamarra. Indira also has her seamstress workshop, which she was able to set up with her savings. Meanwhile, Magna buys cereals and potato from different towns and fairs in the region and she sells her products at the market Nery G.. Magna learned this activity from her parents.

Maribel, Indira, and Magna need loans for 600 soles, 1000 soles and 1800 soles, which they will invest in buying wood, potato, and buying school uniform shirts and sweaters.

The savings of Maribel, India, and Magna are to buy land, build a house, and to set up a guinea pig farm. The dreams of Maribel, Indira and Magna are having a bigger business with different branches, having a guinea pig farm, exporting her products, having a family and owning a house.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Maribel, Indira y Magna pertenecen al Banco Comunal Pura Vida desD. hace 2, 6 y 2 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal aprendieron a ahorrar, cómo manejar su negocio, a ser solidarias. Ellas mencionan que en su Banco Comunal son unidas y cuando alguna socia tiene algún problema se apoyan y ayudan en L. medida D. sus posibilidades.

Maribel junto a su esposo tienen una carpintería que implementaron hace 6 meses con los ahorros que tenían y el préstamo D. su Banco Comunal. Por otro lado Indira venD. ropa en L. feria D. Nazarenas los días lunes y los demás días viaja a Lima donD. también tiene una tienda en un centro comercial D. Gamarra. Indira también tiene un taller D. confección D. prendas D. vestir y nos cuenta que con sus ahorros logró implementar su taller. Mientras que Magna compra cereales y papa D. los diferentes pueblos y ferias D. L. región y venD. sus productos en el mercado Nery García. Magna dice que esta actividad L. aprendió D. sus padres.

Maribel, Indira y Magna necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 1000 soles y 1800 soles, que serán invertidos en L. compra D. madera, papa y en L. compra D. camisas y chompas escolares. Los ahorros D. Maribel, Indira y Magna son para L. compra D. un terreno, construcción D. casa y para L. implementación D. una granja D. crianza D. cuyes. Los sueños D. Maribel, Indira y Magna son tener un negocio más granD. y con sucursales, tener una granja D. crianza D. cuyes, exportar sus productos, formar una familia y tener casa propia.

loans.use: Maribel, Indira, and Magna need loans for 600 soles, 1000 soles and 1800 soles, which they will invest in buying wood, potato, and buying school uniform shirts and sweaters.

loans.name: Ramzana's Group

texts.en:
I am Ramzana B. and and I am a mother of nine. I live with my family in a small town: Depalpur, Pakistan. Currently, two of my kids are married and live separately while seven live with me. My husband prepares and sells snacks; I also help him in preparing the snacks. Last year, we took a loan for this business and it turned into better results and enabled us to construct our house. Now, we need a loan to buy potatoes and other stuff that are required to prepare these snacks in bulk. I plan to save money for my son’s marriage.

My group members are: Nusrat B. who needs a loan for her husband’s rickshaw repairing; Arshad B., wife of Taj Ali, who needs a loan for their scrap business; Waziran B. plans to invest their loan in their tyre business. I want to get all of them loans so that they can improve their incomes and can feed their children better. All of us together have acquired loans earlier and accept responsibility for each other.

loans.use: Expand current snacks business

loans.name: Alejandra's Group

texts.es:
Eda, Apolonia and Alejandra have belonged to the communal bank Pura Vida (pure life) for 1, 6 and 8 years respectively. In their communal bank they were taught how to value themselves, be punctual, save, and manage their businesses.

Eda is divorced and has 4 children. Eda sells cheese and meat in the market of the city of Ayacucho. Her products are bought in different fairs of the region and she also offers a service of catering for different events. In addition to these two activities, she makes cloth crafts and decorations. On her part, Apolonia is a widow and has 6 children. Apolonia sells vegetables in a kiosk at the market of the Americas. At first, she sold in the streets, but then with her savings she was able to buy the stand in which she now works. In addition, Apolonia sells buckets and ojotas (shoes maD. out of recycled car tires) in the fairs of Uripa and Chincheros. Meanwhile, Alejandra has a recreational place in her house where she sells meals typical of the region on Saturdays and Sundays and in addition she has a small store where she sells sweets and beverages.

Eda, Apoloniia and Alejandra need loans for 400 soles, 400 soles and 600 soles respectively. These will be invested in buying ojotas carrot, onion, squash, culantro (long coriander), cloth, thread, craft materials, beer, soda, meat, corn, potato, rice.

The savings of Eda, Apolonia and Alejandra are for the education of their children and grandchildren. Their dreams are to open a new business of children's parties, that their children and grandchildren become professionals, owning a house, and having a larger business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Eda, Apolonia y Alejandra pertenecen al Banco Comunal Pura Vida desD. hace 1, 6 y 8 años respectivamente. En su Banco Comunal les enseñaron a valorarse, a ser puntuales, a ahorrar y cómo dirigir sus negocios.

Eda es divorciada y tiene 4 hijos. Eda venD. quesos y carne en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho; sus productos los compra en las diferentes ferias D. la región, y también brinda servicio D. preparación D. comida para diferentes eventos, además D. estas dos actividades ella hace manualidades D. telas y adornos. Por otro lado Apolonia es viuda y tiene 6 hijos, Apolonia venD. verduras en un kiosco en el mercado las Américas. Inicialmente vendía ambulatoriamente y con sus ahorros pudo comprar el puesto en el que trabaja. Además Apolonia venD. tinas, baldes y ojotas (calzado elaborado D. neumáticos D. carros reciclados) en las ferias D. Uripa y Chincheros. Mientras que Alejandra tiene un recreo en su casa donD. venD. comidas típicas los días sábados y domingos, y además tiene una tienda pequeña donD. venD. golosinas y bebidas.

Eda, Apolonia y Alejandra necesitan préstamos D. 400 soles, 400 soles y 600 soles respectivamente, que serán invertidos en la compra D. ojotas, zanahoria, cebolla, zapallo, culantro, tela, hilo, accesorios para las manualidades, cerveza, gaseosa, carne, maíz, papa, arroz.

Los ahorros D. Eda, Apolonia y Alejandra son para la educación D. sus hijos y nietos, Los sueños D. ellas son abrir un nuevo negocio D. piñatería ( venta D. productos para fiestas infantiles), que sus hijos y nietos sean profesionales, tener casa propia y tener un negocio más granD..

loans.use: Eda, Apoloniia and Alejandra need loans for 400 soles, 400 soles and 600 soles respectively. These will be invested in buying ojotas carrot, onion, squash, culantro (long coriander), cloth, thread, craft materials, beer, soda, meat, corn, potato, rice.

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.es:
Ricarda has lived in Los Olivos (the olives) Asoc. Portales del Norte for 20 years. When she arrived to that community she lived only with her husband. Five years later, they established a carpentry business.

In addition to offering the best to their three children, Ricarda wants to invest in glass and aluminum to complete some orders. She needs a capital of S/3000.00.

Ricarda has worked with EDAPROSPO since 2003, having started thanks to the invitation of a friend who now works on her savings.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Ricarda vive en Los Olivos – Asoc. Portales del Norte desde hace 20 años. Cuando llegó a la comunidad solo vivía con su esposo. Cinco años después, establecerían juntos su negocio de carpintería.

Además de brindarle lo mejor a sus tres hijos, Ricarda desearía invertir en vidrios y aluminio para hacer la entrega completa de sus pedidos. El capital requerido seria de S/3000.00.

Trabaja con EDAPROSPO desde el 2003 y llegó gracias a la invitación de una amiga con la que actualmente trabaja en su alcancía.

loans.use: Expand carpentry businesses offering window-making services.

loans.name: Naziran's Group

texts.en:
I am Naziran B., wife of Amanat Ali. I am a mother of six, one of whom is married. I live with my family in a small town, Depalpur, Pakistan. My husband operates a used clothes shop. He has been in this business for the past 20 years. He earns reasonable profits out of this business. Now, we want to expand our business and need a loan for this purpose.

My group members are also in need of loans and I request loans for them: Salma B. needs a loan for her husband’s wholesale business; Ulfat B. requires loan for her brother’s fruit business; Nasreen Anwer also needs a loan for her husband's business; Shugufta B. needs a loan for her husband who is an electrician.

loans.use: Expand used clothes shop

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Since arriving to the Human Settlement Laura Caller, Cristina has helped her husband selling meat, and then, prepared meals. Now she sells "panchos" (hot dog) in a stand at the market close to her home.

Cristina would like to start a business selling clothing, because there is a lot of demand for that in this season. To that that she needs S/1500.00. Cristina is one of the leaders of her group bank. She is the "fiscal" of the group thanks to her initiative and the initiative of her partners. Their second anniversary working with EDAPROSPO was in October.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Desde que llegó al Asentamiento Humano Laura Caller, Cristina ayudó a su esposo vendiendo carne y luego, comida. Ahora, vende “panchos” (hot dog) en un puesto del mercado cercano a su casa. A Cristina gustaría iniciar un negocio de venta de ropa ya que para estas fechas tiene mucha salida. Para ello requeriría S/1500.00. Cristina es una de las líderes de su alcancía, del cual ella es fiscal gracias a su iniciativa y la de sus compañeras. En octubre cumplieron 2 años trabajando con EDAPROSPO.

loans.use: Starting a clothing sales business. (Iniciar un negocio de venta de ropa)

loans.name: Ramzana's Group

texts.en:
I am Ramzana J. from a small town, Depalpur, Pakistan. I am married and a mother of five: three boys and two girls. We live in a two-room brick house. My elder kids are done with their studies while two still attend school. I stitch clothes for my neighborhood clients and my husband runs a laundry. He has been in this business for many years. Last year, we took a loan from Asasah, Pakistan and increased our profits. With the increased profits we bought a television for our house. Now, we require another loan to expand our business.

There are four members in my loan group. They are: Sharifan S., who needs a loan to buy wood for their wood selling business; Sughran B., who plans to invest loan in her husband’s cloth business; Shamim A., who requires loan for their auto workshop; Sughran and Shamim, both of whom stitch clothes for their neighborhood clients to support their families.

loans.use: Expand laundry

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es:
Since she was 4 years old, Domitila lived with her adoptive parents, because her real parents could not keep her. It is because of her second family that she has a merchants spirit, because since she was a child she helped selling fruits wholesale, which was the family business.

Even though she is a nutritionist by profession, for the past 17 years she has worked selling potato, sweet potato, tomato, and onion at the market of La Huaca.

When she started she had nothing but 3 sacks of potato, and nowadays she brings 100-150 sacks thanks to the financial aid from EDAPROSPO . She distributes her products to 17 popular diners, a restaurant, and to people who come to her stand.

Domitila started with a line of credit for S/.350.00, and she currently has S/1300.00. Her savings group has been active for 2 years, and she is the president.

She requests a loan to buy merchandise wholesale, so she can have a larger profit margin and be able to offer a better price than the competition.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Domitila vivió desde los 4 años con sus padres adoptivos ya que sus verdaderos padres no pudieron tenerla a su lado. Fue por su segunda familia quien lleva ese espíritu de comerciante ya que desde niña ayudó en la venta de frutas al por mayor negocio al que se dedicaba su familia.

Aunque es nutricionista de profesión, se dedica, desde hace 17 años, a la venta de papas, camote, tomate, cebolla en el mercado La Huaca.

Cuando comenzó solo contaba con 3 sacos de papas, en la actualidad trae de 100 a 150 sacos gracias al financiamiento con EDAPROSPO con lo que puede repartir sus productos a 17 comedores populares, un restaurante y a las personas que vienen a su puesto.

Domitila comenzó con una línea de crédito por S/.350.00. En la actualidad cuenta con S/1300.00, su alcancía tiene 2 años de vigencia y es ella quien la preside.

Solicitaría más crédito para comprar mercadería por mayor, ya que le dejaría mayor margen de utilidad y poder ofrecer a un mejor precio que la competencia.

loans.use: Buying fruits and vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her business (Ampliar su negocio)

loans.name: Barkat's Group

texts.en:
I am Barkat B., wife of Muhammad Yasin. I am a mother of four girls: three of them attend a local school. I live with my family in a small town, Depalpur, Pakistan. I feel it is very important to educate children so that they can polish their lives and become good citizens. My husband operates a breakfast stall in the morning and drives a rickshaw in the evening. My husband has been operating this stall for past nine years. Now, we need a loan to pay the remaining installments on our rickshaw.

My group members are: Nasreen A., who needs a loan for her husband to repair his vehicle; Shabnam B., who needs a loan for their grocery sore; Azra B., who requires a loan for their livestock trading business. We all assume responsibility for each other.

loans.use: Pay remaining installments on rickshaw

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Not having any economic support from her husband was not an obstacle for Adela to be able to support her 7 children.

After have worked selling desserts in the street and washing clothing, Adela has been selling homemade food from a stand in the market near her house for 5 years.

This business not only has helped her raise her children and better their quality of life, it ihas also generated employment for two of her children with the purchase of their respective motortaxis.

Adela has always had a great vision for business. It is for this reason, and having the opportunity, she would like to open a grocery store and internet service. In addition, thinking always of her children, she would buy them cars so they can offer taxi service, and at least, buy sewing machines so as to start a tailoring business at home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

El no tener el apoyo económico de su esposo, no fue un obstáculo para que Adela sacara adelante a sus 7 hijos.

Luego de haber trabajado vendiendo postres en la calle y lavando ropa; Adela, desde hace 5 años, vende comida criolla en un puesto del mercado que está cerca de su casa.

Este negocio no solo le ha ayudado a criar a sus hijos y mejorar su vivienda; sino también, ha generado puestos de empleo a dos de sus hijos con la compra de sus respectivos mototaxis.

Adela, siempre ha tenido una gran visión para los negocios. Es por esto que, de tener la oportunidad, pondría un puesto de abarrotes y un local de Internet. Además, pensando siempre en sus hijos, les compraría carros para que realicen servicios de taxi y a la menor, máquinas de coser para que inicie un taller de costura en casa.

loans.use: Open a grocery store

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
When her spouse retired, Luz saw the need to leave her home and start selling plants, natural medicines and flowerpots in the street.

After 7 years and much effort, she has a small stand in the Virgen de Fátima market where she sells her products.

With the income her business has generated, Luz has been able to help her husband support their 5 children.

Although she has only been in this location for a year, she wishes to expand it and sell other products like lotions and popsicles during the hot season.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

Al jubilarse su esposo, Luz se vio en la necesidad de dejar su hogar y comenzar a vender en la calle plantas, medicinas naturales y macetas.

Luego de 7 años y con mucho esfuerzo, ha puesto un pequeño puesto en el mercado Virgen de Fátima donde vende sus productos.

Con los ingresos que su negocio le ha generado, Luz ha podido ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a sus 5 hijos.

Aunque recién tiene un año en este establecimiento, desea ampliarlo y vender otros productos como emolientes y chupetes en las épocas de calor.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
In seeking a better economic situation, Esther’s husband left his job and began his own business. Unfortunately it didn’t go well. Upon seeing this situation, Esther decided to help her husband by selling desserts from their home.

When they finished paying their debts, 12 years ago, Esther established a business selling ice cream, pop, beer, and beauty products in the store that she shares with her son and daughter-in-law.

Today her dream is to have her own locale where she could sell groceries.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

En búsqueda de una mejora económica, el esposo de Esther se retiró de su trabajo y comenzó su propia empresa. Lamentablemente, no le fue bien. En vista de esta situación, Esther decidió ayudar a su esposo vendiendo postres en su casa.

Cuando terminó de pagar todas sus deudas, hace 12 años, Esther estableció un negocio de venta de helados, gaseosas, cervezas y productos de belleza en la tienda que actualmente comprarte con su hijo y nuera.

Hoy en día su sueño es tener su propio local donde vendería, además, abarrotes.

loans.use: Own her her locale

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Knee pain impedes Betty’s ability to move with ease. Nevertheless, this impediment doesn’t stop her from continuing to work in her little grocery store. This woman has always helped with the family’s income by selling desserts in the market. Today, her impediment has made her establish a business in her home.

Despite having recently started this business, the earning she has received are a great help, and thanks to the income she can pay for her medical treatment.

Betty, in addition has helped many of her neighbors and friends from the market where she used to work open their own businesses, uniting them under the project Prosperidad de EDAPROSPO.

Betty hopes to be able to better stock her store and buy freezers and shelving in order to offer and display her products.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

Los dolores en la rodilla impiden a Betty moverse con facilidad. Sin embargo, esto no es impedimento para que siga trabajando en su pequeña tienda de abarrotes. Y es que desde siempre esta mujer ha ayudado con la economía familiar vendiendo postres en el mercado. Hoy, esta dificultad ha hecho que establezca su negocio en casa.

A pesar que recién esta comenzando, las ganancias que recibe le son de gran ayuda ya que, gracias a ellas, puede pagar el tratamiento que sigue por su malestar.

Betty, además ha ayudado a que muchos de sus vecinos y amigos del mercado donde trabajaba pongan su propio negocio uniéndolos al proyecto Prosperidad de EDAPROSPO.

Betty anhela poder surtir mejor su tienda y comprar congeladoras y más estantes para ofrecer sus productos.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora, better known in her community as Dora, is 24 years old and lives at AAHH 19 DE MAYO –LOS OLIVOS. She came to live with her family (mother and sisters) when she was still a young girl.

When she began her business she made and sold cleaning products. One year ago she opened a grocery store with which she helps her husband support their children.

Her intermediate goal is to construct a home because her current home is made of adobe. Dora has worked with EDAPROSPO since 2003 and has formed a community bank with the help of her friends.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Teodora, más conocida en su comunidad como Dora, tiene 24 años viviendo en el AAHH 19 DE MAYO –LOS OLIVOS, ella vino a vivir con su familia (madre y hermanas) cuando aun era muy jovencita.

Cuando comenzó su negocio se dedicaba a la fabricación y comercialización de productos de limpieza. Desde hace 1 año, tiene una tienda de abarrotes, con lo que ayuda a su esposo a mantener a sus hijos.

Su meta a mediano plazo es construir su casa ya que en la actualidad es de adobe. Dora trabaja con EDAPROSPO desde el 2003 y llego a formar una alcancía con la ayuda de sus amigas.

loans.use: Build her house

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es:
For Fermin, making bricks is something that runs in his veins, his father having made a living from brick-making for years. He learned the business from his father 15 years ago or so and it's been his life's occupation, generating enough income to support his family and see the business through slow patches. Fermin has four children and lives in his own house in the Salvadoran "departamento" of La Libertad. He's applying for a loan so that he can buy more raw materials--"tierra blanca", clay, wood--because sales will grow in the summer and he wants to be able to increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El negocio de fabricación de ladrillos obra, es algo que se trae en la sangre , su padre se dedico a esta actividad por años y el Sr. P. aprendió con su padre ese negocio desde hace aproximadamente 15 años ,este negocio a sido la ocupación de toda su vida tanto a si que le a generado los suficientes ingresos como para poder sacar adelante a su familia y su negocio durante las épocas malas de esta actividad ,tiene cuatro hijos y vive actualmente en casa propia en el Departamento de la Libertad su necesidad actual de financiamiento es para poder comprar mas materia prima de la que ya posee actualmente tales como tierra blanca barro leña , esto se justifica ya que en esta época de verano en nuestro país las ventas de estos materiales de construcción se incrementan y es necesario el poder aumentar la producción.

loans.use: Buy raw materials for brick-making business.

payments.comment: This entrepreneur prepaid the balance on his loan. He is very grateful for your loan and appreciates your support.

loans.name: Marta Delmi

texts.es:
Marta’s business has a good location, and in addition a large number of clients who request seamstress services. Marta has had this business for 12 years, and she really enjoys being able to design and give suggestions about style and color to her clients. Because of this her clients are faithful, and appreciate her dedicated and fine service that she provides.

Her goals in life are to be able to proviD. a future for her three children and give them the opportunity to continue their studies. She began her business with two pieces of fabric and a few accessories but over time she has been able to stock her fabrics to show her clients and at the same time make new fashionable clothing items.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

Su negocio actualmente tiene una buena ubicación, además una gran cantidad D. clientes a los cuales presta el servicio D. costura , su experiencia en este negocio es D. doce años, le encanta poder diseñar y dar sugerencias en estilo y colores a sus clientes debido a esto es que ellos son fieles, por el servicio dedicado y fino que les presta.

Su esfuerzo en la vida van orientados para poder sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, darles a ellos una oportunidad D. estudio mayor a la que tuvieron en la vida , en sus inicios comenzó con dos cortes D. tela y pocos adornos recuerda pero con el tiempo a podido ir surtiendo el numero D. telas que muestra a el publico y a la vez irse actualizando con los modelos mas recientes D. costura.

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, and accessories to sew as she needs an ample supply of these products to show customers who visit her shop.

loans.name: Marta  Lorena

texts.es:
Mrs. L. lives in La Libertad and has had her business in the same place for four years. She has always liked business, and prior to having the store in her home she used to sell clothing as traveling salesperson, but while her children were growing up she decided to open a business in her home which would allow her to dedicate more time to ther children and attend to their needs. She has three children, two of whom still depend on her income. The store has helped her be able to cover some of her childresn’s school expenses and contribute with her husband to the household expenses.

She is well-known in the area and has a good number of customers that pay her bimonthly or monthly. That money she collects is reinvested and used to stock her products that the customers seek. She needs a loan to invest in purchasing clothing for the school year as that is what her clients are asking for the most at this time.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

la señora L. vive en la actualidad en la Libertad, de tener su negocio en el mismo lugar tiene cuatro años siempre le a gustado el comercio antes de tener la tienda en su casa comercializaba con ropa de forma ambulante , pero mientras sus hijos iban creciendo decidió el poner un negocio en la misma casa que le permitiera el poder dedicarles mas tiempo y poder atender algunas necesidades que ellos tenían, cuenta con tres hijos los cuales dos únicamente dependen de sus ingresos, la tienda le ayudado a poder costear algunos gastos de estudio de sus hijos y a contribuir con su esposo con las responsabilidades.

Es muy conocida en la zona maneja un buen numero de clientes que le pagan de manera quincenal o mensual , ese dinero que recoge le sirve para poder reinvertirlo y surtir con los productos que le buscan, su necesidad actual es invertir en ropa para la época escolar ya que es la que mas le solicitan sus clientes.

loans.use: She will buy basic grains to sell in her store: beans, corn, rice; in addition she will buy items such as  underwearp for adults and children that she sells out in her neighborhood

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
We find 46 year old Juana in her humble home, avidly preparing her merchandise to sell to the inhabitants of her community. She is the mother of six children, four of whom still depend on her and that is her main motivation to shape the vision of the future. She offers a great variety of knitted ponchos. While she sells ponchos, her husband, Victor, works as a driver providing private service in their city. Juan wishes to have a secure place with a great variety of clothing items, she is sure that with this expansion she will strengthen her business and improve their quality of life. In order to make this happen she needs a loan to invest in the purchase of a large quantity of products to sell, and thereby little by little obtaining better opportunities for the benefit of her family. Juana is awaiting your collaboration.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Encontramos a doña Juana de 46 años de edad, en su humilde domicilio, preparando ávidamente su mercadería para ofertarlos a la población de su comunidad, ella es madre de seis hijos, cuatro de ellos aún dependientes y es la principal motivación que posee para conservar su deseo de progreso. Oferta una inmensa variedad de ponchos tejidos.Mientras ella se dedica a esta labor, su esposo, Víctor, trabaja como chofer brindando servicio de movilidad rural en una empresa privada de su ciudad.El deseo de doña Juana es poseer un puesto seguro de ventas con una inmensa variedad de prendas de vestir, ella está segura que con esta ampliación fortalecerá su negocio y mejorará su calidad de vida.Para concretar sus planes requiere obtener un préstamo de dinero para invertirlos en la compra de mayor volumen de productos para comercializarlos, y así poco a poco conseguir mejores utilidades para el beneficio de su familia.Juana en este momento está en espera de tu colaboración.

loans.use: Increased capital to be able to offer a greater variety of articles in a secure locale.

loans.name: Luzdelia

texts.es:
Mr. Vicente, his wife Luzdelia and his three kids have been very well-known by their noble artisan work in clay. Vicente and Luzdelia start their daily work at 8:00 am and finish at 8:00 pm. They have increased their popularity thanks to their detailed work.

They work really hard to pay their three kids college tuitions, since their three kids are currently attending to Puno College. Vicente and Luzdelia would like to maximize her clay and plaster art skills and generate extra income with the help of this loan they will buy raw materials to increase production and fulfill the demand of their beautiful artisan work.

Translated from spanish to english by Mayra Villegas, Kiva volunteer

La familia de don Vicente y su esposa Luzdelia, siempre ha sido muy conocida por la noble labor artesanal que realizan.Este fascinante oficio lo heredaron de sus padres, quienes con mucha agilidad y habilidad realizaban cada una de las piezas que adornaban sus objetos de la línea Ornamental que ofrecían sus familias y que Vicente y su esposa actualmente con el mismo amor y paciencia inculcan en sus tres queridos hijos.Luzdelia y su esposo inician su labor diaria basada en arcilla a las 8:00 de la mañana, culminándola a las 8:00 de la noche, debido a que constantemente tienen gran cantidad de solicitudes por los novedosos y finos acabados de sus trabajos.Estos encantadores padres realizan muy contentos este arte, con el objetivo de generar ingresos extras y solventar la carrera profesional que cada uno de ellos ha elegido en la Universidad de Puno. El deseo de Luzdelia y Vicente es hacer de su trabajo el mejor, con excelentes acabados y novedosos modelos, es por esa razón que desea obtener un préstamo para invertirlos en la compra de materia prima, arcilla y pintura con el objetivo de seguir produciendo su divino arte.Ayudemos a cristalizar los sueños de la señora Luzdelia y su esposo Vicente.

loans.use: Purchase of raw material: clay and paint

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
At about 62 kilometers from the city of Juliaca, there's a small town of Pukara. This is a very well known place because the people of this town are very well known for their beautiful pottery. Doña Luisa's family is no stranger to this gift since her and her husband have been making these pots and then sell them in the different fairs around the city of Puno. They begin working every day at 9:00am and finish at 5:00pm. They are always accompanied by their young children, who at a young age are already learning this beautiful art of making pottery. In the future they will be able to work on their own creations. Doña Luisa and her husband's wish is to increase production but in order to do this, they need more raw materials. This is why they are requesting the loan. Luisa and her hard working family needs your support in order to make their wishes come true.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

A unos 62 kilómetros de la ciudad de Juliaca, está ubicado el pueblito de Pukará, este lugar es muy conocido porque en su interior alberga pobladores muy laboriosos con un don innato por la artesanía. La familia de doña Luisa no es ajena a este bello arte y junto a su esposo se dedica a elaborar una inmensa variedad de ollas de arcilla para comercializarlas en las ferias de los diferentes pueblitos del departamento de Puno.Ellos inician su labor cotidiana a las 9:00 de la mañana y la culminan a las 5:00 de la tarde, acompañados siempre de sus menores niños, quienes a muy corta edad van aprendiendo sigilosamente los conocimientos de arte de sus padres, para que en el futuro puedan crear y desarrollar al máximo sus capacidades como hasta ahora vienen haciéndolo sus padres.El deseo de doña Luisa y su esposo Luis es perfeccionar este bello arte y aumentar la cantidad de su producción, para ello requiere adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima (arcilla) y hace la solicitud de un préstamo. “Luisa y su laboriosa familia requieren de tu apoyo para concretar sus proyectos.

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Diuselinda

texts.es:
Diuselinda, a very creative lady, has developed her ceramic and plaster art skills to the maximum. She inherited these skills from her dad, who will encourage her to create wonderful pieces. She also works as a teacher in a little elementary school located in a small town called Pukará.

She would like export her ceramic and plaster pieces. She knows her pieces will have a huge demand abroad. Diuselina is planning on using this income to send her younger brother to college, who she has been supporting since her dad passed away.

She’s asking for a $ 1175 loan to invest in raw material such as clay, plaster and paint to produce this beautiful art pieces and sell them abroad. Your generous contribution will be well invested in Diuselina’s hands.

Translated from Spanish to English by Mayra Villegas, Kiva Volunteer

Diuselinda, es una dama muy creativa que con mucha imaginación y paciencia ha desarrollado al máximo sus capacidades para el arte; ella aprendió esta bella labor de su padre, quien desde muy niña con mucha diligencia inculcó cada uno de sus conocimientos y que ahora gracias a su habilidad y agilidad va cosechando triunfos y muchas satisfacciones.Adicionalmente a este arte en cerámica y yeso, Diuselinda, se desenvuelve en su noble labor de maestra, brindando sus conocimientos a los alumnos de una humilde escuelita del pueblito de Pukará.El deseo de esta abnegada maestra es exportar su mercadería, ella considera que su trabajo será muy apreciado y solicitado en el exterior; con los beneficios que obtenga pretende ofrecerle una profesión a su hermano menor quien desde que su padre falleció quedo a cargo de Diuselinda.Para concretar sus deseos desea obtener un préstamo de 3,800.00 soles, a fin de invertirlos en la compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima (arcilla, yeso, pintura) comprometiéndose a reembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de seis meses.Tu generoso aporte será muy bien invertido en las manos de Diuselinda.

loans.use: To purchase a greater amount of raw material.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Selling books on the street became the only source of income for Miguel Angel, humble 19 year-old young man who's been doing this for three years. This young man has many projects for his future., selling books in schools, playgrounds, parks, and bus stops. He's good at what he does, this is why he's been able to support himself through this. His wish is to add more books and therefore have more to offer to his clients. He would pay back this loan and with the money he would be able to pay for his technical career education. This young man awaits for your help, let's make his dream come true.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de libros en forma ambulatoria se convirtió en el único ingreso económico de Miguel Ángel, joven humilde de 19 años de edad, quien desde hace tres años diariamente viene ganándose la vida con este noble oficio.Este emprendedor y luchador joven con innumerables proyectos en su vida futura, ofrece sus libros en los diferentes colegios, parques y autobuses de servicio urbano de la ciudad de Juliaca, utilizando hábilmente sus conocimientos y agilidad de palabra para la venta de los mismos, estos dotes le permiten mejorar considerablemente sus ventas diarias planificadas.Su deseo es aumentar el monto de su capital de inversión, para eso requiere obtener un préstamo de dinero que será invertido completamente en adquirir más libros para ofrecerlos a los pobladores que desean instruirse con esta valiosa herramienta, y con las ganancias que obtenga luego de comercializarlas poder pagar la mensualidad de su carrera técnica.Este joven espera vuestra colaboración, posibilitemos su petición.

loans.use: Increase his capital in order to purchase more books

loans.name: Teresita

texts.es:
In one of the busiest streets of the little town of Pukará – Puno, we find Teresita offering delicious fruit juices. This hardworking lady is mother to one ten year old son, who is the main reason for her work. Teresita offers a variety of fruit juices on Wednesdays, Thursdays and Fridays from 7:00 in the morning until 4:00 in the afternoon. In addition to this job, she has a small grocery store, an activity from which she gets additional income for her son’s education. Teresita’s wish is to expand her juice selling business, and for this she needs a loan to invest in the purchase of an extractor, a blender and a tricycle to better serve her customers and above all to increase the variety of basic needs items in her little store. Teresita anxiously awaits your response.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

En una de las calles más comerciales del pueblito de Pukará – Puno, encontramos a doña Teresita, ofreciendo su delicioso néctar de frutas. Esta laboriosa dama es madre soltera de un niño de diez años, quien es la razón principal de su progreso.Teresita ofrece su variado jugo de frutas los días miércoles, jueves y viernes desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 4:00 de la tarde, adicionalmente a esta labor se dedica ha atender su pequeña bodeguita de abarrotes, actividad por el que obtiene ingresos extras para la educación de su pequeño niño.El deseo de Teresita es ampliar su puesto de ventas de jugos de frutas, para eso requiere obtener un préstamo de dinero que invertirá en la compra de una extractora, licuadora y un triciclo para mayor comodidad de sus clientes y sobre todo para aumentar la variedad de insumos de primera necesidad de su tiendita.Teresita espera ansiosa tu respuesta.

loans.use: Purchase a blender, extractor and tricycle

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
We find Benita and her happy husband, Pablo, proudly showing us their beautiful clay ceramic works. The inherited this beautiful art from their humble parents, who were the best artisans and clayworkers in their small town, Pukará. Now this pair lovingly continues the same work, beginning their daily work at 8:00 in the morning and finishing at 6:00 in the evening, every day of the week. Then when they have a large quantity of products, they sell them in the markets in the states of Arequipa, Cuzco, Puno and Lima. Benita and Pablo wish to offer a profession to their four children, who shortly will be starting their university studies. In order to make their dreams reality they need greater income from their work and therefore they are asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of raw material (clay) and thereby increase their production volume of their beautiful and incomparable objects.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Encontramos a Benita y su alegre esposo Pablo, mostrando orgullosamente sus hermosos trabajos de cerámica en arcilla. Ellos heredaron este bello arte de sus humildes padres, quienes fueron los mejores artesanos y alfareros de su pueblito Pukará. Ahora esta pareja gustosamente desempeña el mismo oficio, ellos inician su labor diaria a las 8:00 de la mañana culminándola a las 6.00 de la tarde, durante todos los días de la semana; luego de contar con gran cantidad de productos se dedican a venderlos en los mercados de los departamentos de Arequipa, Cuzco, Puno y Lima.El deseo de Benita y Pablo es ofrecerles una profesión a sus cuatro hijos, quienes dentro de muy poco tiempo estarán siguiendo sus estudios superiores. Para concretar sus anhelos requieren obtener mayor ingreso con sus trabajos es por eso que hacen la solicitud de un préstamo a fin de invertirlos en la compra de materia prima (arcilla) de esa manera aumentar el volumen de producción de sus hermosos e incomparables adornos.

loans.use: Purchase a large quantity of raw material

loans.name: Rubén

texts.es:
Rubén and Virginia are a young married couple with many plans for their future. Rubén comes from a family of artesans and therefore he has this trade in his blood, and his enchanting wife learned this beautiful ceramic clay art very quickly. Both live in Hutta in the Pukará district. They make the best and most beautiful sculpted clay art with their fine hands, making a great variety of statues, decorative objects, and pots that they later put in the oven, paint, and sell in the market. During these months of high demand, Rubén travels constantly to deliver their products to the markets in different states in Peru, meanwhile his young wife Virginia, 18 years old, stays home to keep on carefully making their extensive variety of beautiful objects. With this opportunity the young couple needs your support and is asking for a loan to acquire a large quantity of raw material (clay). This hard-working couple awaits your response.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Rubén y Virginia, son una pareja de esposos muy joven con innumerables planes para su vida futura. Rubén proviene de una familia de artesanos y es por ello que este don lo lleva en la sangre, y su encantadora esposa aprendió rápidamente este bello oficio de cerámica en arcilla.Ambos actualmente viven en la comunidad de Hutta distrito de Pukará; hicieron de este trabajo el mejor y más bello arte moldeando la arcilla con sus finas manos formando gran variedad de estatuillas, adornos decorativos y vasijas que luego de colocarlas al horno proceden a pintarlas y venderlas en el mercado.Por estos meses que se han convertido en temporadas de mucha demanda, Rubén, viaja constantemente para repartir sus productos en los mercados de los diferentes departamentos del Perú, en tanto Virginia su joven esposa de 18 años se queda en su domicilio para seguir elaborando con esmero sus extensas variedades de objetos de gran belleza.En esta oportunidad esta joven pareja requiere de tu apoyo y hace la solicitud de un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima ( arcilla).Esta laboriosa pareja espera tu pronta respuesta.

loans.use: Purchase a large quantity of raw material

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia is an exemplary daughter and sacrificing mother. Her husband abandoned her when her son Rodrigo was just born, and now he is two years old. Since then, with much strength and perseverance, she decided to continue on with her son and her aged parents, who at all times have given her unconditional support. This hardworking mother, as daughter of great ceramic artesans, decided to use her knowledge, demonstrating her qualities and abilities for this splendid art, designing a great variety of piggy banks, decorative pieces, flower vases, etc. Eulalia’s wish is to export her merchandise. She is sure that with her will, a lot of effort, and above all with your support she will be able to make her dreams reality and thereby finally offer a better quality of life to her son and her dear parents who are the reason for her continuous efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Eulalia, es una ejemplar hija y sacrificada madre. Su esposo la abandonó cuando apenas nació su pequeño niño Rodrigo, que ahora tiene dos añitos, desde entonces con mucha más fuerza y perseverancia decidió progresar en compañía de su hijo y de sus ancianos padres, quienes en todo momento le brindaron su apoyo incondicional.Esta laboriosa madre, como hija de grandes artesanos en cerámica, decidió sacar a flote sus conocimientos, demostrando de esa manera sus cualidades y habilidades para este esplendoroso arte, diseñando así gran variedad de alcancías, adornos decorativos, floreros, etc.El deseo de Eulalia es exportar su mercadería, ella está segura que con su voluntad, mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo con tu desinteresado apoyo podrá concretar sus pretensiones y así finalmente ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida su hijo y a sus queridos padres quienes son la razón de su continuo esfuerzo.

loans.use: Purchase a large quantity of raw materials in order to continue making her beautiful articles.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa Bertila is a 49 year old single mother of three children. Daily she works to be able to give her youngest son what he needs, with the end goal that he will be able to reach his goal and pursue studies for a career he has chose. She is the owner of a motorcar, additionally she depends on the income from rooms she rents to young people from her community, and this allows her to live comfortably. Keeping in mind that this is dependable income that she counts on month to month she has decided to better the rooms of her small house, and that is why she needs the loan to enable her to better this place with the end goal of making the rooms more comfortable and secure for her tenants. We support Mrs. Rosa Bertila to meet her objective. She will not disappoint you.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rosa Bertila, es madre soltera de 49 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, el objetivo de su esfuerzo diario es porque desea otorgarle las facilidades necesarias a su menor hijo, a fin de que éste pueda alcanzar su meta y desarrollarse plenamente en la carrera que ha elegido estudiar.Ella es propietaria de un motocarro, además mensualmente cuenta con el ingreso de las habitaciones que otorga en alquiler a jóvenes de su comunidad los cuales le permiten vivir cómodamente. Teniendo en cuenta que este es el ingreso seguro con el que cuenta mes a mes ha decidido mejorar las instalaciones de esta pequeña casa es por eso que ella necesita un capital que le permita mejorar este lugar a fin de brindar mayor comodidad y seguridad a sus inquilinos.Apoyemos a la señora Rosa Bertila a cumplir con su objetivo ella no te defraudará.

loans.use: Repair her vehicle and expand two rooms in order to rent them

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela has been selling general household products for three years. She wishes to increase her income by expanding the locale in which she daily offers her products, converting her business in to one of the largest household goods stores in the city. She is the mother of two children who are professionals and are outside the country. Manuela has the goal of growing and raising her quality of life with her business and for that she needs an loan that will allow her to meet her goals. With your help soon she will be able to make her dreams reality.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Manuela, se dedica a la venta de productos de pasamanería desde hace tres años, desea incrementar sus ingresos económicos con la ampliación de las instalaciones en las que ofrece a diario cada uno de sus productos para convertirlo más adelante en una de las casas más grandes de pasamanería de su ciudad.Ella es madre de dos hijos los mismos que ya son profesionales y se encuentran radicando fuera del país.Manuela, tiene un objetivo progresar y elevar su nivel de vida con su ocupación y para ello requiere de un capital de inversión que le permitirá lograr su propósito. Con tu ayuda pronto podrá convertir sus anhelos en realidad.

loans.use: Invest in her small business.

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es:
Elvia is 48 years old and has been selling candy for a long time with much success. She has four children who are the light of her life since they arrived in this world. This noble mother wishes to grow the items she offers for sale by offering larger quantities in a well-equipped establishment. So to start down this great path that she wishes to travel with your help, she asks for help from your noble heart in order to make this goal come true in the near future. Support Mrs. Elvia, she is hard working and promises not to disappoint you.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Elvia, de 48 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de golosinas desde hace mucho tiempo con mucho éxito, tiene cuatro hijos que se han convertido en la luz que alumbra su camino desde que llegaron a este mundo.Esta noble madre de familia desea acrecentar la venta de los artículos que oferta hasta ofertarlo en grandes cantidades en un establecimiento bien equipado a fin de iniciar el gran camino que desea recorrer con su labor solicita la ayuda de tu noble corazón a fin de cristalizar su objetivo en poco tiempo.Apoya a la señora Elvia, ella es trabajadora y promete no defraudarte.

loans.use: Enlarge her small establishment

loans.name: Padi Bali Group

texts.id:
The farmer group "PADI BALI" is headed by I Wajan P.. The member of this farmer group is: I Wajan P., I Gede Ketut S., I Wajan S., I Gede Nyoman S., I Ketut A., I Wayan W., I Ketut S., I Nyoman B., I Gede Ketut W., I Wayan B., I Gede Ketut S., I Ketut W..

As Balinese farmers, they do the farming as a group in accordance with the decision made by their village. This approach is beneficial to all. The water is distributed fairly. Up to now they do the farming in a convensional way. They use bufallo to work on their field.

With the loan money, they are planning to buy a tractor, costing them IDR 8 million (approx. US$ 840). Indeed not everyone will have a tractor, but this tractor will be used together by the group.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Kelompok tani Padi Bali yang diketuai I Wayan P. ini beranggotakan : I Wayan P., I Gede Ketut S., I Wayan S., I Gede Nyoman S., I Ketut A., I Wayan W., I Ketut S., I Nyoman B., I Gede Ketut W., I Wayan B., I Gede Ketut S., I Ketut W.. Sebagai petani Bali mereka melakukan penanaman secara serempak sesuai dengan keputusan adat. Tentu saja hal ini akan sangat menguntungkan semua pihak. Air akan mereka bagi dengan adil. Pengolahan lahan yang selama ini mereka lakukan adalah dengan menggunakan cara konvensional. Mereka masih menggunakan kerbau untuk membajak sawah mereka. Melalui pinjaman yang diperoleh, mereka berencana mempermudah pekerjaan mereka dengan membeli sebuah traktor senilai Rp 8.000.000,00. Memang tidak setiap orang akan memiliki traktor, melainkan dari satu traktor yang ada akan di manfaatkan bersama.

loans.use: to buy a tractor, seeds and fertilizer (membeli sebuah traktor, bibit, dan pupuk)

loans.name: Nagina's Group

texts.en:
I am Nagina B. from Multan, a mid-size city in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of six. I embroider clothes in my house. My husband is paralyzed and does not work. One of my sons is a rickshaw driver and now we need a loan to repair our rickshaw. Rickshaw is our major source of income and therefore, please lend us loan to get it repaired as early as possible.

My group members are: Saeeda P., who will use the loan to buy cloth in bulk; Shaheena P., who requires a loan for her husband’s breakfast stall; Noreen S., who needs a loan for her embroidery business; Ameer B., who requires loan for her son’s jewelry business expansion.

loans.use: Get rickshaw repaired

loans.name: Asiah's Group

texts.en:
My name is Asiah S. from Multan, a mid-size city in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of seven: five girls and two boys. All of my kids attend school. I sew clothes for my neighborhood clients and my husband operates a food stall. Now he requires a loan to buy a few items such as pulses and rice in bulk for his stall.

There are four other members in my group: Mussarat A. makes objects out of plaster-of-paris, and needs to expand their business. Anila K. needs a loan for their grocery store. Hasina Z. will invest her loan in their fruits business. Azia I. also requires a loan for their fruits business.

loans.use: Expand food stall

loans.name: Nadia's Group

texts.en:
I am Nadia Gulam A., from Multan, a city famous for its shrines in Pakistan. I am a mother of two daughters, both of whom attend a local school. My husband has a fridge and air conditioner repair store. Now, he needs to buy few spare parts for his business and therefore requires a loan.

My group members are: Khalida N., who needs a loan to buy cloth for her stitching business; Saeeda A., who plans to invest in their grocery store; Naziran N., who requires a loan for her son to start up a dry fruits stall; Zarina B., who needs a loan for their fruits business.

loans.use: Buy spare parts for the electronics repair business

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
I am Nasreen R.. I am married and a mother of five: three girls and two boys. I live with my family in a two-room brick house in a mid-size town--Multan, Pakistan. My husband is a daily wage laborer and constructs buildings; along with this work he operates a grocery store. He plans to expand his store so that he can quit his construction work. We need a loan for this purpose.

My group members who are in needs of loan are: Sughran R., who plans a loan for their fruits business; Riffat P., who needs a loan to buy cloth; Nasreen I., who needs a loan for her husband’s grocery store; Khalida H., who intends to buy cloth for her business with your loan.

loans.use: Expand grocery store

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
I am a widow, Naseem B.. I am married and a mother of two sons. I live with my family in Multan, a mid-size town in Pakistan. One of my daughters-in-law died few years ago and left three kids. Now, I am the caretaker of these kids. My elder son is the breadwinner of our family and he is a rickshaw driver. Now, he requires a loan for rickshaw maintenance.

There are two other members in my loan group; all of us are mutually responsible for each other’s loans. Koser P. requires a loan for her beauty salon. Tasleem F. requires a loan to expand their fruits business.

loans.use: Get rickshaw repaired

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
I am Shahnaz B., wife of Abad Ali. I have lived all my life in Multan and I am a mother of one son who studies in grade three. My husband and I both create clothes. Now, we need a loan for our business and to start our own boutique. Currently, my husband works for someone for very low pay and now we need to start our own business. We both have a strong desire to educate our son so that he can find good employment for himself.

There are a few other women who need loans for their businesses and we guarantee each other's loans. Tasleem B. needs a loan for their scrap business. Kaneez B. needs loan for their fruits business. Abida B.'s husband also has a scrap business and needs a loan to improve it. Arshad B. intends to use a loan for her husband’s ice-cream manufacturing business.

loans.use: Start a boutique

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
I am Samina M. F. from Multan, a mid-size city in Pakistan. I am married and mother of an only daughter who is nine months old. I and my husband both are tailors and we now want to start a grocery store along with our existing business, because our tailoring business is very seasonal and we are unable to generate steady income. We now plan to expand our business so that we can have a steady source of income and we can save for our daughter’s future.

My group members are Shahnaz A., who plans to invest loan in their electric store; Khursheed B., who requires a loan for her son who needs to buy motorcycle spare parts; Rafia S., who requires a loan for their shoe business; Yasmeen K., who needs a loan for her son’s embroidery business. All of these are very cooperative and they strive hard to bring incomes to their families.

loans.use: Open up a grocery store

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
My name is Kalsoom Z.. I have lived all my life in Multan, a mid-size city in Pakistan. My husband has a motorcycle repair business and he has been doing this business since his teens. Now he plans to expand his business further and needs a loan for this purpose.

I want my community to grow and therefore I want to help a few other women. They are: Hafeezan B., who she needs a loan for their animal fodder business; Nasreen B. will also invest in their livestock fodder business; Naziran B., who needs a loan to buy a spinning machine.

loans.use: Expand motorcycle repair business

loans.name: Koser's Group

texts.en:
My name is Koser P., wife of Muhammad Arif. I live in a two-room brick house here in Multan, a mid-size city in Pakistan. I have an embroidery business and my husband has a loom. I want to grow my embroidery business and generate good profits for my family. I need a loan for this purpose and plan to buy cloth and threads, etc. in bulk. Buying in bulk is relatively cheaper and will allow me to save on cost per item.

There are few other women in my loan group and we together assume loan responsibility for each other. They are: Muqsodan B., who requires loan for her son’s grocery store; Mariam B., who needs a loan for her bangles business; Sajida B., who needs loan for her husband’s weaving and wants to take on bigger orders: Aziz B. requires a loan for her husband to repair his rickshaw. I want all of them to get loans so that they can also improve their businesses.

loans.use: Expand embroidery business

loans.name: Majeedan's Group

texts.en:
I am Majeedan S. A.. I have lived all my life in Multan, a mid-size city in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of eight. I and my husband together manufacture cloth on our looms. I need a loan for our cloth manufacturing business. Our business generates decent profits. We plan to save money for our children’s marriage.

I have a friend in my neighborhood and I want to help her and get loan. We together assume loan responsibility for each other. Safia B. needs to buy animals for their livestock trading business.

loans.use: Expand cloth manufacturing business

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 36 years old and has three children. Two of them are already studying in school and his small son will go next year. He has a small bakery shop which he depends on it for his living. He applied to get $1200 to purchase new bakery machines, hire one unemployed person and renovate the shop to improve his life and increase his income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk. Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering his name, etc.).

loans.use: To purchase new bakery machines

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur 34 years old. He is married and has two children. His sister and his elderly mother live with him in a rented house. He has a small market to sell home supplies and he applied to get $1200 to purchase new goods, make new shelves, paint the shop and do some advertising for to increase his income and provide a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering his name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new goods

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Anyone who first sees Mrs. Bẩy would be surprised by her young, cute look despite the fact that she is the owner of one of the biggest poultry farms in the Tân Hưng village. Mrs. Trần Thị Bẩy is 32 years old, got married at young age of 19. Early marriage and tough life seem could not deter her fresh, young look. She joined the TYM Fund in 1999 with her first loan of 100USD to invest in the family’s poultry business and the brick manufacturing. In subsequent years, she took out bigger loans and concentrated in poultry farming more. In 2005, the family decided to build a big poultry farm. The business booms. Now she has a flock of 1300 hens for egg and 2000 quails which provides a comfortable income of 200USD monthly. The family’s economy is steady and she has purchased a half acre lot for fruit trees. Mrs Bẩy would like to take a loan of 950USD to buy feed and invest in a incubator that would avoid sending eggs to other farms.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Mới gặp chị Bẩy, ai cũng ngạc nhiên khi thấy một bà chủ trại chăn nuôi gà và chim cút vào loại nhất nhì xã Tân Hưng lại trẻ và nhỏ nhắn đến vậy. Chị Trần Thị Bẩy năm nay 32 tuổi, xây dựng gia đình từ năm 19, cuộc sống vất vả của người có gia đình sớm không làm mất đi được sự tươi trẻ ở con người chị. Năm 1999, chị tham gia Quỹ Tình thương, mới đầu chỉ vay mức 100USD để chăn nuôi gà và đầu tư vào lò gạch. Những năm tiếp theo, chị vay tăng dần và đầu tư nhiều hơn vào chăn nuôi. Năm 2005, gia đình quyết định xây dựng trang trại chăn nuôi với quy mô lớn. Công việc tiến triển rất thuận lợi. Đến nay, chị có 1300 gà đẻ trứng, 2000 con chim cút cho thu nhập bình quân 200USD/tháng. Hiện tại, kinh tế của gia đình khá ổn định, chị đã mua được 4 sào đất để trồng cây ăn quả. Vòng vốn này, chị dự định vay mức 950USD để mua thức ăn gia cầm, và đầu tư mở lò ấp trứng, tận dụng luôn sản phẩm từ gà và chim cút, không phải đi bán cho các lò khác nữa...

loans.use: Buy food for poultry, buy incubator

loans.name: Dong Thi

texts.vi:
