In Thắng Lợi village everyone knows Mrs. Đồng Thị D.. She is 46 years old, a member of group 33, an excellent in commerce and economic development group, of the TYM Fund. She joined the Fund in 1996 with her first loan of 30USD to invest in a rice mill and few pigs. Feed for pigs comes from the mill. The following year, she borrowed more and switched to selling poultry. Within few years she has saved a good sum. In 2003, she borrowed more, and together with her saving, she and her husband remodeled their house to open a café which serves breakfasts. He is the chef while she serves and manages the café. The cafe becomes popular that they brought in 2 more employees with monthly salary of 50USD each to fulfill the demands. The family’s economy is comfortable with monthly income of 300USD. Though busy, she still holds on her pigs. She is applying for a loan of 950USD to expand her enterprises.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.

Ở thôn Thắng Lợi, ai cũng biết đến chị Đồng Thị D., 46 tuổi, thành viên cụm 33 Quỹ Tình thương về làm ăn kinh tế giỏi. Năm 1996, chị D. tham gia vào Quỹ và vay mức 30USD đầu tư cho máy xay xát gạo và nuôi vài con lợn, tận dụng cám vụn của máy sát. Năm tiếp theo chị vay mức cao hơn và chuyển sang đi chợ buôn bán ngan, gà. Chị rất có duyên kinh doanh. Qua mấy năm, chị đã tích lũy được số vốn kha khá. Năm 2003, số vốn vay từ Quỹ cộng với số tiền dành dụm được, chị D. cùng chồng sửa lại nhà và mở cửa hàng ăn sáng. Anh là đầu bếp chính, chuyên chế biến món ăn, chị phục vụ và quản lý. Khách đến cửa hàng rất đông, thế nên chị D. đã thuê thêm 2 người làm, trả với mức lương 50USD/tháng/người. Hiện tại, công việc kinh doanh của gia đình rất phát triển, chị vẫn đang chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập của gia đình hàng tháng là 300USD. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay mức 950 USD để mua thêm thực phẩm cho bán hàng ăn sáng và mua thức ăn cho lợn. Chị quả là một người phụ nữ năng động và tháo vát.

loans.use: Buy food for her restaurant

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lê Thị Quyền, 46 years old, lives with her husband and 3 children in Minh Phú, Sóc Sơn province. In 1996, the TYM Fund opened more branches to rural areas, she was one of the firsts joining the Fund. In the first year, she took out a loan of 30USD to invest in poultry. She also processes and sells chicken meat at home. In 2000, the family has had a farm of 300 to 500 chickens for meat. Her farm processes about 100 kg chicken meat every day for retails and restaurants in the area. Part of the income, they invest in their son’s education in the electronic vocational school. In November 2007, she took a lease and opened a store selling mobile phones in downtown Sóc Sơn. She is applying for a loan of 950USD to buy chicken. The family’s income is about 250USD a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Lê Thị Quyền, 46 tuổi, sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại xã Minh Phú, Sóc Sơn. Năm 1996, chi nhánh 2 Quỹ Tình thương mở rộng địa bàn hoạt động ra các thôn trong xã, chị là một trong những người đầu tiên của thôn tham gia thành lập cụm 13. Năm thứ nhất chị xin vay 30USD mua gà con về chăn nuôi và mổ thịt bán tại nhà với số lượng nhỏ. Đến năm 2000 gia đình chị đã mở rộng mô hình chăn nuôi với số lượng lớn, trong chuồng luôn có từ 300 - 500 con gà thịt. Mỗi ngày cửa hàng của chị Quyền giết mổ khoảng 100kg gà bán lẻ tại chợ huyện Sóc Sơn và xuất cho các nhà hàng ăn uống trong huyện. Từ tiền lãi thu được chị bàn với chồng đầu tư cho con trai đi học lớp sửa chữa điện tử. Tháng 11/2007 gia đình chị đã thuê địa điểm và mở cửa hàng kinh doanh điện thoại di động tại huyện Sóc Sơn. Vòng vốn này chị Quyền xin vay 950USD để mua gà thịt. Thu nhập hiện tại của gia đình hàng tháng khoảng 250USD

loans.use: Buy chicken

loans.name: Rhina Luz

texts.es:
Señora Rhina Luz P. lives in Ciudad Arce and has three children. Her husband helps her by selling clothing, but the money he obtains through these sales isn't enough to support their family. This is why Rhina started a store where she sells basic food items (coffee, broth, bread, sauces, etc.) in her home several years ago. She uses the earnings from her store to supplement her family's income. The requested loan will be used to purchase products to further supply her store and also to purchase more clothing. Rhina hopes to start selling wholesale and to generate more income, with the aim of obtaining economic stability and a better future for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Rhina Luz P., vive en Ciudad Arce, tiene 3 hijos, su esposo le ayuda a través D. la venta D. ropa, pero el dinero que obtiene en la comercialización D. la ropa no es suficiente para mantener a la familia, debido a ello doña Rhina desD. hace ya varios años estableció una tienda D. venta D. productos D. primera necesidad(café, consomés, pan, salsas,etc) en su casa, con la cual logran complementar el sostenimiento D. la familia, el préstamo solicitado es para comprar productos para surtir más la tienda y también compra D. más ropa , con el afán D. empezar a vender por mayoreo y generar con ello más ingresos, con el fin D. lograr estabilidad económica y un futuro más digno para ella y su familia.

loans.use: To purchase products to further supply her store and to purchase more clothing

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es:
Señor Juan José Néftali P. lives in the municipality of Colón, where he started working as a boy in the trade of shoe making with his father, since his father had a shoe shop through which he supported the entire family. Now Nefta, as his friends and clients call him, continues with the shoe shop, and at 67-years-old, he has aspirations of making it grow since he is one of the most sought-after shoe makers in the region because of the experience, reliability, and quality with which he attends to his clients. He tells us that it has been a difficult road that he has had to travel to take good care of his family, and the road of fighting and selflessness hasn't ended for him. He still hasn't completely fulfilled his dream of making his shop bigger and more productive so his children and grandchildren can inherit it. The fundamental purpose for requesting the loan is to buy more materials like leather, glue, heels, lining, etc. He hopes these will make his shop more competitive so he can make his dream a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

El Sr. Juan José Néftali P. , vive en el municipio de Colón, desde que era un niño inicio a trabajar en el oficio de la zapatería junto a su padre, ya que este tenia un taller de zapatería del cual mantenía a toda la familia, hoy en día don Néfta como le dicen sus amigos y clientes continua con el negocio de zapatería, a sus 67 años tiene aspiraciones de hacer crecer el negocio ya que es uno de los zapateros más solicitados en la zona por su basta experiencia, seriedad y calidad con la que atiende a sus clientes , el expresa que ha sido un camino muy arduo, el que ha tenido que recorrer para sacar adelante a su familia , pero el camino de lucha y abnegación no termina para él , ya que todavía no ha logrado por completo el sueño que quiere hacer realidad y es el de hacer un taller más grande y más productivo, que sirva de legado para sus hijos y nietos , el propósito fundamental de solicitar el préstamo es para comprar más insumos como cuero, pegamento, tacones, forros, etc., que le lleven a ser más competitivo el taller e iniciar con ello, el hacer realidad su sueño.

loans.use: Purchase of materials like leather, glue, heels, lining, etc.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

payments.comment: Juan Jose was able to pay back his loan early. Thank you for your support!

loans.name: Helia

texts.es:
Señora Helia S. lives in Ciudad Arce. Two years ago, she started her business of selling perfumes, cosmetics, and DVDs. She is 30-years-old and is a single mother of a 3-year-old little boy. She tells us that it is very difficult to survive in a country where there aren't a lot of opportunities to get ahead. In spite of the difficulties she has experienced, she is taking good care of her son, who is her reason for fighting. She is requesting the loan to increase the variety of products she offers her clients. This is how she will be able to generate more income that will allow her to offer better living conditions to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Helia S., reside en Ciudad Arce, desde hace 2 años se dedica al negocio de venta de perfumes, cosméticos y dvd's, ella tiene 30 años y es madre soltera, de un bebé de 3 años. Expresa que es muy duro el sobrevivir en un país donde no hay muchas oportunidades de superación, a pesar de las dificultades que a pasado está sacando adelante a su hijo, ya que es él su razón de lucha. Esta solicitando el préstamo para incrementar la variedad de productos a ofrecer a sus clientes, a través de ello poder generar más ingresos que le permitan brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su hijo.

loans.use: To purchase a larger variety of products like perfumes, DVDs, cosmetics, etc.

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Muthu

texts.en:
Mrs. Muthu S. is a shopkeeper in Chetrapati, Kathmandu. She opened her grocery shop 3 years ago. Her husband's name is Ram S.. He works in a private office. Mrs. S. has two children. Her daughter and son are studying in grade 3 and 4 respectively.

Mrs. S. opened her grocery shop to uplift the standard of their living. She sells different types of grocery items in her shop. Before she opened her grocery shop, her husband was the only earner in the family. At that time, the condition of family was so poor that they could hardly live hand-to-mouth problem. Now her family condition is improving.

Now Mrs. S. is requesting her first loan of Rs10000 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Goma

texts.en:
Mrs. Goma T. lives in a village named Sainbu-Bhaishapati, one of the developing villages of Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this village are engaged in farming. Mrs. T. lives in a nuclear family with her husband and one son. Her husband is Ram Chandra T.. He works in a private office.

Mrs. T. is a shopkeeper. She opened her grocery shop 4 years ago. Her son helps her in her shop. Mrs. T. sells different types of grocery items. She opened her little grocery shop to help her husband in meeting the financial needs of their family and also in the hope of improving their standard of living.

Now Mrs. T. is requesting her first loan in the amount of US$ 175 to buy goods which are lacking in her shop.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Patan Business and Professional Women - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Shaili

texts.en:
Mrs. Shaili S. lives in a nuclear family with her husband and two sons. Her sons are both electricians. They live in Sainbu-Bhaishapati.

Mrs. S. and her husband Mr. Kancha S. opened their vegetable shop 3 years ago. Mostly they sell potatoes and onions in their shop. They buy these goods from Kalimati, a very popular vegetable market, and resell them in their neighborhood. Now she is asking for a loan in the amount of US$ 175 to buy more potatoes and onions for her shop.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and onions for her shop

loans.name: Thuli Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuli Maiya L. and her husband Mr. Dharma L. are both farmers in a village called Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Nepal. They grow different types of vegetables on their own land. Mostly they prefer to grow seasonal vegetables on their land. Mrs L.'s husband is a painter. He makes traditional paintings.

Mrs. L. has three children. All her children are grown. Her daughter is a teacher. Her only son is studying and working abroad and another son has left his studies and presently has no work.

Now Mrs. L. is requesting her 3rd loan, this time in the amount of US$ 325, to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Patan Business and Professional Women - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mukunda

texts.en:
Mukunda T. has one son who is a house painter. She lives in a nuclear family with her husband and her one son. Mukunda already owns one milch cow and she has been selling milk in her area. In Nepal pure, fresh grass-fed cow’s milk is highly valued for its nutritional value.

Mukunda lives in a growing neighborhood and in that area the demand for milk is constantly increasing. She carries her milk containers and sells door-to-door daily in the morning and evening. Because of the rising demand, she wants to buy another cow to increase her production. Mukunda plans to purchase a Jersey cow which produces more milk than normal cows. So she is asking for a loan of US$ 325 to buy a young milch cow.

loans.use: To buy a young milch cow

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Mrs. Kamala B. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Nepal. Kamala has two sons; both are studying in Higher Secondary School. Her husband is a taxi driver and drives his taxi in Kathmandu valley.

Kamala already has one cow and she sells cow's milk door-to-door daily, morning and evening. The demand for cow's milk is increasing in that area because grass-fed cow's milk is good for health.

Now Kamala is requesting her third loan of US$ 325 to purchase a young milch cow because of the increased demand for cow’s milk in her area. She has grassland of her own, so she does not has to buy food for her cows.

loans.use: To buy a young milch cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Patan Business and Professional Women - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Sandha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sandha S., 28, lives in Thecho in Lalitpur district, Nepal. She lives in a nuclear family with her husband and two children. Her daughter is studying in grade 3 and her son is in pre-school.

Her husband's name is Gan S.. He makes various products made of clay such as pots, jugs, plates, etc. Mrs. S. sells these goods in her shop. Now she is asking for her second loan, this time a loan of US$ 250, to invest in her shop.

loans.use: To invest in her shop

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 29 years old and married and with three children. His wife and small son were wounded in a terrorist attack two months ago. He has a general store in Kirkuk and he applied to get $ 1200 to purchase a new ice box and new more goods, to paint the store and renovate it, and make new shelves. He wants to expand his project to increase his income and develop himself.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering his name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase a new ice box and new more goods

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 40 years old she has 4 children, all going to school. Her husband died two years ago in a big car explosion and she is now responsible for all of her family expenses. She has a small grocery shop and she has applied to get $1200 to purchase a new balance machine and new ice box, and to bring in more new grocery products, and renovate the shop and make a new door to keep the shop safe. She wants to increase her income and provide a better life for her family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware and accept that this loan may represent a higher risk.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect her (i.e. masking portions of the picture, altering her name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new balance machine and new ice box

loans.name: Dawood

texts.en: Dawood lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with one son. He was out of the country for about 8 years and when he came back two years ago he got married and opened a retail shop and attracted good numbers of clients. Now he wants to take an individual loan to complete his stock and make a good income to help his wife and his son. He is happy with this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Sayaad Agha

texts.en: Sayaad Agha lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with four children and he lives with his own family. He is a man full of experience. He has a mobile phone shop that fixes and sells mobiles. He needs to expand his business so he has requested an individual loan to import new designs of mobiles from different parts of the country to attract more clients and make good income to help his family.

loans.use: To import new designs of mobiles

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
"I am Samina S. from the mid-size city of Faisalabad, Pakistan. I am married and the mother of an only daughter. My husband buys and sells bricks. Now we require a loan to expand our business by taking on bigger orders.

There are two other members in my loan group. Najma N. requires a loan for their grocery shop. Sobia B. needs a loan for her blanket business. These women are my neighbors and we live together like a family."

loans.use: Expand our brick-selling business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Hameedan's Group

texts.en:
"My name is Hameedan A. M.. I am a widow and the mother of three sons and four daughters. My children had to quit their studies after their father’s death. I am a textile designer and I make embroidered bed sheets, cushions, etc. Two of my sons are turners and they requires a loan to buy a lathe (a tool used to turn objects).

My group members are: Sumaira F. and Humaira S., both of whom need a loan for their grocery stores; Farzana N. who requires a loan for their vegetable shop; and Amna S. who needs a loan to start up a grocery store for her son."

loans.use: Buy a lathe for my sons' business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
"I am Sakina B. from the mid-size city of Faisalabad, Pakistan. I am married and the mother of seven: five girls and two boys. My husband operates a small thread shop in one of the local factories. He buys thread from various factories and then sells various types at his shop. My husband now requires a loan to expand his business to increase our income.

I make and sell carpets from our home. I have few other women in my loan group; all of these women are very cooperative and responsible and each of us requires a loan for her business.

My group members are Naziran R. who requires a loan for her snack manufacturing business; Salma Y. who needs a loan for her family's bicycle business; and Humaira M. who also requires a loan for her family's snack-manufacturing business."

loans.use: Expand my husband's thread business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
"My name is Bushra N. Ahmed. I am the mother of five sons and three daughters. I live with my family in a mid-size city, Faisalabad, Pakistan. I make and sell blankets whereas my husband is a daily wage laborer. My husband is sickly and cannot work continuously. I require expanding my blanket business for which purpose I desire a loan from you.

There are three other members in my group and we are mutually responsible for each other’s loans. My group members are Zarina K. who needs a loan for their blanket-stitching business; Mehmooda A. who requires a loan for their detergent-manufacturing business; and Rafiq B. who is a widow and wants to buy her son a rickshaw."

loans.use: Expand home-based blanket manufacturing business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Zakia's Group

texts.en:
"I am Zakia B., wife of M. Amin. I am the mother of seven: three boys and four girls. I live with my family in Faisalabad, a mid-size city in Pakistan. My husband works at a towel factory and I manufacture plastic shopping bags at our home, which my son or husband then sell at various shops in the city.

Now we require a loan to invest in our shopping bag business. The two other group members in my loan group are: Saira M. Y. who requires a loan for their blanket business, and Hanifa A. who requires a loan for her grocery store."

loans.use: Expand our little home-based business manufacturing shopping bags

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
"I am Shamim A. from Faisalabad, a mid-size city in Pakistan. I am married and the mother of three: two boys and one girl. Currently, both of my sons attend school whereas my daughter is not of school-going age yet. I wish my kids to complete their studies and hence polish their futures.

My husband has a paint business and we also supply various bakery items to different bakeries in the city. Now, we require a loan to expand our bakery items business.

My group members are: Shahnaz R. and Zakia O.. Both of them need loans for their blanket businesses."

loans.use: Expand her bakery wholesale supply business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Heide Jaime

texts.pt:
Heide Jaime M. lives in Liberdade. She is married and the mother of 7 children. She sells necessary products like pastries, sodas, popcorn, crackers, cookies...etc. She entered the program June 30, 2006 with a loan for $150.00US. This is her 4th loan cycle, and she is asking for another $150.00US to increase her inventory. Her business is in front of her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Heide Jaime M., Portadora do BI nº100041170W residente do bairro da Liberdade, Vive maritalmente mae de 7 filhos é negociante vende produtos de 1º necessidade tais como ,Bolos refregerantes pipocas biscoitos etc. entrou no programa a 30/06/06, tomando o valor de 3000 mt esta no 4º coclo vai tomar o valor de 3000 mt para aumentar os produtos ,tem o seu negocio em frente da sua casa.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Gilda Sebastião

texts.pt:
Gilda Sebastião C. lives in Laulane. She is married with 4 children. She sells yogurt, cookies, and popcorn on foot. She entered the program March 14, 2007 with a loan of $130.00US and is currently on her 3rd loan cycle looking for $175.00US for 4 months. She orders her products from South Africa, and with this loan she wants to increase her inventory.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Gilda Sebastião C., potadora do BI nº111282415Z,residente no bairro de Laulane , vive maritalmente mae de 4 filhos comerciante vende: yogurtes , palone bolachas pipocas e uma vendedora ambulante, entrou no programa a 14/03/07, tomando 3000 mt esta actualmente no 3º ciclo vai tomar o valor de 4000 mt a pagar em 4 meses ela trabalha na base de encomendas compra os produtos na Africa do sul com o valor quer aumentar o s produtos.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is 30-year-old trader who owns a small store in a village of the Imishli region. He has five years of experience in selling goods. He had a store prior but because of a very difficult financial situation in his family, he was forced to sell it. He has started this new business form nothing. He purchased his first consignment of goods from savings and now he requests 1200 USD to finish purchasing the remainder of goods such as spices and beverages. Hasan currently sells candies and tea.

loans.use: To purchase goods such as spices and beverages

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Musharrafa

texts.en:
A. Musharrafa is 38 years old. She has been married for 18 years and has 3 children. Her husband is an entrepreneur. Musharrafa and her husband are raising their children with love and trying to ensure their kids having everything that a teenager may need.

Musharrafa has been running her business already for 9 years. She sells the fabrics for the national dresses. The national dresses in Tajikistan are very popular and very important item of the dowry of any girl. Musharrafa has trading places in three local markets. Being very polite with the clients and having a good taste, Musharrafa has customers in each of the trading places. All the fabrics are supplied from Dubai, United Arabian Emirates.

Musharrafa is trying to have a wide range of goods and thus to be able to meet the requirements of her customers and to satisfy the needs of the clients with different levels of income. Today Musharrafa requests 1000.00 US Dollars with the purpose of ordering delivery of a new stock of fabrics from Dubai. She would like to thank everybody who made the decision to support her and promises to pay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: Purchasing of new fabrics for increasing the range of goods

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en: Rasim is 44-year-old trader who sells men's clothes in the local Sabirabad bazaar. He started his business in 2002 after he borrowed money from his friends. Rasim has loyal customers because he always offers discounts and his goods sells very quickly.  Now Rasim would like to expand his business and start selling women's clothes along  with the mens clothes. He requests a loan of 1100 USD to purchase his first consignment of women's clothes.

loans.use: To purchase the first consignment of women's clothing

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Zarkhanum

texts.en: Zarkhanum 48-year-old woman who sells women's clothing in the local Sabirabad bazaar. She has seven years of experience in  this field and does it very well. In fact, her inventory sells quicker then it can be replaced by new consignments. She is married and has three children. Her business is the only financial source for her family. Zarkhanum is going to expand her business and increase the number of goods for sale. For this purpose she needs 1200 USD for a 18 month repayment period.

loans.use: To expand her business and increase number of goods

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Yakhya

texts.en: Yahkya is 61-year-old man who owns a small place in the central street of Sabirabad region. He is married and has two children. He has more than ten years of experience in selling cosmetic products. He started by opening a small table near his house where he sold hair coloring items. Now he requests 1200 USD to develop his working place.

loans.use: To develop his working place

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Julião Fabião

texts.pt:
Julião Fabião P., married, 3 children, lives in the neighborhood of Ndlavela, in Maputo, Mozambique. Julião is in the business of selling clothes at the Xipamanine market. He joined the credit program in 2007 and is now on his 3rd loan cycle. He will use the current loan to keep improving and expanding his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

julião Fabião P., portador do BI nº 110776251V, residente no bairro de Ndlavela, vive maritalmente tem 3 filhos comerciante vende roupas Nova entrou no negocio a 22/02/07 agora encontra se no 3º ciclo entrou tomando o valor de 4000 mt a gora vai tomar 7000 mt a pagar em 5 meses vende no mercado de xipamanine com o valor vai expandir o negocio

loans.use: To improve his Clothing Sales business

loans.name: Rufullu

texts.en: Rufulla is 45 year old trader who has been selling men clothes in the central Sabirabad bazaar for nine years. He brings in clothes from different countries which is why his goods are of high quality and sells very quickly. He is married and has three daughters. This business is the only financial source in his family and he tries very hard to cover all of his family's needs. Rufulla plans to increase number of clothes he brings in from abroad. To expand his business he has applied for a 1200 USD loan.

loans.use: To increase number of clothes

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Shafiga

texts.en: Shafiga is 44-year-old woman who owns a small booth in the Sabirabad bazaar. She has been selling women's and baby clothing for seven years. She would like to increase the inventory of her clothes and for this purpose she requests 1200 USD.

loans.use: Increase the inventory of her clothes

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Khatira

texts.en: Khatira is a 56 year old woman who sells undergarments in the central Sabirabad bazaar. She is married and has five children. She has ten years of experience in this field and this business is the only source of income for her family. She tries very hard to cover her family needs and she works from early morning until late at night. She would like to expand and diversify the number of product sshe sells and has applied for a 1200 USD loan

loans.use: Expansion and diversification of products for sale

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Saedet

texts.en: Saedet is 44-year-old woman who sells wedding dresses and wedding accessories in her own store located in the Sabirabad region. She has seven years of experience in this field. Her store is always full of customers and she Is not just a trader but a master of style. As spring is high season for wedding parties,  she would like to purchase more dresses because she knows that it will be the perfect time to increase her income. She has already saved some earnings and she needs an additional 1200 USD to achieve her goals.

loans.use: Purchasing more wedding dresses for her shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Madalena Elias Tembe

texts.pt:
Madalena Elias Tembe L., 37, is a widow who lives with her three children in the neighborhood of Moamba- Maputo, Mozambique. She joined the credit program in 2007 in is on her 2nd loan cycle. She sells big bags of charcoal at the Malhapsene market. She plans to use the loan to improve her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Madalena Elias Tembe L., portadora do BI nº 110517348W, residente na Moamba Corrumane, Viuva tem 3 folhos , nascida a 05-06-70 entrou no programa tomando o valor de 6000 mt vai mater tomdondo novamente o valor de 6000 a pagar em 5 meses esta no 2º ciclo vende peixe e carvão o peixe vende em malhapsene e o carvão ela vende em sacos. com o valor vai aumentar o negocio

loans.use: To improve charcoal business

loans.name: Sujayet

texts.en: Sujayet is 43-year-old trader who owns a small store from which she sells clothes and underwear. She imports her quality goods from Russia. She is married and has two children. Sujayet would like to expand her business and applies for a 1000 USD loan.

loans.use: Expansion of her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Aqroinvest Credit Union - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Relina Vasco Cumbe

texts.pt:
Relina Vasco Cumbi, 44, lives with her husband and 8 children in Maputo, Mozambique. She just joined the credit program and plans to use her first loan to improve her poultry-breeding business.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva volunteer.

Relina Vasco Cumbi B. , portadora do BI nº 110103199Z, casada com 9 filhos os quais faleceu 1 este é o primeiro ciclo dela vai tomar o valor de 6000 mt a pagar em 4 meses ela faz crianção de galinhas com o valor vai aumentar o negocio tem o seu negocio na Machava nascida a 30-12-1963.

loans.use: Improvement of poultry-breeding business

loans.name: Helena  Jeremias

texts.pt:
Helena Jeremias G., 48, lives with her husband and 4 children in the neighborhood of Machava, in Maputo, Mozambique. She joined the credit program in 2006 an is now on her 4th loan cycle. She sells eggs, cooking oil, yogurt and other food products from home, and also delivers to clients. She plans to use her loan to increase her stock and expand the business.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva volunteer.

Helena Jeremias G. potadora do Bi 100152397R vive maritalmente tenm 4 filhos nascida a 17-12-1959, residente no bairro da Machava, entrou no programa a 21-02-06 tomou 6000 mt agora esta no 4º vai tomar 12000 mt pagar em 8 meses , vende ovos ,oleo yogurte palone faz entrega aos clientes com o valor vai aumentar o negocio.

loans.use: stock increase

loans.name: Wajibika A Group

texts.en:
Suzana, age 32, is married with 2 children (ages 5 and 12). She is a hair dresser and owns a beauty salon, which she started in 2001. Each day, she works from 8am to 9pm and in one month she can make a profit of about $230.

Suzana and her subgroup request a loan to expand their businesses. Suzana's subgroup members have businesses dealing in selling food and clothing.

loans.use: To expand business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en: Tabu, age 28, lives with her parents and supports her 3 year old child with her cafe business. She started this food vending business in 2006 and now makes a monthly profit of about $160. Each day, Tabu works from 7am to noon, serving a variety of breakfast snacks. Tabu now requests a loan to buy more food stock to increase her cafe's business.

loans.use: To buy food stock for cafe

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Happiness

texts.en: Happiness, age 22, lives with her husband. She has a business of selling clothes which she started in 2005. She works daily from 8am to 4pm and makes a monthly profit of about $165. Happiness is requesting a loan to buy more clothing for her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing stock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en: Fatma is 48 years old and is married with 5 children between the ages of 17 and 30. Fatma is a food vendor and began this business in 1998. Each day, Fatma works selling breakfast snacks from 6am to noon and makes a monthly profit of about $40. Her hope is that a loan will help her provide more  options and better service for her customers.

loans.use: To buy food stock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mapatano A Group

texts.en:
Bahati, age 27, lives with her parents and takes care of her 2 sons (ages 3 and 7). She has a retail business of selling cosmetics products. She began this business March 2006 and now she makes a monthly profit of about $280. She works from 11am to 6pm daily.

Bahati and her subgroup request a loan to expand their businesses. Bahati's fellow subgroup members have businesses in tailoring, quarry work, selling charcoal, and soft drinks.

loans.use: Buy more inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Azimio A Group

texts.en: Rehema, age 45, is divorced with 4 children between the ages of 1 and 14. Her business is selling pancakes and used clothing. She began this business in 1993. She works from 5am to noon daily and makes a monthly profit of around $90. She and her fellow subgroup member (also selling clothing)request a loan to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To expand businesses

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Witness Chota

texts.en: Witness, age 35, is married and has a toddler. She works as a food vendor, which she began doing in 2006. Each day, she sells food from 6am to 10pm and she makes a monthly profit of around $410. She now requests a loan to buy more food stock in order to increase her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Xuan Thi

texts.vi:
Mr. Thi, 48 years old, is an active person. Besides his main activity of making tofu, he also raises a few pigs and offers a service of rice processing for farmers in the area. Incomes from many occupations keep the family’s economy stable. His wife sells tofu and helps him tend those pigs and process rice. He would like to take out a loan to buy bean and feed for his pigs. He prefers loan with weekly repayments because it make him conscious about spending and saving.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


AnhThi 48 tuổi, là người rất năng động trong việc làm. Anh chủ yếu kiếm sống bằng nghề làm đậu phụ để bán. Ngoài ra, anh còn nuôi lợn và xay xát gạo thuê. Nhờ có nhiều nghề nên kinh tế gia đình rất ổn định. Vợ anh hàng ngày đi bán đậu và thời gian còn lại thì cùng chồng nhận xay xát gạo và nuôi lợn. Anh dự định vay vốn để mua thêm đỗ về làm đậu và mua cám cho lợn. Anh rất thích hình thức vay vốn hoàn trả theo tuần vì nó giúp anh có ý thức hơn trong chi tiêu và tiết kiệm.

loans.use: To purchase bean for making bean curd and feed for pigs

loans.name: Hekima_A Group

texts.en:
Hadija, age 40, is married with a 9-year-old boy. She also lives with her 80 year old mother, who she takes care of. She has a business of selling charcoal near their home, which she began in March 2006. Each day, she sells charcoal from 6am to 6pm and she makes a monthly profit of about $70 a month.

She now requests a loan to rent a charcoal store in order to increase her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in recycling plastic bottles and selling food.

loans.use: To rent a charcoal store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Thi Bac

texts.vi:
Mrs. Bắc, 33 years old, has 2 children. Both are in school. While her husband works as a construction worker and a general laborer she tends a small general store at home and raises a few pigs. The modest income keeps her family’s economy stable. She is happy to be eligible to take out a loan. Weekly repayments fit her financial situation well. Se hopes to get the loan soon.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Bắc 33 tuổi, chị có 2 con đang đi học. Chồng chị là thợ xây và chủ yếu là làm thuê tại làng. Chị ở nhà vừa bán hàng tạp hoá, vừa chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập của chị tuy ít ỏi nhưng cũng ổn định. Chị rất vui mừng khi được tham gia vay vốn vì chị có thêm vốn để hỗ trợ cho chăn nuôi. Chị thây hình thức hoàn trả theo tuần rất phù hợp với gia đình và mong sớm nhận được vốn vay.

loans.use: To purchase food for pig

loans.name: Dafrosa

texts.en: Dafrosa, age 33, is married with a 4-year-old child. She also lives with her sister and her kids. Dafrosa has a business of selling traditional alcohol, which she began doing in 2005. She makes about $85 a month, and works from 11am to 7pm daily. She hopes for a loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mapatano B Group

texts.en: Grace, age 23, is married with one child (age 1 yr 7 months). She owns a tailoring business where she also sells laundry soap and fabrics. She began this business in 2002 and now makes a monthly profit of about $95. She works from 7am to 7pm daily. She now requests a loan to increase her business, which she will share with her subgroup member Agripina (a shopkeeper). Grace hopes to one day buy modern sewing machines for her business.

loans.use: To buy stock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Mapatano A Group

texts.en: Grace, age 23, is married with one child (age 1 yr 7 month). She owns a tailoring business where she also sells laundry soap and fabrics. She began this business in 2002 and now makes a monthly profit of about $95 from this business. She works from 7am to 7pm daily. She now hopes for a loan to increase her business, which she will share with her subgroup member Agripina (a shopkeeper). Grace hopes to one day buy modern sewing machines for her business.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Muhbira

texts.en: Muhbira, one of the active clients of Microinvest, became our client in 2006 and has proven herself as an accurate client and responsible person. She is a good seller and has enough experience as she has been in trade for over 7 years. She is divorced and is raising her one daughter, and her mother is helping her. Her business is located in the central market in Panjshanbe, Khujand. She buys her assortment from China from her dear friend Matluba, who helped her to open her trade place and told her about Microinvest. When she heard about the KIVA program, she wished to receive a loan for business expansion. Today Muhbira does all her best to create a good standard of living for her lovely daughter. She hopes to provide her daughter with an education and try to develop her business.

loans.use: To buy modern children's clothes

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary, age 30, is married with 2 children, ages 10 years and 1 month old. Her 23-year-old sister also lives with them. Mary owns a grocery shop where she sells beer. She started this business in 2006 and now she makes a monthly profit of about $135 from her sales. The shop is open from 10am to 10pm daily. Mary hopes for a loan to buy more beer to increase her profit.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Hakim

texts.ru:
Hakim U. has been selling nuts, garlic, potatoes, turnips and fruit vinegar (circo) for 28 years. He has been a MicroInvest borrower since 2002 and has shown himself to be a responsible borrower. Hakim learned about MicroInvest from a loan officer. Due to the loan he was able to increase his purchases from wholesalers and increase his profits. Sometimes he travels to Uzbekistan and Kyrgyzstan to purchase products.

Hakim is a family man and has 3 children. His son helps him in his business. In the future he plans to pass on his business to his son. Hakim will use his Kiva loan to expand his inventory and support his fast product turnover.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Умаров Хаким, продает орехи, чеснок, картошку, репку и фруктовый уксус. (сирко) на протяжении 28 лет.В Микроинвесте он кредитуется с 2002 года и проявил себя как ответственный плательшик. О нашей организации услышал от займового офицера.Благодаря кредитам он смог закупать больше товара у оптавиков и соответственно иметь большую прибыль. Иногда он сам ездить за товаром в Узбекистан и Киргизистан. Он человек семейный и имеет 3 детей.Сын помогает по бизнесу. В будушем он прланирует передать совй бизнес сыну. На займ с КИВЫ он хочет увеличить объём товара потомучто сейчас он имеет быстрый оборот.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Upendo

texts.en: Upendo (Swahili for "love") is a 30 year-old widow who runs a cafe in order to support herself and her 2 children (ages 12 and 15). She started this cafe in 2003 and now makes a profit of about $55 a month. There, she serves lunch and dinner and works from 10am to 10pm daily. She requests a loan to increase her food stock and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food stock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Agness

texts.en: Agness, age 20, is married with 2 children, ages 3 and 6. She has a business selling fruits which she started 6 months ago. She sells fruits from 1pm to 9pm daily and now makes a monthly profit of about $80. She requests a loan to buy more fruit stock.

loans.use: To buy fruit inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Ushirika_A Group

texts.en:
Adela, age 39, is divorced with 3 children, ages 17, 16, and 11. She also takes care of two other children, ages 7 and 9. Adela started a clothing business in 2003 and a cow grazing business in 2001. She works from 6am to 5pm daily. From both of her businesses, she earns a monthly profit of about $78.

In the past, Adela took a loan from BRAC Tanzania to enhance her businesses. She now requests a new loan for the same purpose by buying more inventory. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Janeth, who owns a shop.

loans.use: To buy clothing

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Keko Bora A Group

texts.en:
Federica, age 37, is single and owns a poultry business. She started this in 1985 and works from 5am to 6pm daily. She currently makes a monthly profit of about $430 from this business.

In the past, Federica took out a loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Having paid this back successfully, she now requests a new loan for the same purpose by buying broiler chickens to raise and sell. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Wema, who is a shopkeeper.

loans.use: To buy broiler chickens

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema, age 50, is a widow with 6 children ages 35, 25, 18, 16, 15, and 12. She owns a business of selling clothes and beverages, which she began in 1989. From these sales, she makes a monthly profit of about $55. She works daily from 8am to 8pm.

Rehema has taken a previous loan from BRAC Tanzania. She requests a new loan in order to buy more inventory of clothes and beverages.

loans.use: To buy clothing and beverage inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Tanzania - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Mrs. Julia O. A. is a 43-year-old mother of six school age children who are studying in a humble educational center in their city. For this reason, her goal is to keep working hard so that her children can finish their studies and follow their plans. For many years, Julia has been selling candy in a small stand as her means of support. Although the father of her children walked out over seven years ago, he continues to help with the family expenses in order to support his wife. Julia has the goal of improving and broadening her business by selling liquor in the city of Pichanaki, thus creating a sustainable business that will last for a long time. In order to reach this goal, she needs a loan to invest into this project. With your help, you will make her goals possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Julia, de 43 años de edad, tiene seis hijos que aún están estudiando en un modesto centro educativo de su ciudad, debido a esta razón su propósito es seguir esforzándose a fin de que sus hijos terminen sus estudios satisfactoriamente y cumplan sus metas trazadas. Julia se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a la venta de dulces en un pequeño kiosco para incrementar su sustento económico, el padre de sus hijos se marchó hace más de siete años, pero está pendiente de los gastos y deacuerdo con todas las decisiones de su esposa a fin de apoyarla.Julia tiene un propósito, mejorar e implementar su negocio para también incursionar en la venta de licores en la ciudad de Pichanaki con el objetivo de tener un negocio sostenible en el tiempo. Para este fin requiere de un capital de inversión para encaminar este proyecto. Con tu ayuda posibilitarás el alcance de su objetivo.

loans.use: Invest in merchandise to increase sales

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Dedicated to her small coffee, citrus, and banana plantation, Mrs. Marisol P. makes the best effort to provide an education for her seven children. This noble mother regrets not having the financial means to offer her children higher education because she has obligated three of her eldest children to help out by working on the farm and taking care of the younger children. However, she does not lose the hope of being able to provide an education for her younger children, who will soon conclude their school year in an educational center in their humble community. For this reason, Marisol wishes to have your support, so that she can invest the loan into her plantation and increase production. We are counting on your generous cooperation so that we may grant this family a little ray of hope.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Dedicada a su chacra de café cítricos y plátanos, doña Marisol, se esfuerza al máximo por educar a sus siete hijos, de los cuales los tres mayores la apoyan en la chacra; esta noble madre lamenta no tener la capacidad adquisitiva para ofrecer a sus hijos una educación superior ya que la necesidad ha obligado a sus hijos mayores a apoyar a su madre y cuidar a sus hermanos.No pierde las esperanzas de educar a sus pequeños hijos que están pronto a culminar su año académico en un centro educativo de su humilde comunidad. .Motivo por el cual, Marisol, desea vuestro apoyo para invertir el dinero que solicita en sus terrenos de cultivo a fin de incrementar su producción.Contamos con su gentil colaboración para poder otorgarle un rayito de esperanza a esta familia.

loans.use: Increase production

loans.name: Amancio

texts.es:
Amancio is 50 years old. He works hard in his small farm of fruits, which for a long time has become the main source of income to provide for his beloved children. The responsibility to fulfill the rolls of father and mother in his home was very difficult . When he was told that he was going to have his first baby he was very happy and he has been since then.

His children are his motivation to keep working hard in obtaining every time better fruits in his harvest. Amancio’s new goal to start in the coffee production, since he did a business research and found out that the investment of the other families members of his community has been very profitable. He ask for your support to reach his desire to continue working for the well-being of his four beloved children. He ask for $525 that will pay off in six months.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva volunteer.

Amancio a sus 50 años, trabaja fervientemente en su chacra de frutas, la cual desde hace mucho tiempo se ha convertido en la principal fuente ingresos económicos para sus queridos hijos, la responsabilidad de cumplir los roles de padre y madre en su hogar era muy dificultoso pero no imposible ya que desde que le informaron que iba a tener su primer bebé estuvo muy feliz por la buena.La retribución diaria de sus hijos a través del inmenso cariño que le manifiesta impulsa a Amancio a seguir trabajando como hasta ahora para obtener cada vez mejores frutos en su cosecha y además para plantearse el nuevo reto de su incursión en la producción de café ya que durante meses realizo un estudio y se dio cuenta que la inversión de las otras familias miembros de su comunidad ha sido muy rentable..Requiere de vuestro apoyo para alcanzar su deseo con el deseo de seguir trabajando para bienestar de sus cuatro queridos hijos.

loans.use: Expand and capitalize his business

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Trinidad’s hard work in her grocery and beverage shop has until recently helped her satisfy the day-to-day needs of her four beloved children, who attend primary and secondary school in their dear city. Now, however, she has a shortage of goods, and the wide selection of products that she used to offer has greatly diminished. These circumstances seriously trouble Trinidad, who has already multiplied her efforts without any success. She needs a loan to invest it into her small shop. She hopes that you collaborate with her request, promising to administer the loan carefully. We are counting on your cooperation to help this family move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

El arduo trabajo de Trinidad en su bodega y en la venta de bebidas le han ayudado hasta el día de hoy a satisfacer las necesidades de sus cuatro queridos hijos, quienes cursan estudios primarios y secundarios en los modestos centros de formación de su querida ciudad. Hoy su tienda tiene un déficit y la mercadería tan variada que ofertaba ha disminuido en gran porcentaje, esta situación tiene muy preocupada a Trinidad quien ya ha multiplicado sus esfuerzos y trabajo sin éxito alguno.Requiere de capital para invertirlo en su pequeña bodega, ella espera que usted colabore con su pedido y se compromete a administrarlo de la mejor manera. Contamos con vuestra colaboración para el progreso de esta familia.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Eni Luz

texts.es:
Eni is a sweet teacher who has, along with her dear husband, been imparting her knowledge to students in a small educational center in her community. Besides teaching, she sells ice in the evenings, thanks to the help of an icemaker she was able to obtain after much hard work. Years ago, she and her husband dedicated themselves solely to teaching children in their community for a living, but after the arrival of their own beloved children, their expenses increased considerably. Because of these events, they thought that starting an ice-making business would be quite lucrative in their city with its hot climate. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase an additional ice maker, so that they can meet the demands of their new customers. Eni’s family awaits your generous help.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Eni, es una dulce profesora que imparte sus conocimientos en un pequeño centro educativo de su comunidad, en compañía de su querido esposo, además de su desempeño en esta actividad por las tardes se dedica a ofertar hielo a sus clientes gracias a una máquina que obtuvo a base de mucho esfuerzo.Años atrás ella y su esposo se dedicaron únicamente a impartir sus conocimientos a los niños de su comunidad, hasta que hubo tiempos en los que los gastos se incrementaron considerablemente debido a la llegada de sus dos queridos hijos; por esta razón pensaron que poner un negocio con este servicio sería muy rentable debido al caluroso clima de su ciudad.Su petición atiende a la necesidad de adquirir una máquina más a fin de abastecer los pedidos de sus nuevos clientes, quienes a recomendación de sus vecinos vienen acercándose con una enorme lista de peticiones.La familia de Eni espera vuestra generosa ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase an additional ice maker

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Ever since he was young, Juan had the courage to push forward and pave his way through life. Now that he has his own family, he wishes to offer them the best and grant them financial stability. For this reason, he gets up very early every morning, and makes his way to his shop where he cheerfully works as a carpenter. One morning, Juan left his home determined to distribute the shelves that he so eagerly prepared for a school in his community. He placed them in a delivery truck and decided to ride along with them so that he could show his appreciation to the principal for having appointed him to the project. While on the road, they encountered a huge bog that caused an accident and destroyed a month’s worth of Juan’s work. The monetary loss was considerable since he was forced to remake the shelves. From that moment on, Juan has struggled to reach the stability he and his family enjoyed before this unfortunate loss. Now he would like to purchase a machine to expedite his wood work so that he can restore his family’s financial status in a short period of time.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde joven Juan, tuvo los ánimos progresar a fin de abrirse camino por la vida y ahora que tiene una familia desea ofrecerles lo mejor y otorgarles estabilidad económica.Por esa razón todas las mañanas sale muy temprano rumbo a su taller de carpintería en el que se desempeña con mucha alegría. Una mañana de tantas en la vida de Juan se marchó de casa dispuesto a repartir los módulos que había preparado con mucho ahínco para un colegio de su comunidad, ingreso cada uno de ellos en el camión que los conduciría hasta su morada final y decidió marchar con ellos para agradecer y manifestar al director su agradecimiento por haberle encargado este proyecto. Mientras transitaban salió a su encuentro un inmenso lodazal que ocasionó un terrible accidente que destruyó el trabajo de un mes de Juan. La pérdida monetaria fue considerable ya que tuvo que volver a fabricar los módulos.Desde ese momento Juan esta luchando por alcanzar la estabilidad que tenían antes de la penosa pérdida. Hoy desea adquirir una máquina para agilizar la fabricación de artículos en madera a fin de alcanzar la recuperación económica de su familia dentro de poco tiempo.

loans.use: Purchase of wood working machinery

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz, is a sweet mother who works with much joy in her small warehouse, in wich she feels very happy. Her work helps her to forget the painful memories of being abandoned by her mate. She started to sell groceries to educate her son and to resolve the expenses of her home. Luz lives in her mother’s house who is an old lady so she helps to take care of her as well.

Luz wants to expand her business and to stabilize her income so she can provide for her family. She is asking for a loan of $350 that she will pay off in six months.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva volunteer.

Luz, es una dulce madre que se desempeña con mucha alegría en su pequeña bodega, en ella se siente muy feliz y su labor en este lugar le ha hecho olvidar los recuerdos dolorosos que le dejó el abandono de su pareja.Ella empezó a dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes para educar a su hijo y solventar los gastos de su hogar; teniendo en cuenta que se fue a vivir a la casa de su madre ya anciana también vela por el bienestar de ella..El deseo por aumentar su negocio y por estabilizar su nivel de ingreso son los planes que la motivan. Por esta razón solicita vuestra ayuda a fin de alcanzar la suma que solicita para poner en marcha cada uno de sus proyectos en bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Capitalize her business.

loans.name: Reimundo

texts.es:
Reimundo offers copy services in his community with the help of a small copy machine that he acquired three years ago. He set aside a small area in his home to provide his services and satisfy his customer’s needs. This business is his beloved family’s main source of income, so he would like to buy a new copy machine in order to increase his revenue. After the passing of his wife, his household has endured great hardships. The purchase of a copy machine, along with a substantial source of income, would be the best ways in which to give shelter to his daughter, with the aim of showing her how to value the hard work that she will carry out in her father’s company. This work tool will bring tranquility and well-being to their home. Let’s make his request possible.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Reimundo, se dedica a brindar servicios de fotocopias en su comunidad con la ayuda de una pequeña máquina que adquirió hace tres años, para este fin instaló en su domicilio un espacio y adecuó el mismo para satisfacer los requerimientos de sus clientes. Este negocio es la fuente principal de ingresos de su querida familia y desea comprar una fotocopiadora moderna para incrementar sus ingresos; debido a que a partir de la muerte de su esposa atravesaron grandes declives en el interior de su hogar. La compra de una fotocopiadota además de una sustancial fuente de ingreso sería la forma de mantener a sus hija a buen recaudo con el objetivo de enseñarle a valorar el trabajo que irá desempeñando en su compañía. Esta herramienta de trabajo le otorgará tranquilidad y bienestar a su hogar. Posibilitemos su petición.

loans.use: Purchase of additional copy machine

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 57 year-old Elizabeth M.. She is married with five children, aged 6, 7, 12, 14, and 18. In 2000 Elizabeth established a small shop selling general items, and now requests a loan of $350 in order to purchase additional supplies. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is an organization that is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania. Through leasing and leaseback, SELFINA provides a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. As they lack tangible collateral assets, they are termed not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment. The process is called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional supplies

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sero Lease and Finance Ltd. (SELFINA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Epasia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 46 year-old Epasia M.. She is married with four children, aged 6,16,18, and 23. In 2004 Epasia established a business selling fish, and now requests a loan of $350 in order to purchase additional stock. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is an organization that is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania. Through leasing and leaseback, SELFINA provides a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. As they lack tangible collateral assets, they are termed not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment. The process is called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of fish in bulk.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sero Lease and Finance Ltd. (SELFINA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es:
Since she was very young Roberta worked on a small farm, and now, along with her husband she works cultivating potatoes, corn and vegetables. When their crop comes in they transport it to the capital for sale. This activity has helped to pay the economic expenses of her family and to give an education to her five children, three of which have taken advantage of the opportunity provided and are today professionals working in the city of Lima. Thanks to them Roberta can transport their products to the capital. Nevertheless they are still responsible for the two smaller children, for which she and her husband continue to strive. She has found an opportunity to acquire a position in the market of Huaycan, where she could bring her products and by being there acquire a larger income. With this desire in mind she asks your consideration to receive them in your kind heart.

translated from Spanish by B, Kiva volunteer

Roberta desde muy niña trabajó en la chacra y ahora junto a su esposo se dedica al cultivo de papa, maíz y verduras, los cuales al llegar su cosecha son trasportados a la capital para su respectiva comercialización.Esta actividad le ha ayudado a solventar los gastos económicos de su familia y a brindarles educación a sus cinco hijos, tres de los cuales han aprovechado el esfuerzo de su abnegada madre y hoy son profesionales y radican en la ciudad de Lima. Gracias a ellos Roberta puede transportar sus productos a la capital.Sin embargo aun tiene a su responsabilidad a sus dos menores por los cuales ella y su esposo siguen esforzándose. Ha observado la posibilidad de adquirir un puesto en el mercado de Huaycan, a éste lugar podría llevar sus productos y por la misma demanda de la zona adquiriría mayores ingresos. Con este deseo en mente les extiende su solicitud a fin de se acogida en vuestro bondadoso corazón.

loans.use: To buy a place for selling in the market of Huaycan.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina, has always had a close relationship with her children and, now that they have set off on their own lives, she seeks to find her own path, although she misses them terribly. This grief she shares with her beloved husband, with whom she passes the most time possible, being dedicated to their agricultural work, in order to keep busy and, in this way, to reduce the sadness that she feels. In spite of not being close to her children, they are always on her mind and she tries to send them a small quantity of money at the end of each month in order to help them so that they can progress. In spite of her hard work, the crop of her products continues decreasing because she does not use mineral supplements, pesticides or adequate fertilizers that help to fight the insects and diseases and improve the quality of her products. In order to increase the quality and quantity of her products, she requests the aid of your noble heart to acquire the products that she lacks to obtain an excellent crop this season.

translated from Spanish by B, Kiva volunteer

Catalina, siempre tuvo una relación muy estrecha con sus hijos y ahora que estos han enrumbado sus vidas para buscar sus propios caminos, sufre por no tenerlos.Esta pena la comparte con su querido esposo, con quien pasa el mayor tiempo posible dedicándose a las laborea agrícolas a fin de mantenerse ocupada y aminorar de esta manera la pena que la inunda.Ella a pesar de no tener cerca a sus hijos siempre esta pendiente de ellos y trata de enviarles cada fin de mes una pequeña cantidad de dinero a fin de ayudarlos para que progresen..A pesar de sus inmensos esfuerzos la cosecha de sus productos sigue decreciendo debido a que no cuenta con abonos y fertilizantes adecuados que le ayuden a combatir las plagas y a elevar la calidad de los mismos. Con el fin de incrementar la calidad y cantidad de sus productos solicita la ayuda de tu noble corazón para adquirir los productos que le hacen falta para obtener una excelente cosecha esta temporada.

loans.use: To purchase mineral supplements, pesticides and fertilizer to increase the quantity and variety of her products.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda has, through time, learned to care for animals and to value the land that has fed her since she was very young. Since she was a girl she has maintained a close bond with the kindness of nature and she works with satisfaction in this area. She wants to increase the quantity of her lambs and the production of her lands. She would like to purchase a small house in the capital of her country in order to have a place where she can stay when she goes to market the products that she obtains from her arduous work. For this reason she requests your aid in order to obtain the amount that she needs to acquire a greater quantity of small animals and to increase the quality and quantity of her agricultural products.

translated from Spanish by B, Kiva volunteer

Aurora, a través del tiempo aprendió a querer a los animales y valorar la tierra que desD. muy niña la alimentó; ya que desD. niña mantuvo estrecha relación con las bondades D. la naturaleza y sus actividades las realiza con satisfacción en este rubro.Desea incrementar la cantidad D. sus carneritos y la producción D. sus tierras, para posibilitar el cumplimiento D. la compra D. una pequeña casita en la capital D. su país a fin D. tener un lugar donD. cobijarse cuando realice cada uno D. sus viajes para comercializar los productos que obtiene luego D. su arduo trabajo. Por esta razón recurre en tu ayuda a fin D. obtener la cantidad que necesita para adquirir mayor cantidad D. animalitos y acrecentar la calidad y cantidad D. sus productos agrícolas.

loans.use: To buy more lambs and to improve the quantity and quality of her agricultural products

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira has always maintained a close relationship with her community, Maco, the place in which she was born and grew up. Unfortunately, upon forming a family, she saw the great responsibility that she faced. Motivated by her husband's energy and dreams of getting ahead, she had to abandon her beloved home to settle down in a place with better possibilities of progress, with the hope of offering a better quality of life to their beloved children. Now in an area far away from her community, they grow potatoes and corn on large expanses of land, which they transport to the city of Tarma to sell wholsale. Elvira hopes to increase her economic income by opening a small grocery store in her home to meet certain unsatisfied needs. With the hope of obtaining this loan, she extends this petition to you.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Elvira, siempre ha mantenido una estrecha relación con su comunidad, Maco, lugar en el que nació y creció. Desafortunadamente al conformar su familia observó la gran responsabilidad que tenía que enfrentar y animada por el ímpetu y deseos de su superación de su querido esposo tuvo que abandonar su querida tierra para instalarse en un lugar con mayores posibilidades de progreso con el objetivo de brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus queridos hijos.Aún en las tierras de su alejada comunidad cultivan papa y maíz en grandes extensiones de cultivo para transportarlos hasta la ciudad de tarma y comercializarlos al por mayor.Elvira, desea acrecentar sus ingresos económicos aperturando una pequeña bodega en su domicilio para apaciguar de alguna manera ciertas necesidades insatisfechas.Con el deseo de obtener la cantidad que solicita les extiende su petición.

loans.use: To start a small grocery store to increase the economic income of her home.

loans.name: Crecia

texts.es:
A characteristic of Mrs Crecia, is the dedication that she brings to her work, as much in the cultivation of her land, as in the breeding of Guinea pigs, thanks to which she earns enough income to satisfy the needs of her home. Some climatic factors damaged her sown fields last year and, on account of this fact, she had large losses. Nevertheless she still maintains that enthusiasm and takes care to make the next crop even more profitable. Crecia is very determined at the moment to set goals and, in spite of the fact that she now also works breeding Guinea pigs, she needs to prepare her land for cultivation. To once more take up her work as a farmer and to work her lands, she requests the aid of your noble heart.

translated from Spanish by B, Kiva volunteer

Una característica de doña Crecia, es la dedicación que le otorga a sus labores, tanto en sus terrenos de cultivo, como en la crianza de cuyes, gracias a las cuales obtiene ingresos económicos para satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar.Algunos factores climáticos perjudicaron sus sembríos el año pasado y a causa de este hecho tuvo grandes pérdidas. Sin embargo aún mantiene ese entusiasmo y esmero para hacer de la próxima cosecha una de las más rentables.Crecia es muy decidida al momento de plantearse metas y a pesar de dedicarse por ahora a la crianza de cuyes, tiene la necesidad de producir sus terrenos de cultivo. Para retomar sus labores como agricultora y trabajar en sus terrenos, solicita la ayuda de vuestro noble corazón.

loans.use: To prepare land for cultivation

loans.name: Chiku

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 40-year-old Chiku M.. She is married with no children. In 2002 Chiku established a grain and charcoal business, and now requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. 

Charcoal--small black and dirty pieces of dry earth--are important not just to charcoal sellers but to their customers, who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of rice, beans, and charcoal in bulk.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sero Lease and Finance Ltd. (SELFINA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 44-year-old Asia K.. She is married with four children, ages 9,18, 20, and 25. In 2004 Asia established a grain, clothing, and general retail business, and now requests a loan of $875 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is an organization that is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania. Through leasing and leaseback, SELFINA provides a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. As they lack tangible collateral assets, they are termed not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment. The process is called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of grain and clothing in bulk.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sero Lease and Finance Ltd. (SELFINA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Delila

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 30-year-old Delila M.. She is single with no children. In 2007 Delila established a livestock business. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA and now requests a loan of $525 in order to purchase additional chickens.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. In fact, if you are a regular lender on kiva.org, you may be tired of reading about kuku! "Who or what are kuku?" you may ask. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. 

First, they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two and either add to them as you go or wait for them to multiple naturally! Second, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Third, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein. I’m sure there are hundreds of other reasons why raising kuku is so popular (maybe they are friendlier than other animals? Prettier?), but this is all time and space will allow.

loans.use: To purchase additional chicks to raise and sell.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sero Lease and Finance Ltd. (SELFINA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Jenifa

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 26-year-old Jenifa M.. She is married with two children, ages 1 and 12. In 2006 Jenifa established a clothing business and now requests a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional clothing in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is an organization that is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania. Through leasing and leaseback, SELFINA provides a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. As they lack tangible collateral assets, they are termed not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from that client, extends a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment. The process is called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothing in bulk.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sero Lease and Finance Ltd. (SELFINA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 56-year-old Mwanamkuu N.. She is single with six children, ages 18 to 35. In 2006 Mwanamkuu established a soft drinks business and now requests a loan of $350 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. 

It is said that Coca Cola is one of the most recognized symbols or ‘words’ in the world. And it’s true. Even in the most remote villages in Africa there is usually some kind of ‘bar’ selling Coke, Fanta, and Guinness (Pepsi has made it to most African capitals but not to the sticks, but I’m sure they’re working on it!). The hot weather makes soft drinks all the more appealing; a very cheap marketing tool! All of which explains why selling soft drinks is such a popular venture, whether you’re the CEO of Coca Cola Ltd in the United States or a micro-entrepreneur in Tanzania!

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of soft drinks in bulk.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sero Lease and Finance Ltd. (SELFINA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam! This is 25-year-old Angela M.. She is married with one child, aged 3. In 1998 Angela established a vegetable business. Angela has already received and successfully repaid three loans from SELFINA, and now requests a loan of $1050 in order to purchase additional stocks of onions, tomatoes, and potatoes in bulk. 

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop or stall is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people usually send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.
